Summary Heading: Some of the best views in Laguna for less money!
Summary: The views from most of the rooms are outstanding!  We had one of the best ever with full windows on 3 sides of the main room and a huge, totally private deck with full views on all sides too‚Ä¶beautiful all day no matter the weather and especially the sunsets!  Enjoyed watching the surfers and gazing at Catalina Island.  Outstanding staff too.  Wish we lived closer so we could visit again soon.

Does it need to be updated - yes.  But it's a coastal funky old hotel so just know that.  It is hard to beat the ocean view and the neighborhood.  The price was reasonable for what else is in the area.  The room had a mini fridge and microwave.  The bed was okay, but i am not picky.  There was not much for parking but they did have a valet.  The main reason I gave it 4 stars was because the location.

We enjoyed this vintage suite with unbeatable beach views and helpful, friendly staff. We enjoyed the sound of the waves in every room. Great restaurants, shops, and a grocery store are all within walking distance. It was a birthday weekend I will never forget and we will be back. We loved our stay.

Summary Heading: The extra charges make it not worth it
Summary: WE have been coming here for 42 years 3-4 times a year.   Now they charge $38/night for parking , $25 a day for wifi, and no breakfast.  Had we have known this in advance we would not have come.  Plus they now allow pets and our room smells like dog urine.  This was the best kept secret of Laguna Beach for 50 years and now the new owners have ruined it.
Room tip: They charge a ridiculous amount for parking and wifi and breakfast is no longer included

Summary: Juanita and Micaela and all the staff of Laguna Rivera were excellent‚Ä¶from start to finish they made a family visit amazing from chaises and umbrellas on the beach to the live guitar music at sunset! A true gem and amazing view!
Manager Response: Whitney, We are just so pleased to read this feedback and can't thank you enough for your kind words. Family Time is the most important thing to us and we are so warmed to know we made this time special for you and yours. We look forward to hosting you again in the very near future. Thank you again!

Summary: The rooms were clean and spacious. Close to restaurants and grocery store. Downtown is a quick free trolley ride away.  Friendly and helpful staff. Bonus beach chairs set up for us on the beach! ‚òÄÔ∏è‚òÄÔ∏è‚òÄÔ∏è
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and for providing us this wonderful feedback. It was our true pleasure to have you and we all look forward to hosting your next trip to Laguna Beach.

Summary: We decided to stay at the Laguna Rivera and it didn‚Äôt disappoint! What makes this place so wonderful is the staff and the hospitality. Diana got us checked in and made sure we were accommodated. One our favorite moments was Friday evening where the hotel host their guest to wine and music. Picture this, while watching the sunset you are listening to acoustic paired with wine and every melody gives you chills. yes, please! Michael (singer) has the most beautiful voice, he even sang ‚ÄúBaby Shark‚Äù for our 4yr son to which got us all dancing. Mr. John was so kind my our son‚ù§Ô∏è Every time  we ran into him. Everything about this Friday evening was amazing! We hanged out by the beach all Saturday, we walked to restaurants/shops and took the trolley around the city for scenery and we
Manager Response: We love this so much! Thank you once more for staying with us and taking the time to provide us kind words on our team and your experience. It is our goal that every guest leaves as happy as you all did and gives us such joy to read. Until next time, be well!

Summary: Really enjoyed this hotel. Has a cool California vibe to it. Staff was friendly & helpful. They give beach chairs, umbrellas, towel, even had boogie boards free to use on the beach. Beach is very clean in a very good location. Pool /Hot tub was cleaned everyday. Good size on both. You can walk to lagunas main beach within mins from the hotel beach. Grocery store, restaurants, shops, gas all in close range. Trolleys take you where you need to be in summer. There is a stop right in front of the hotel. Last but not least the valet parking is super convenient. Ethan & Daiki were true professionals, super courteous, polite, had awesome attitudes, and very attentive. They made us feel safe leaving our car at laguna Rivera. Was a great place to get away for the day to day!

Summary Heading: The people are the real win here. The hotel location is great, but the people are betterr
Summary: Juanita at the desk has been unbelievable! Always pleasant, patient and super responsive. I have stayed at many 5 star resorts that don't have front desk people of her caliber. The Valets are also very spot on. I am currently staying at the Riviera, and the hotel location is perfect. The hotel needs a bit of love.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful feedback, and for spotlighting our dear Juanita! We look forward to hosting you again.

Summary Heading: Used to be Great, Now an Overpriced DUMP!
Summary: For years, my family loved coming here. Nothing fancy, just clean, comfortable rooms with spectacular views, complimentary breakfast bags, and free parking.   Hah! Just arrived after 3 years away, to find none of that. No breakfast, $38/day parking, tap water from such filthy pipes that it reeked of rotten eggs, an unspeakable shower, and a deck furnished with the most uncomfortable chairs and no umbrellas to shield you from the sun. We all know it‚Äôs getting hotter, even by the beach. Do the rooms come with ceiling fans? No. They provide you with a small fan ‚Äútower‚Äù that only cools the person directly in front of it.  We used to love it. Never again.
Manager Response: Robin, On behalf of our team, I am very disheartened to hear of your unpleasant experience. The Laguna Riviera signifies 75 years of tradition of warmth and compassionate service. We are doing our best to transition poorly executed aspects such as the breakfast of the past to a professionally executed, service focused experience. We thank you very much for your business this trip, and we wish you well for the future.

Summary: This was definitely an awesome experience! Staff is really friendly, Juanita went an extra mile to show me around. My room was clean, and well kept. There is valet parking and it‚Äôs $38 a night but it‚Äôs so worth it because you don‚Äôt need to move your car, everything is walking distance. 3/4 min walk to the resultant ‚ÄúCliff‚Äù with an ocean view. Easy access to the beach, they provide you regular and pool chairs and cutest umbrella. I sat at the beach for hours soaking everything in. I felt so relax with no worries on this stay.   I love everything about this hotel! Easy access to Everything. The balconies views are amazing. Laguna is so beautiful.   Also visited their sister hotel Seven4One, that another relaxing quiet gem.
Manager Response: We are so overjoyed to read this feedback and to hear you soaked up everything we have to offer. We will continue to raise the bar as we transition the hotel over the next few years. We look forward to hosting you and yours again!

Summary: I liked my stay here. I stayed with my parents for 3 days. We booked an ocean view suite with a private balcony. We got the living room ocean view, but not the bedroom sadly. We didn‚Äôt get a private balcony but it wasn‚Äôt a big deal to us. The parking was pricey. They did not restock towels and soap often enough. The floor didn‚Äôt get cleaned often either, especially under the sofa bed. There were a few great things about this hotel though. First off, it‚Äôs location was nice and there were a lot of shops in walking distance. The beach was nice and clean, although it is a steep walk down. The pool and hot tub were nice but I wish they stayed opened until midnight because most of the days we didn‚Äôt get back to the hotel until late and didn‚Äôt have much time in the pool and hot tub.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. I truly appreciate your candor and honesty. We have zero bugs, and we do in fact pride ourselves on the most helpful and genuine service team in all of Laguna Beach. Our greatest priority is ensuring our guests are well cared for and enjoy their time with us. That's why we do what we do!  We have noted your detailed feedback, we appreciate it, and we plan to work diligently to ensure the things that did go wrong are corrected.

Summary: The hotel concierge, Dianna, was incredibly kind, took extra time to show us around the property, and helped us to organize an extra night with very little notice. All hotel staff were friendly and extremely helpful, and Dianna really went the extra mile to help make our stay excellent!
Manager Response: This makes us extremely happy to hear! I will make sure to share this with Diana. Our goal above all else is to provide a genuine care for our guests and their needs, and it warms my heart to hear Diana did this and made your experience what it was. Thank you so much for taking the time to share this. We look forward to having you again!

Summary: The employees are extremely nice.  I feel bad that people are spending their hard-earned money to stay here.  One of the employees mentioned they are "pre-renovation." I do not want to know what they charge "post-renovation."  1. View.  Yup, very nice.  2. Room.  Horrible.  We slept on foam (seriously; see photos).  The room had hairs in the sink.  The door was cracked and damaged at the bottom.  There was rust in the closet.  The toilet ran incessantly, and we had to lift the lid to get it to reload.  The remote control was taped over.  It was dingy and gross.  Please see the attached photos.    3. Pool.  We had called beforehand to inquire about the pool and told it was heated and open.  The pool was not heated.  I know pool temperatures and can tell when the heat is off; I
Manager Response: We truly regret to hear that your experience at our resort fell short of your expectations, and we sincerely apologize. We are glad you let us know of these shortcomings and we are eager to correct each and every issue, and resolve them for the future. We have taken all of these comments to heart and shared them with our leadership team in an effort to provide coaching. Thank you for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Unique and Charming Beach Hotel - Excellent Service
Summary: Laguna Riviera was an ideal place for our family reunion/birthday gathering.  I loved this very unique property with many outdoor spaces with amazing views.   Excellent and professional staff were all very helpful.  Special thanks to Danielle!  She helped make our experience perfect.
Manager Response: Michael, Thank you for taking the time to provide us with absolutely glowing feedback! We have shared this with Danielle also and we can tell you that you have put a smile on her face. We truly look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This is a great place for a family to visit and hang out. The hospitality of the staff (especially Kyle and Juanita) make this a place you want to come back to again and again. We have been staying here and only here for almost 20 years. Each room is so different and it‚Äôs nice to be able to pick exactly which room you want. This is not a standard block hotel. This place is as unique as Laguna Beach is. We will be back in a few months!

I used the hotel website to book our reservation and paid for a 12 pm early check-in. When we arrived, the young girl at the desk told us the room wasn't ready, she was refunding our early check-in fee; they don't allow early check-in; and that we should hang out in town; and that the room should be ready by 2:00-2:30. I explained to her that I specifically requested early checkin because we had dinner reservations at 4:30 and wanted to shower and get ready, and that a 4:00 pm wouldn't give us the time needed; to which she repeated her comments about not allowing anyone to check in before 4 pm but come back at 2:00 and they would have housekeeping clean our rom as soon as possible. When we came back at 2:00 she told us it still wasn't ready, and became very condescending,
Manager Response: Jane, I wanted to personally reach out and thank you for staying with us, and even more so for providing us feedback. We agree that the "early-check in" option was not clear that it was based on availability and because this hotel sells out almost every night it's unfair to even offer. We have removed this feature from our website due to your feedback, so thank you again. We apologize once more for the inconvenience this caused you to start your vacation.

Summary: I booked 2 nights for my wedding anniversary and this visit exceeded all our expectations!!! Wow! We were met with such an amazing staff. From the super sweet note and flowers, to the welcome champagne and spectacular views‚Äî everything was just perfect! We already miss the ocean! Thank you, Diana for making our stay truly memorable. We can‚Äôt wait to book our next staycation here!!!
Manager Response: Such a pleasure to have you all choose us to celebrate your special date! We pride ourselves on delivering the best guest service is Laguna Beach, and I'm so joyed to hear we are delivering! I will share this feedback with Diana. Thank you once more for staying with us and we can't wait to have you back!

Summary: We loved it here the staff was very friendly and helpful our whole stay. It was a great location easy to walk to lots of places to eat and the beach out front was amazing! The pool was a nice and hot tub was hot! Our room was definitely out dated but had everything we needed from a fridge microwave and hot plate if you needed any dishes you just asked at the front desk and they brought you a bundle. The AC worked great in our room and the bed was comfortable the only real complaint I would have is the shower pressure wasn‚Äôt great. We chose this hotel because it was on the beach and we were looking to relax by the ocean they had chairs and umbrellas we were allowed to use which was awesome! Loved the vibe of this hotel. We will be back for sure!

I have stayed on and off at the Laguna Riviera Hotel (as well as many other places in Laguna Beach) for decades.  My wife and I deserved a break, so I splurged slightly and reserved a mini-suite for 2 nights.  Well, it turns out that 4 months ago, the hotel was sold, along with the 741 Hotel in the next block.  I was put into a mini suite at the 741.  The room was okay, great steam shower, not a great view compared to rooms in the Riviera.  BUT: *  Air conditioner didn't work (came back on a warm day and windows with sun had the place super hot.  They came but couldn't fix it.) *  Waited 20 minutes for the desk to answer my phone call. *  No coffee pot *  No glasses *  1/2 roll of toilet paper *  No kleenex *  The soap dispenser in shower was empty *  No TV (not a big deal for
Manager Response: Ken, Thanks for the feedback. As one of our very first guests at Seven4One, we knew would we have one or two shortcomings. And with one of our team members there to assist you around the clock, I'm saddened to hear we didn't meet your expectations. We truly hope this is not why you did significant monetary damage to the property, but either way you have given us some minor things to work on. We know this property will shine going forward!

Summary: We narrowly escaped a snow/ice storm to retreat at the Riviera. It was a week of sunshine and warm sand combined with pleasant atmosphere and friendly faces. Who wouldn‚Äôt love that? üíï  I only wish we could have stayed longer.   Centrally located along coast, is an easy walk to the main beach and Heisler Park to the north. Walk to the south and see the most beautiful emerald green, moss covered boulders. The environment changes completely. Stay on the beach though and go during low tide.   The other guests were respectful and noise dies down after 10. We slept very well, except for the occasional party of excited voices, waking up at 3:00 in the morning to take a sunrise stroll.üòÑ
Manager Response: Tess, We absolutely love to hear this and thank you for your glowing 5-Star Review. We have plans to begin making the property even better in the next few months so please think of us next time you are in Sothern California. We look forward to having you again!

Summary: My husband and I just spent our honeymoon here after being married in the early days of covid. We stayed here for a week and were blown away by the level of customer service we received by all the staff members throughout our visit, notably John who checked us in as well as Vince! The place was cozy and affordable making it a diamond in the rough for a young couple like us who wanted to experience Laguna beach! I hope this place maintains its magic for us to enjoy on our next trip to Orange county from the ‚Äúgreat‚Äùwhite north.

Summary Heading: Bait and switch? Better check your charges!
Summary: The front desk tells me that the new owners and the transition to a new booking system is to blame, but WARNING to all who see this - Their descriptions are misleading, and once you arrive, they charge you for incidentals, then do not refund them when you don't use them, add hidden fees and do not provide an itemized list of what you are being charged for.  They also repeatedly charged me for future stays long before I have arrived.  They also offer the common decks if your room doesn't actually have the balcony they advertise, then don't provide shade or furniture to use.  The patio furniture they did provide was soaking wet and they had no alternatives to offer.  BTW, you may want to use a sleep mask because the smoke alarm flashes a piercing green light every 3 minutes
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. Our greatest priority is ensuring our guests are well cared for and enjoy their time with us, and we sincerely regret that we were unable to provide you with a satisfactory experience while you were here on property. We have noted your detailed feedback and we plan to work diligently to ensure this is corrected. Please reach out directly if this billing issue didn't fix itself. Around the time of your stay we were dealing with 2 credit card processors. Again, our apologies.

Summary: We stayed here for a 30th & 70th birthday celebration from WA state. First impression wasn't great because of age of hotel & rooms. But the location & beach were fantastic! The customer service we received from Juanita in the office was amazing!!! She went over the top to make our stay one of the best! We wanted to have a outdoor birthday celebration overlooking the ocean at sunset. Juanita set us up with table & chairs & checked in with us to make sure everything was top notch!    Really great time!
Manager Response: We love to hear this. Juanita is a shining star and i'm so glad to hear how she enhanced your experience with us. Please hang in there with us for the next 6 months or so as we have exciting renovation on the way! Thanks again.

Summary: My husband and I are mature travelers and both disabled. I have difficulty with stairs and we were on the 2nd floor. There was no elevator. The room smelled musty when we entered. They had not put any air or fan on before our arrival and during Covid. The bed was so hard I could not sleep. I slept a few hours in the arm chair. The room was so small we could barely turn around. The shower was dark and had a tall edge and I was afraid to get in it. No bars to hold onto. The parking lot was so small, my husband scraped the side of the car on the rock flower bed pulling in. Long lines at the front desk with only one person working. The view was the only redeeming feature. This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.
Manager Response: We truly regret to hear that your experience at our resort fell short of your expectations, and we sincerely apologize. We are glad you let us know of these shortcomings and we are eager to correct each and every issue, and resolve them for the future. We have taken all of these comments to heart and shared them with our leadership team in an effort to provide coaching. Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: I‚Äôve been staying here for 20 years and it has always been our favorite hotel in laguna. This year, we are very sad to say that the management does not care about keeping up with the place. The carpet in the room is very dirty, the hot tub was Luke warm, the deck needs to be redone, the shower is not great etc. It is incredibly overpriced for what you get. You would think with how much they charge they could replace the carpet in the rooms (or put tile) An upgrade is way overdue. This place has potential to be very beautiful and enjoyable.
Manager Response: Taylor, Thank you for sharing your experience. We agree this hotel has been neglected for far too long. We have just taken over October 1st, 2021. Give us 6-9 months to give it the love that it needs and we assure you this will be an experience in Laguna you won't want to miss. Truly appreciate your feedback.

Summary Heading: The view is killer, the hotel stinks!
Summary: Never have been to a hotel where it took 20 min for someone to come to the front desk to check us in!  Advertised as non smoking. If you like, I‚Äôll show you all the crushed cigarette butts that were on our patio!  Gross stained carpets and furniture!  Very overpriced for what you get. Must have been nice years ago. For over $700 for 2 nights, would it be that difficult for some coffee in the lobby?  Very surprised and will not be back!!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. It's unfortunate that your experience was ruined by the smell of cigarettes. In fact, not only are we a non-smoking hotel... it is illegal to smoke in the entire city of Laguna Beach.  We have taken your review to heart and will work diligently to correct our shortcomings.

Summary: I have been staying at this hotel since the 1980's (and worked here in the early 1960's).  Over the last weekend in September I stayed here in one of the less expensive rooms with a small view of the ocean. My bill was almost a thousand dollars---for a room with a dirty carpet and the view window was in need of a wash and/or a replacement.  I have never cared about modern and fancy---just want nice and functional.  The hotel is not being managed and taken care of as it was a few years ago.

I was disappointed because I expected an unobstructed  view of the ocean from our room. This is the description: "Surf View King: 1 king bed in our more modern hotel rooms. You will have unobstructed views of the sand and waves, and a shared balcony space". The pictures all show beautiful views from the room, but this is not the case. See my photo, There is a walkway and another room's door right next to the room so you would have people looking in if you keep the shutters open. Their excuse is that you have a view from your balcony but that is not what the web page says. It is a old hotel, not a modern room. The bed is not comfortable and the linens are not great. We could never get hot water in the shower. The web page does say no air conditioning but if you can't have the

What the property lacks in comfort and charm, the front desk agents Danielle and Juanita make up for in spades. They were both super friendly, energetic and cared for the guests.  Our room was in need of a refresh big time. The large lower outdoor common area has only two chairs, one lounger and one table (the cushions needed a good wipe down) which makes it difficult for more than one or two guests at a time to enjoy the gorgeous ocean view. Easy to access the free Laguna Beach Trolley which we took to the Pageant of the Masters.

I was a guest at Laguna Riviera resort on the beach from April 6,2021 thru  April 15,2021.  The total amount including taxes was $2174.40.  April 15 I paid for my stay in the amount of $2174.40 (CASH) which was the amount of my confirmation dated March 12,2021.  The room was ok with a queen/or king size bed.  The shower had 3 cracked tiles, the refrigerator did not work and the sliding doors to the patio needed to be fixed so I could safely stay in the room and enjoy the ocean breeze.  Well guess what - when I got home I found out that the first night of the stay $208.99 was charged to my credit card and I was not told the new balance.  Jaunita was hesitant to take the cash but I told her I spoke with Matt and he was ok with it.  Well guess what  Jaunita apparently didn't know
Manager Response: Kathryn, I apologize you are still having trouble understanding the first night's deposit was taken on your credit card. We did receive your dispute and had it reversed so maybe your bank will be able to explain it to you better than we can.  We wish you the best wherever you choose to stay in September!

Summary Heading: Love, love, love this place since 2018!
Summary: If looking for a place that is shiny and new and has no character, this isn‚Äôt for you. Laguna Riviera has so much charm, hard to explain as you need to feel it. The staff is wonderful and do everything they can to assure happy guests. Clean, comfortable rooms with everything you need. Steps away from toes in the sand and accessories which can be borrowed for your day at the beach. Every time I leave starts the countdown to my next visit, I‚Äôm down to 350 days already‚Ä¶

Just don‚Äôt stay here.  We came in to Laguna for The Pageant, like we have done many times, meeting our whole family.  This place was like staying at an old Motel 6.  It was noisy, the shower didn‚Äôt work right, the carpet and paint were old.  Just keep searching
Manager Response: Karen, We truly regret to hear that your experience at our resort fell short of your expectations, and we sincerely apologize. We are glad you let us know of these shortcomings and we are eager to correct each and every issue, and resolve them for the future. We have taken all of these comments to heart and shared them with our leadership team in an effort to provide coaching. Thank you for staying with us Karen.

Summary: Laguna Riviera is family friendly. They have all types of equipment so that during your stay you can take a beach umbrella, towels and chairs to the beach. The staff is super friendly and if you need anything they are on it.  We stayed in room 401, 301, 516 and 409 all beautiful rooms with great views. The public deck in front of 401 has a beautiful sunset view.   Love coming to this resort. They even have a indoor jacuzzi and a pool. Ralphs is across the street. They have plenty of grills so that multiple families can grill outside.  We had 4 cars and didn‚Äôt have a issue with parking. Highly recommend for a family vacation. If your doing a romantic getaway I recommend the deluxe rooms. Lol if you have a big family maybe the suites. And all surf view rooms are just beautiful so

Everything was great. Right on the beach. The room comes with a kitchen.  They provide coffee and a coffee maker.  The bed was comfy. The only complaint is no full length mirror. Which a girl loves. The hot tub and pool area was nice. Although why use the pool when you have the ocean. Hotel tip:  they charge a lot for parking but if you go right up the street and park on a residential road its free and safe. They also provide chairs and umbrellas for the beach These pictures are from the hotel

The thing that comes to mind after thinking back about my stay at the Laguna Riviera Beach Resort last week is simply "Delightful"  I stress the beach resort part because it is not just a hotel it is really a beach hideaway, it is so quaint and unique,  the building is sprawled throughout the mountain and has its own walking path down to the sand only steps away from the ocean. Every part of the hotel has been hand painted with vibrant flower and ocean scenes, they also provide beach chairs and umbrellas. It is clean, has barbecues and grassy area and seating to view the sunsets and the ocean or whatever your mind needs to relax. It is very affordable and the staff were great and very helpful. Special thanks to John, Juanita,  and the entire front desk staff!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback, and taking the time to acknowledge our team. We love to hear this!

Summary Heading: Laguna Rivera Hotel Beach Hotel! Views for days! Hospitality unbeatable!!!!!
Summary: This review is long over due. This is our 2nd time staying here now as a family & our annual girls trip! Prime location. Steps away from the beach. Better service than Four Seasons. The entire staff is always so amazing & attentive especially John & Matt!
Manager Response: Rhea, Such a pleasure to have you all back! We are so happy to hear that you had such a great experience. We can't wait to have you all back next year!

Summary: Juanita was so friendly and welcoming upon our arrival.  A real sweetie and so attentive! We stayed in room 514 or 516, I can't quite remember the number, but it was overlooking the ocean with both a balcony and a covered patio. We used the hotel's private access to the beach plus nice pool and jaccuzi. The room was big, with refrigerator and microwave. It was the perfect stay for us a couple for a little honeymoon that was delayed due to COVID.

It was our first time at this hotel the view is amazing , My family had a great time .Juanita and Matt are amazing very helpful they were super nice and friendly, The manager Matt was so kind to move us to a big room which was amazing it had a   kitchen and a private deck . The location is great just a few steps to the ocean and the shopping store , I will definitely  go back next year ,The view is gorgeous . If you are looking for a nice view and friendly stuff this is the hotel to stay .
Manager Response: Ms. Perez, It was truly our pleasure to make your stay so wonderful. Thank you for the kind words and fantastic review. Please reach out when you are ready to return!

Summary Heading: Not the Same Property as before
Summary: My wife and I have stayed many times at the Laguna Riviera Resort for going on 30 years.  It has always been the consumate beach hotel-in-the-wall.  It has never been the nicest place in town, but it is on the beach and many of the rooms have great views of the ocean.  Each room is different from the other, and in past years you could know your favorites and call ahead for reservations or go online and know what rooms on what dates we available. Recently, they have abandoned that policy, and now rooms are classified as to their views, and they give a general idea of the features: a kitchenette or a separate bedroom or so on.  But you wont know until you arrive exactly what room you will have.  Because each one is o different, you can wind up with a kitchenette with sink or no

First, this is on the beach. Not every room has a gorgeous view but every room is within 1 minute walk of a gorgeous view on property. Absolutely, one of the most memorable trips I've had in California. The main reason is the location, staff. The staff works as a team. Hospitality is beyond belief. I actually got a thank you card from Juanita and Madeline. Mike unloaded my car and repacked it back up like the professionally is. Jason who's in maintenance wasn't above getting me an ice bucket. They have an unbelievable work ethic at this place. These come with kitchenettes in most but remember you need to call and ask for supplies they do not leave plates, glasses, knives, and forks. Call the operator ask if housekeeping can bring the kitchen supplies. With that said some people

My girlfriend and I have stayed at this resort several times, but we will never go back.  They gave us the wrong room then switched us to a dump.  it smelt like mold.  The carpet had stains. Several lights were missing lightbulbs.  There was NO heat.  They brought in a heater. The kitchen had no dishes, utensils, papertowls, or cups.  We had to ask for dishes.  The deck had dog poop on it.  I'm so disappointed. This place was so special, but now it's old, dirty, and needs a facelift.

we spent a week at this resort in rooms 502 and 503.  When we first checked into this resort I was a little worried.  It seemed very dated and plain.  After getting checked in and settled I realized this place was so clean! It was a perfect location. We booked last minute so we didnt get the better rooms with the private balcony which I think would be amazing!  This was a trip with my daughters and we all had a great time!  We walked pretty much everywhere for meals and felt very safe.  The real gem at this resort is the staff!  Especially Juanita! She went above and beyond for us and was always smiling.  I would definitely stay here again with a oceanview room.  My only suggestion and didnt rate 5 star is because room 502 had carpet that had stains and should just be replaced

Summary Heading: Fabulous stay!  Great for the price.
Summary: We had a Queen Suite with a view.  The walk-ways down to the beach were beautiful.  And the beach was perfect.  Plenty of room for the guests and lots of fun.  (Remember sunscreen.  Ouch!)  We had a private patio area.  The Grill was wonderful.  And nothing beats staying right on the beach, where you can access it from your back door.  There was a nice private room with a queen bed and plenty of storage.  The living room area had a queen couch bed.  We also had a fabulous full kitchen.  Dishes and cookware are available from the staff.     The couch bed was a little limp and lop-sided, but we put the kids on backwards, so their feet were over the actual couch.  It worked great.  I wish there were more hooks in the bathroom for hanging up bath towels, but I hear when they

We spent 2 nights in #304, neighbors only on one side, great 180 views of ocean and activities on beach.  The staff, Madeline and Juanita, were friendly and went out of their way to ensure we had all we needed and more w great places and menu recommendations to try.  Loved just parking our car once and then when we left our stay there .... walked all over town and easy access to walk down to the beach.   Do have bfst/lunch at The Orange Inn .... it's a corner Cafe (due to Covid we ordered take-out --- GREAT coffee, pastries, acai bowl, etc) and then walked 2 mins to eat on our deck.  Delightful !

Terrible   Just checked-in this evening(3/29/2021) around 6 PM in Room#511. We took a partial sea view room. Here are my reasons for one star(Terrible).   1. Rooms are pretty small.  2. When we entered the room and near hallway, we smelled cigarette, when this is Non-Smoking one. 3. My kid wanted to watch TV, and the TV channels did not come. All Channels display Program not available, tuning failure. When I checked with the front desk, I was told its because of the wind, and it comes back. I literally believed it. I waited, waited and waited. When I checked with other hotel guests, I was told, on the day of check-in, guests need to have the front desk reset the HDMI to get TV channels. This is the first time I am hearing something like this.  Now, when I mentioned this to the
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. Our greatest priority is ensuring our guests are well cared for and enjoy their time with us, and we sincerely regret that we were unable to provide you with a satisfactory experience while you were here on property. We can assure you we are completely smoke-free and it is actually illegal to smoke cigarettes in Laguna Beach. We have noted your detailed feedback and we plan to work diligently to ensure the TV issues are corrected.

Summary Heading: One of our worst vacations ever
Summary: We have traveled all over the world and to Laguna Beach many times. This was one of our worst vacations and relatively most expensive ever. We were attracted to this hotel because of location and fair pricing. We reserved a partial ocean view with kitchen for prepaid rate of $169 + taxes for 4 nights. We got a room overlooking a roof with sea in back ground and could not see the beach. We had a microwave and small fridge. No cleaning service and had to call (wait more than 15 rings) to get change of towels. No information how to make calls or anything in the room. Tried contacting hotel manager via their website before arriving for clarifications in writing for room description but never got a response. Tried calling manager and got disconnected. Before leaving, I sent email to
Manager Response: We truly regret to hear that your experience at our resort fell short of your expectations, and we sincerely apologize. We are glad you let us know of these shortcomings and we are eager to correct these issues, and resolve them for the future. We have taken all of these comments to heart and shared them with our team in an effort to provide coaching. Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: They require you to violate your CA privacy rights at checkin without warning they plan to  do it!  They require you to submit a photo of your ID, a violation of CA State Law. They get around it by saying that they won‚Äôt check you in without doing so, send you to a website where you are forced you to make a photo of your ID, and require you to check a box saying your doing it voluntarily.   Failure to do so will result in no room, and 2 days of charges ($450!!) for not cancelling 48 hours ago.   This is illegal!!  Using financial and services leverage to make you voluntarily waive your privacy rights is ILLEGAL.
Manager Response: We do in fact use Canary Technologies to fraud check all guest's identification against their credit card. We are sorry this ruined your vacation, but we can assure you it is 100% legal, and all your personal information is well protected. We would never charge you if you decided you are uncomfortable submitting this information for whatever reason. We wish you the best in your future stays and encourage you to look into Canary as you will assuredly use it at most hotels in the future.

Summary Heading: Great location, nice people, but your experience will depend on which room you're assigned
Summary: I read through all the reviews on TA before I booked, and it seemed like people either loved it or hated it.  Those who hated it raged (with fists raised) that the website photos are a lie!  I don't think the website photos are a lie - I do believe that there are beautifully updated rooms with new furnishings and modernized bathrooms...I just didn't happen to get one.  So...your experience will depend, I think, whether or not you get one of these updated rooms.  It's a matter of managing expectations - and if you're expecting a room with matching furniture with a sleek new bathroom and you ge the room we got, yes, I can see why you'd be upset.  So even though I crossed my fingers and hoped and prayed I'd get lucky and get a nice room  (I took my parents there on a staycation to

Summary Heading: Excellent accommodation with attentive hotel staff
Summary: We were helped by Madeline and Juanita on check in / out, and during our stay, Vince helped my wife and I get a crib for our baby. We stayed in a room just off of the grass courtyard which was excellent for having family over for sunset. An excellent value for a great weekend in Laguna.
Manager Response: Thank you for your lovely review! We are so happy to hear your experience with all of our staff was so pleasant.  We hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: I had a wonderful time at the Laguna Riviera. It is right on the beach and surrounded by adorable boutiques and restaurants. The service is impeccable, particularly that of Madeline and Jordan. They were both incredibly helpful and friendly. I can't wait to go back!

Did not get the room we were booked to get. We were supposed to have a side ocean view with a balcony which we did not get. It was our 30th wedding anniversary so we're especially disappointed. We have stayed here before and had the same problem with not getting the room we paid for.

The family and I wanted to do a beach day. It‚Äôs a small tiny staycation to keep us normal. Laguna Riviera seemed like a good fit. The location was great.   We tried to do an early check in. We got there at 2:30 (check in at 4:00). Was told that the room was not ready and to come back at 3:30 closer to 4:00. She informed us that we can have bathroom keys to change and more than welcomed to use the hotels beach chairs and umbrellas. (Mental note: there are no beach chairs or umbrellas)  Was then informed that there will be a $19 fee for parking even though I stated that when I booked it said ‚Äúparking included‚Äù She said yes it‚Äôs ‚Äúincluded with a fee‚Äù.  Seriously!!  Finally came up the ramp to check in at 5:00.  Walked up to the room and it still wasn‚Äôt ready. Was told by

Summary Heading: Cute little place on the beach
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay here. The staff was very nice and the room was clean.  We had the most basic room they offer, queen bed, no view, but it had a nice little kitchenette with mini fridge, microwave, sink, etc. We went down to the beach both days and it was great to use their chairs and umbrella. Parking is $19/night but the spaces are pretty small, I wouldn‚Äôt bring a full size SUV or truck. Property is very close to a great little coffee/breakfast place that you can walk to. I would definitely return to this property and maybe splurge on one of the ocean view rooms with their own balcony!

Our first night experience was really bad.We were not welcomed.We were to exhausted so we just went straight to our room and we felt we need water.there was not even 2 small bottles of water in the refrigerator.There was no Iron.sheets was not clean.the location is good but customer services and amenities are zero.They are not spend any Dollers for gust and room.They charged for parking very night which was not mentioned in the website.It is expensive for such a room which did not have air Conditioner.I am really sad by staying in such a hotel even 1 night.

We stayed here on the 4th of July during COVID and it was perfect. The staff was spectacular and helpful, safe and distant while attentive and casual. The ocean breeze and vitamin sea was wonderful, the bed was comfortable and it felt more like an apartment because of the kitchen and space. Perfect if you want to swim and close by to fabulous restaurants and shopping.

We booked a room with Laguna Riveria based on the ‚Äòpictures‚Äô they advertise and were given a crappy room with no view and literally had a trash bag right outside our room from people who stayed before us. I went to the reception to request a refund, the lady at the front desk is A LIAR!! She told me she went ahead and issued a refund but we never got it. On calling her back she had the audacity to tell me on my face that she told me their is no guarantee on me getting my money back which was EXACTLY THE OPPOSITE of what she told me then. I was told that my refund was issued!! These guys are thieves and don‚Äôt care about anyone‚Äôs hard earned money  and I would make sure I tell the world that I was cheated by them not ONCE but TWICE!!! BEWARE!!!!

We had a very poor experience at the hotel. We booked a "ocean view room". We could kinda see the ocean but across a walkway and a balcony (not ours) so not private at all. But the worst part was the condition of the room. It has not been remodeled in a long time, very worn and smelled of mildew. This probably was because there is no A/C which may not seem necessary at the ocean but it was very warm and humid. The whole property is very worn and not well taken care of. A champagne glass sat on the railing outside our room for the 24 hrs we were there. Great location but think twice before booking.

From the moment of our arrival we felt welcomed and cared for.  It was our 34th wedding anniversary, and they went out of their way to make it special and memorable.  The location of the hotel is ideal for exploring the coastal paradise of Laguna Beach, not to mention the extraordinarily easy access to the beach.  The private and public terraces provided unsurpassed opportunities to view the spectacular ocean sunsets. Without hesitation, for us, the Laguna Riviera is going to become a family tradition.

Best Stay ever! Front desk was so amazing! Jordan was the best! It was a birthday and he surprised us with a bottle of wine! So awesome of him! Thank You for a great stay!!! We will be back soon! Everything was so close by as well!

Summary Heading: If you don‚Äôt like it leave but we will still charge
Summary: We checked in around 5 pm and after we put our bags in the room, we went for a walk to downtown Laguna.  Afterwards, we had dinner at the Cliff restaurant (great views and atmosphere). We made it back to our room around 8:30 pm.  I noticed that there wasn‚Äôt a remote control for the tv  and also the AC was not working.  I tried calling the front desk but no one answered.   The main window in our room was stuck and won‚Äôt open. The next morning I stopped by the front desk to let them know about the two main issues.  A technician showed up and he confirmed that the AC is damaged and he couldn‚Äôt fix it.  He brought us a mobile AC unit.  He also checked the TV and said that it is damaged.  He mentioned it to the front desk.  The clerk informed me that her manager told her they are
Manager Response: Hi Kifah, We are greatly disappointed to hear this! Our staff takes great pride in providing a level of genuine care and service excellence that ranks amongst the best in Laguna Beach, and we are always saddened if this is not our guests' experience and perception. We will utilize your feedback to get better. Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel recently and found it was a good value. Bit of an older hotel, but it‚Äôs a great place for a few nights stay. The view is beautiful, and it is walking distance to some restaurants and shops
Manager Response: We love to hear this! Thank you so much for taking the time to give us positive feedback.

Summary: We got lucky to be able to stay in room 508 which has the best view in the hotel and I would request this every time.  All the rooms (ocean view) are amazing and the staff is great.  Walking distance from everything.  Left the windows open all night and listened the waves.

This place is always a pleasure to visit. It's a throwback to when resorts were small and quaint, and is more laid-back and relaxing.  It's right on the beach, with a private beach access, amazing ocean views and soothing surf sound. Juanita was very helpful explaining the different rooms etc, Adam showed us the rooms and got us quickly checked in.  They have coffee and pastries at 830am, but I had mis-read the sign and thought it was 630am, but Madeline let us grab a pastry on the way out! I've stayed here several times in the past, and it's always my first choice when visiting Laguna Beach!

This little place is absolutely amazing! Honestly the front desk woman, Juanita makes everything about your stay perfect and personal. I thought for sure she was an owner. She clearly loves her job and the company she works for, she runs it like it‚Äôs her own. The sunrise, view of the ocean, the central location and the sunset makes this hidden gem a new go too for my future trips! Thank you for the experience. Very needed and very much appreciated.

Currently writing this review from the balcony of room 306, which is about as close to the beach as any hotel room in Laguna Beach.  The hotel staff is friendly, room is clean, and price affordable.  Such a great value!  Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, especially Room 306 ;-).
Manager Response: Bradley, Thank you for staying with us and thank you for the terrific review! So happy to hear you enjoyed room 306. That view can not be beat! Please let us know when you're headed back to Laguna Beach in the future, as we would love to host you and your family!

Summary: Cute hotel overlooking the water.  It's a bit of a walk down to the beach but worth it!  Small kitchens in the rooms & BBQ grills outside so we could cook meals to save money.  Great location to walk to shops and restaurants.  Trolly stop is right in front of the hotel as well.  Great for families!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and we are so happy to hear you enjoyed the resort and the location. Please come back and see us soon!

Summary: My fianc√© and I were looking for a relaxing, romantic weekend getaway, and we found it! Our stay at the Laguna Riviera was perfect. The view is amazing out to Catalina, and over to main beach. The location is amazing and walking distance to everything. We enjoyed the amenities like the saltwater pool and jacuzzi! The staff was friendly, and accommodating, especially Maddy! Thank you for a wonderful stay! We will definitely be back!
Manager Response: Jill,  Thank you so much for your review. It warms my heart to here your stay with us was perfect. We would love to have you back anytime.

Summary Heading: A wonderful, quirky hotel with a great view
Summary: Myself and some of my family have been coming to this hotel for a couple of years now, and it has become a wonderful tradition. This hotel is unique and wonderful.  The ‚Äúnew booking system‚Äù is a bit of a bummer; you used to be able to select the exact room you wanted. At most hotels, where most rooms are the same, this wouldn‚Äôt be a big deal. However, at this hotel, every room is a little bit different. Some have four kitchens, some have ocean views, some have large bathtubs with jacuzzi jets. Luckily, the super friendly staff can help you get what you are looking for. For my family, we love getting a room with a full kitchen, as Ralph‚Äôs the grocery store is very short walk away, and when you have kids on board, being able to make your own meals and stay close to the hotel is a
Manager Response: Conor,   Thank you for the kind review and your compliments on Maya. Please know if you ever have a specific room request we will always do our very best to accommodate that.  We hope to see you again very soon!

Summary: My wife and I blindly booked this resort for her birthday.  Never been to Laguna Beach.  What a gem.  We got lucky.  This place is great.  Very neat and clean.  Direct beach access.  We reserved an outdoor grill over looking the beach.  The resort supplies the utinsels etc.  There is a nice grocery store less than a block away.  We grilled a thick rib eye, two lobster tails and veggies and watched the sunset!  It was AWESOME!!  Last but not least, the staff is soooo friendly and helpful.  No question, we recommend this place.  Thank you, John Putnam.  Fort Worth , TX
Manager Response: Mr. Putnam,   Thank you for the wonderful review. It was truly our pleasure to serve you. We hope to see you and yours in the near future!

Summary: Our stay at Laguna Riviera was absolutely perfect. I highly recommend this resort for your stay in Laguna. Our room was right over the water, and we could hear the crashing waves all through the night. There are plenty of places to sit to take in the scenery and watch the sunset. There is direct access to the beach, and the beach area is really nice. The property itself was nice and very well maintained. Leaving the hotel you could walk in either direction and find a great place to eat or shop. Also, management was very kind and extremely helpful. We were checking in late and received a courtesy call to make sure we were still coming and to make sure we knew where to go and how to check in. We are really looking forward to our next stay here. It will for sure be our go to spot

The location was great. Right on the beach up on the hill looking over. The walk to and from the beach can be exhausting, it‚Äôs quite a walk up and down. But well worth it. Walking distance to a lot of great places. Restaurants and tourist shopping. Rooms were dated, super noisy and not quite like the pictures. Unfortunately the ‚Äúprivate‚Äù balconies are not exactly what you would expect. The location of our room was less than ideal. It was located perfectly for anyone coming up the steps to be looking straight into along with anyone walking on that floor. From guest, housekeeping, maintenance etc. we were on complete display if we had our curtains open. Which we obviously wanted open to not only have a view of the ocean but there was no a/c so to also cool the room. The staff was
Manager Response: We are greatly disappointed to hear this! Our staff takes great pride in providing a level of genuine care and service excellence that ranks amongst the best in Laguna Beach, and we are always saddened if this is not our guests' experience and perception. We will utilize your feedback to get better. Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: my family and I have been enjoying The Laguna Riviera for four decades. It‚Äôs not the place it used to be........ everything is getting old and the service is not good at all. The request of fixing a pocket door to our bathroom in our room was never fixed. One of the days our room was not serviced at all. Rooms old. Number 101 has the best view. The unit above if occupied will make a considerable problem with noise . Every movement above can be heard. At almost 300 a night I wonder if I will ever come back. The new management is driving this place down. For the last month prior to check in I wanted to talk to someone. NEVER did get a response. That‚Äôs really unacceptable and shows how they care for repeat customers. I‚Äôll be looking elsewhere and that makes me sad to have to leave
Manager Response: On behalf of our team, I am very disheartened to hear of your unpleasant experience. The Laguna Riviera signifies traditions of warmth and compassionate service. Our team thrives on providing the utmost genuine care and comfort to each of our valuable guests, and we sincerely apologize for letting you down. We thank you very much for your feedback and have shared it constructively so that we may learn from it and perform better.

Summary: Very friendly staff, Juanita, Madeline, and Ryan could not have been nicer. Location was great and most of the places a resturants we wanted to go to were easily accessable. Would recommend to friends.

The location is great, with beach access, nice views of the ocean, and is close to everything in Laguna Beach. The room itself was ok ... nothing fancy but it gets the job done. The pool area is great for kids, although it feels a tad on the dated side. Breakfast was pretty bare bones. Id suggest just going somewhere within walking distance. The staff was very friendly, and accommodating.   Overall we enjoyed our stay and I'd recommend it to others. If you're trying to impress someone, this might not be the place to come, but it's great for families or if you just want to enjoy the beach. It has a certain charm to it, and while it might not be for everyone we'll be coming back.

Summary Heading: Great location but somewhat tired property
Summary: >>>Booked the Laguna Riviera for a couple nights a few months ago.  Stayed this Monday & Tuesday night.  Had a couple calls with them to insure that we got an Ocean view suite as the rooms are all quite different, even among the same "room class".  Was assured that they pre-selected a great ocean view suite.  Called before heading down and was told it had not been rented the previous night and we could check in early.   >>>Arrived around 2:30pm and got into a discussion with the desk clerk on what room we were assigned.  Manager Matt had reserved 508 but that was not clean.  507 was clean but is on the other side of a walkway from the mini-deck.  Looked very dark. So we agreed to wait on 508.  Also was told that "We just started charging $14.00/day for parking".  I commented on
Manager Response: Mr. Rose, Thank you for the review. I'm glad you all enjoyed your stay and we hope to have you back after we make some exciting upgrades to the property.

Summary: The Laguna Riviera was a charming little stay right on the beach.  The views were absolutely breathtaking.  We especially appreciated James on staff.  He was super sweet, helpful, patient, and friendly! Highly recommend this stay.

Summary Heading: Has its pluses but wow is it is need of serious cleaning and updating
Summary: The location is excellent, on the beach and walking distance to much of interest in LB, plus on-site parking is a rarity in this area. The price is somewhat lower than higher-end places I‚Äôve stayed nearby, so I had no idea that this was (or maybe has become) a run-down motel! My partial-view room was dark and dingy with soiled, tattered curtains, a radiator that was rusted and full of grime, and grotty carpeting that needed to be cleaned, or even better replaced, over a decade ago. When I went to check out the ‚Äúbreakfast‚Äù at 10 AM, there was no coffee and basically just some toast and packets of oatmeal to eat.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with and thank you for your review. We are excited to tell you that there will be some nice upgrades coming property wide both to the rooms and to the breakfast experience. We apologize this stay wasn't perfect for you, but we hope your next one will be! Thank you again!

Summary: This hotel was priced just right. Just a short walk from the beach. Most rooms have a view of the Pacific Ocean. We fell asleep every night to the sound of waves crashing. The room wasn't full of frills. It was a clean room located on PCH and backed onto the beach. Here are a few things you should know:  Breakfast is nothing more than some bagels, english muffins, OJ and coffee. So don't expect to get a great continental breakfast here.  Parking: There are parking spots, I dont know if there are enough for each room. I just parked my car and didn't need it the rest of my stay. (Uber, Trolley, Walking). I was charged $14 a day for parking. You can reserve a spot for another $14/day.   They have towels, beach chairs, umbrellas, beach toys. Some for free, some for rent.

Summary Heading: Staff went above and beyond, Perfect experience!
Summary: This place was great! We went in June for my birthday weekend. My family is from out of town and we were all so impressed. From the moment we checked in we were greeted by friendly staff that was super helpful in informing us of the hotels amenities and local restaurants. Our room had a huge patio that overlooked the ocean and had plenty of room for our spread of party food. We utilized the BBQ to grill some meat for tacos, the grills were clean and easy to use. The staff would come by and ask if we needed anything like grill utensils or anything. Later that day my parents decided that they liked the place so much that they'd like to stay the night as well. We asked James at the front desk if it was possible. He made it happen for us and even moved us to a downstairs room after
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear you had a wonderful experience at The Laguna Riviera! It's reviews such as this one that make us so appreciative to be in the hotel business. We look forward to having you back soon!

Summary: Arrival at Laguna Riviera Beach Resort 0-10: Location: 10 Service: 10 Cleanliness: 10 Bang for your buck: 10  The staff was amazing with every aspect of our trip. I requested some sparkling wine and cake for my wife‚Äôs birthday and they brought us amazing brut and a delicious cake. Juanita at the front desk scheduled an appointment for the eyebrow threading as we mentioned we were looking for a place. Our room was a decent size and in the prime location to walk either direction to do everything. The resort was situated atop a small cliff with a walkway to the bottom that opens up to your on paradise right on the beach. The surfers are out surfing and it was not too over crowded on any given day of the week. The sea breeze and views were breathtaking. Check out the photos from our
Manager Response: Mr. Sox, It was our pleasure to have you this past week. Thank you for the kind words, and we look forward to seeing you in the near future.

Summary Heading: Surf view room on a relaxing return visit
Summary: I like the Laguna Riviera. I had a surf view room with a private deck. It's a pleasant place to hang out. Staying midweek made it more affordable than the weekend. The pool and hot tub are adequate. Continental breakfast was provided. There was a refrigerator and microwave in the room. A seagull tried to steal my lunch from the patio table. A lovely time, many thanks.
Manager Response: Cynthia,  It was our pleasure to have you. We are working on our pool and breakfast areas in the very near future so we hope you come back to an even better experience next time! Thank you for the great review.

Summary Heading: Laid back retro hotel in stellar location.
Summary: Built in the 40's this hotel retains its "Streamline Moderne" vibe, incorporating the look of the levels of a ship's deck on its ocean side. It's a little worn, with exterior chipped paint here & there, so if you're looking for a cookie cutter chain hotel, this probably isn't for you. But if you like a little retro charm, friendly and helpful staff, super comfortable bed, & location right on the beach, look no further. My room had a partial view of the ocean, high, beamed ceiling with a large fan, & its own rear balcony with a view of the beautiful Laguna Hills. The bed was extremely comfortable with a memory foam topper, good pillows, & high quality bed linen. Mini fridge & microwave, wine glasses, glass tumblers, & china mugs (no plastic). (Ralph's grocery a block away).

Love this place.  Clean, staff was great. Has great views.  Nice clean pool and hot tub. A gas grill to BBQ.  Our room had a full kitchen with pots, pans, and cookware.  Dolphins swam by our room every morning. Breakfast was the only thing that I didn't love.  But I will definitely be staying here again.

It was a beautiful place to stay, right on the beach, I would stay here again for sure. Room was clean, it was quiet, and walking distance to shops and restaurants. Great place to watch the sunset. No obstructed view.

Stay with my family here for 1 night. The room is nice and clean. It has a kitchen for cooking. Sofa bed is not bad for 2 adults. It is very close to the sea, down to private beach is very convenient. The breakfast is pretty good and free. like the place.

We have stayed at several hotels and 2 airbnb in laguna beach over the past 10 years. This place is by far the worst of all. The only good thing to say is the view which is spectacular. The staff was kind and helpful. But the hotel needs to be completely renovated. It's not more than a 1 star.

We have travelled to Laguna Beach almost yearly in last 10 years. This time we decided to stay in Laguna Riviera Beach resort. We booked King suite with ocean view. Kitchen is from 1960''s. Front door to get into suite must be also original, very old and dated. There is only a few dishes, rusty refrigerator. Bedroom has been updated in last 25 yrs and mattress is totally worn out. Bedding is very old and comforter was full of stains. Living room has a hide-away bed, however, the mattress was again 20+ yrs old. We had the worst night sleep. There is no air condition in the rooms so only option is sleep window open. The traffic from the street is horrible. The view from the balcony was nice but staying in the hotel is not worth of the money. Across the street there are many

My best friend and I needed to get away for the weekend. She booked a garden view room that had a good price. It was very nice, though they said it had a queen bed when it really looked like a full. That wasn't a big deal because it also had a sleeper sofa that actually worked out better for us! It had a full-size kitchen as well. Just a quick walk to the beach and within walking distance of anything you would need. The staff was incredibly polite. I have no complaints whatsoever and recommend it if you're looking for a reasonably priced room. They have options for oceanview that were beyond our budget, but would be worth it - amazing sunsets!

My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary and wanted an oceanfront nice place.  We were extremely disappointed when we drove up at the appearance of the "resort", parking was terrible.  I kept an open mind knowing it was an older place from the reviews I read and because the photos posted looked so nice.  That all changed almost instantly when were greeted by a very rude front desk lady who apparently was to busy to provide good customer service and check us in, she didn't even tell us how to get to our room until we asked.  Still tryiing to keep an open mind as we are heading to our room, it's going to be nice.  WRONG!!! Boy was I ever so wrong, our room looked nothing like the photos posted online or in their own lobby.  Our room looked like a room from the 70's that

Summary Heading: New owners are ruining the experience
Summary: We have been visiting the Laguna Riviera almost every year since 2001. The new ownership has made one huge change that, unless the policy changes, we will not return. We always stay in our favorite room, and even adjust our schedule to get it. NO MORE!! You can no longer request a room! You make a reservation for a certain date or dates, and you have no idea what room you will be getting! On the website you have limited options, such as "village view suite" but you're going to get what they give you. If this was a chain with 500 rooms, it's understandable, but this is a boutique property with many (former) guests who've been visiting for years, and staying in their favorite room. They ruined my wife's birthday with this change. So sad when it changes from a friendly, family

Honestly, it was a really good stay. You're literally on the beach,  the room was clean and recently renovated. Everyone was super nice and it was within walking distance of everything.  Definitely going to be staying here again

My long time friend and I decided to head to Laguna jBeach for an overnight 'getaway'.   She had stayed at this hotel about 15 years ago and we thought it looked like a great location.  The hotel is an interesting architecture, not your cookie cutter new hotel,  that has been kept up so well and is thoughtfully laid out with many features for comfort -- like the grass area with BBQs,  the ramp down to the beach right in front and boogie boards to use, and many decks furnished with tables and chairs plus heat lamps for warmth, sit and watch the dolphins even on chilly days!  The hotel has many rooms with amazing views of the ocean and many with private decks off the rooms.  Or, use one of the many community seating areas.  The rooms may be a tad dated but are very clean and

Summary Heading: Great place for a couple or family the is something for everybody.
Summary: Great funky fun rooms from small quaint rooms looking at Hwy 1 to awesome beach front or view rooms for 2 to 20 some people in the big house. Still run by the family will be interesting to see what the new owners will do or change. We always liked the bar-be-ques so we could just waik to the market and grab some food and have a nice dinner looking out at the ocean.

If a pristine boutique hotel is what you seek...don't come to the Laguna Riviera.  If you want to stay steps from the beach and a 5 minute walk to downtown and if u can overlook the wear and tear this place has obviously seen, then book away.   The place sort of grew on me.  I believe it's a locally owned and operated place with local employees.  I was there in October for perfect weather.  The crappy wireless and the beachy, well worn rooms was overcome by the crashing surf I could see and hear from my partial ocean view.   The place has a lot of weirdness...but I liked it.

No,this isn‚Äôt the title of an apocalyptic novel in which only one beach hotel lies in its wake. Instead, it was a hotel stay masquerading as a reality show designed to test our patience and endurance. On more than one occasion, I had the perception of being ‚Äúgaslighted,‚Äù and am still scratching my head to understand all that transpired including inappropriate and ‚ÄùTMI‚Äù comments. It is almost as though the management believes that being on the beach reigns supreme and service does not matter. It always matters and especially at $320/ night!    We selected the Laguna Riviera Resort on the Beach because it was right on the beach and less expensive than other beach hotels in the area during prime season. After checking in and going to our room anticipating one King bed, we were

Summary Heading: Final Score, Ocean View: 1,000,000. Laguna Riviera: 1
Summary: Typically, I like to focus on the positives when writing a review, and when reading negative reviews, take them with a grain of salt, or in this case a grain of sand, as people are more likely to comment on the negative than the positive when they are inspired to write.  When I read the reviews of this hotel, I saw that they were wildly variable, and since I can go up and down the scale regarding quality of hotel, decided to go with this one because of the Ocean View and the price. But despite the beautiful ocean view, I would not recommend this hotel, as the service and room quality were horrible, and I do not use that adjective lightly.   Check-in was a lengthy process due to the front desk being understaffed.  This was consistent for our whole stay and at times the front desk

We stayed 3 nights in mid-Aug. The Laguna Riviera is not luxury by any means, but it‚Äôs clean with a great location. They provide beach chairs, toys, and umbrellas. Boogie boards are available for rent for $10. The pool was barely used by anyone but us, but we enjoyed it a lot. There‚Äôs also a foose ball table and a ping pong table. There are even board games in the lobby. Parking is very tight, but we managed with a small sedan. You can walk or take the trolley anywhere you want to go in town. The only negative is the lack of A/C. We stayed in 517 and there was a portable unit in the room, but I don‚Äôt think they have enough for all rooms. It was in the 90s when we were there and would have been pretty miserable without that unit. At first, I was quite worried that the room would

Checked in for 3 nights in early July. Parking is tight, but we found a spot and kept the car parked for 3 days. The hotel is so centrally located that we did not need it at all and walked everywhere. Room 519 was great; extremely spacious with a kitchenettte (sink, microwave, regrigerator and coffee maker) , large bathroom, 2 big beds, sitting area with sofa and air conditioning. It had a large window that looked out over the side street next to the hotel and had a good side view of the ocean. With the windows open at night, we could hear the surf. It was great!  Room and bathroom were very clean., although some furninshing were starting to show signs of wear.  Room also had a small table and chairs in a patio area outside the room that overlooked the parking lot. However,

This motel is not a 3 star ,but a good 2 star, the pictures are not accurate as it is tired looking but is clean. It has a private beach where it is great to watch the surfers üèÑ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è  The staff are really good though, the pool is indoors and by the road/car park. It is in a great location which is what you are paying for but is has no A/C....they will, if available, let you have a portable machine which are very noisy but a necessity. Rooms with a view are expensive.

Summary Heading: Don't book 505, 506 or 507 unless YOU WANT HEATSTROKE!!!!!!!
Summary: So we arrived on Friday night ready to enjoy our weekend and we enter our room and the temperature is 97 degrees....yes, 97 degrees!!!! We have an accurate temperature read of the room from our device and it indicated 97 degrees.  The weather.com reading was also 97 degrees, and the internal temperature gauge located in the room indicated that it was over 90 degrees temperature in that room. We asked for an air conditioner.  NOPE, cannot have ANY AIR CONDITIONERS in 505, 506 or 507 NO MATTER  HOW HOT IT IS....YOU CAN HAVE A FAN, BUT NO AIR CONDITIONER!!!  So we sweat it out for the first night.  Well, yes, the next two nights were also over 87 degrees and close to 90 degrees every night EVEN WITH THE FAN!!!!  IT WAS TORTURE!!!! DO NOT BOOK 505, 506, OR 507 WITHOUT MAKING SURE

Spent a night here when we had to evacuate because of a local brush fire. This was the first place I found locally with a room available. It has a great location right at the beach. Our room was large; more like a suite with a separate sitting room, bedroom, and kitchen. It definitely showed wear. Also, rooms that face Coast Highway get a little highway noise.

This Resort is in a perfect location on Laguna and minutes from Ocean Avenue. We had no problem with parking. The only thing we had issues with was our room accomodations. We booked room 519 and were told upon check in there was a maintenance issue and had to be relocated. We were located to a "bigger" room so they say. The King bed was very comfortable (or we were just tired). However, the rate was worth the stay. We utilized the pool and the hot tub. Perfect walk down to Laguna beach to watch surfers!

What a nice find!  Located right on the beach with super views, this charming place is an easy walk to the main parts of town including dining and a grocery store.  The room itself is nothing great, but it IS warm and cozy.  We didn't get a room with an ocean view but by just walking a short distance from our room there was a grassy area with a bbq grill and tables with a spectacular view of the Pacific.  It's a very clean hotel and it is painted uniquely.  The staff was very friendly and helpful and a nice continental breakfast is included.  Certainly a place for a romantic weekend.

Summary Heading: Rooms and views are highly variable
Summary: As was the service and experience at this place. Decent stretch of beach is basically the best feature of this beach motel. The room we had was quite dated, not new (rug had to have been 20 years old- gave the impression of dirtiness) with a busted shower door, and when we arrived, we realized that a better room (e.g., not right on the busy street with all the accompanying noise, actually having a beach view) would have cost us double. Also we had booked on Booking.com and the desk person was exceedingly unhelpful in trying to help us negotiate a new room- we would have paid more for a better spot but ended up giving up because of the hassle. We changed our stay from two nights to one night. Breakfast included was not bad, although it was kind of awkward as served right in the

Summary Heading: Come for the view, leave for a better night's sleep...
Summary: Like the gal at the front desk put it: "the bars and restaurants in Laguna that are on the west side of PCH take advantage of their location by charging too much for average food, whereas the places to the east of PCH have to make up for the lack of a view by offering better food for the same or less money.   However, the same may be said for the hotels in Laguna Beach, including the Laguna Riviera which offers what is arguably one of the best views along this stretch of the Coast Highway but in an older facility that is in dire need of modernization. The oceanfront decks and lounge chairs are first class but the rooms are tired, the beds are worn and the bathrooms forlorn.  Even if all they did was spend a $1,000 room on new beds and pillows it would make all the difference in

Loved this room actually a suite , bedroom with tv and full bed, living room with Murphy bed that was quite comfortable , full kitchen and best of all patio with an awesome view , there was no AC but when I asked for an extra fan they brought a portable a.c. unit that cooled it down nice, I would recommend room 505

Well the room is terribly run down and you will have to ask and wait in line for towels in the morning. The staff was very nice,except for one young lady who is probably a family member was terribly rude to everyone. Apparently the owners son likes to sit in the lobby and reminisce with customers coming in for breakfast.There was OK food in the morning but the waffle makers don‚Äôt work. Parking will be a problem although there is one small covered parking garage which we managed to damage our car trying to get in and out of. Considering the rooms we rented accommodated easily 10 people there was only parking for one car. The hotel is a bit run down and very old-school but it‚Äôs all worth it for the view. We will go back again next year but will probably seek out nicer

It was a great place to get away. It was walking distance from all the shops and restaurants, we didn't have to drive anywhere. It was right on the beach too, and so, so cute! It was clean, and perfect.

I'm a little stumped about this one.  Naturally, pictures posted by the hotel are always better than the actual thing.  This property is probably pretty old, dating back to at least the fifties.  It has been remodeled, although some rooms are FAR better than others, Certainly the ones with private decks are more expensive.  The amenities are nice; pool, beach access, lots of outdoor seating areas.  The decor on the outside is pure kitsch, with murals painted everywhere.  Parking is VERY limited and tight.  I arrived around 5 pm and got the last (read..worst) space.   For $168, I got a room with a sliding glass door and patio seating area.  Could hear the beach through the open window, which I loved.  Room was TINY, and bathroom equally so, shower only. (Which has no light in it,

Summary Heading: stayed at room 302 and was wonderful
Summary: After reading so many bad reviews, I have to admit I was nervous about our stay.. however once we arrived we were so happy with our choice. yes the rooms are a bit tired, but it was actually ok when you compare the rate we paid, the views from the balcony was amazing, and not having to pay any resort fee nor parking, this was a great choice. we will be happy to come back. also the service at front desk was great, and the housekeeping did a great job.

Our family first stayed at this hotel about 30 years ago, and we have returned as often as we can. I love that there is an on-site bbq to use. We love to grill a simple dinner and eat with a view of the ocean. So fun! The pool was not as warm as it normally is this time around, but the hot tub was perfect.  This is our go-to for a relaxing beach vacation.

Summary Heading: Spacious  comfortable ocean view room with patio
Summary: Upside: Excellent large room (#410) with kitchen & dining table facing the ocean away from the street. Good bed.  Loved going to sleep and waking up hearing ocean. Loved sitting on our private patio  overlooking the ocean and watching beginner surf boarders. Pleasant walk down from resort to lovely beach. Can walk forever on beach and many accesses to street. Downside: wifi cut out after one minute in room but worked just outside the room and in the office. No help from the office staff. Continental breakfast like cheap hotel. Expected better for price of rooms. Pool faces street and has glass so people walking right by you looking in--no privacy so did not use pool. However, pluses outweigh minuses and we would come again.

Very nice place to stay in Laguna.  Wife and I stayed here for two nights.  We would definitely go back for a stay the next time we visit, Staff very attentive. Breakfast that is included is a very nice touch.
