This place is exactly as advertised.  A 3 star property in a 5 star location. You can't beat the views and the walking distance from downtown Laguna Beach.  If you like funk then this place is for you, if not go somewhere else.  The staff on the front desk in the evening was terrific, friendly and full of suggestions and help.  This staff in the morning was indifferent at best and probably closer to just plain rude.  The grounds we kept up very well so also a big shout out to that staff and they are doing a great job.

Summary Heading: Authentic Laguna Beach Funky Vintage Awesomeness!
Summary: First let me say that if you are an  looking for "authentic"  Laguna Beach experience... THIS IS IT!  It's not going to be 5 star.  It's on the water, with salt air so stuff corrodes, it's moist so things get damp, it's THE BEACH, if you leave the doors open like you should, bugs come in!.  Do not expect perfection, what you will get are SUPER nice owners and staff, an incredible view, a fun pool, with lots of interesting history.   If you're looking to be hermetically sealed up in a perfectly clean room, move on... you won't get what this place is all about.  We booked the room that you see on the website with the kitchen which was super convenient because it can get pricey to eat out all the time.  The room was very clean and spacious.  The staff was so accommodating, we were

yes its true, the room we stayed in was quite basic and a bit dingy, but for the price right on the beach, you really cant beat it. The room for us is just a place to sleep at night, we spent all our time right on the beautiful beach, and exploring around the town. There are many great restaurants, shops and a grocery store right within walking distance, and about a 30 min drive to Disney Land. We really liked that you can rent boogie boards right from the hotel, my family really had a great time here we will be back!

The only thing this hotel has going for it is how close it is to the beach. We booked a room with a private deck and partial ocean view. The 'private deck' overlooked the hotel car park and busy South Coast Highway which is lined with businesses; in order words we had no privacy at all. The ocean view was visible from the window on the corner of the room opposite the doors to the deck. These windows looked out on the hotel corridor and you could see the ocean beyond that so, if we left the blinds anyone walking by could see straight in so again we had no privacy here. We kept the blinds closed but you could still see in from outside so we had to cover the blinds for privacy. There was no air conditioning in the room so we sat out on one of the public decks one evening. This only

Summary Heading: Good basic hotel with the oceanfront experience
Summary: Just to be clear- you don't stay at this hotel for the luxurious rooms, you stay here for the ocean front rooms and the direct access to the beach below.  Having said that, we had a nice stay here. We arrived early, thankfully our room #514 had just been cleaned and the very nice front desk man checked us in.  Our room was very comfortable with a great balcony and ocean view. The bed was comfortable and the comforter very soft. Overall I'd say the room was a high 2 stars, but like I said, you're paying to stay right on the ocean.   The only thing we were truly disappointed with was the breakfast- it was pretty bleak. When you're paying $200+ a night you expect more than a Motel 6 level breakfast. They provided the cheapest and lowest quality pre-wrapped baked goods and bagels.

Stayed with family. Wonderful location to surf, paddle board and enjoy the beach. Great boutique shopping and restaurants within walking distance. Downside was the room was circa 1970's with old dated decor, dirty stained door, and pieces of dry wall missing around window sills. Contacted management in advance of visit re our needs, and was surprised no effort was made to upgrade us to a nicer room.

An ocean view is a must.  We had to switch rooms because our first room was too small but the staff moved us with no extra charge.  The second room had a full kitchen and two large rooms.  It's definitely a great location but it's not completely updated.  The staff bent over backwards to make sure all of our needs were met from the breakfast food, air conditioner and extra towels.  The beach is a short walk down the stairs and has a life guard on duty.  We had perfect weather and walked to Ralph's grocery store and the nearby restaurants.  Many of the other travelers staying at the hotel were returning guests.

We did a roadtrip with two teenage daughters and I had planned four nights here as the reviews promised a wonderful hotel. I was pretty surprised when we stayed. I cannot understand where the reviews come from: Staff was everything but friendly, with few exceptions. The girl at breakfast was always focused on her smartphone, even though buffet was empty. Breakfast was the second worst we had on the trip. Pastries that are mentioned in a previous review were cheapest low quality supermarket packed stuff. When we arrived our room was still dirty, with old towels and linen and sand everywhere. The second day no room service showed up at all.  The girls at reception are most ignorant! They hide in a small backroom on their smartphone. In the room we had three knives and one spoon

Summary Heading: Nice location, beautiful beach, the room conditions are garbage
Summary: This hotel is really a motel. There's not much for service here but the location is amazing on the bluff overlooking the ocean and within walking distance of great food and shopping. Checked in to Room 402. My wife started to cry after seeing the condition of the room. It was beyond shabby. Be careful booking here. Many of the rooms have no AC. We booked through Booking.com and they intentionally put us in an awful room even though the hotel was empty. Rooms with AC were almost $200 extra per night. They brought a portable AC to us which was great but it was clunky and super noisy and needed to be vented through a window. It wouldn't start because the power outlet looked as if it had caught on fire. We got moved to room 401. Better room, with a kitchenette and sofa but still

6 of us stayed in room 101 and we were very pleased. There is no doubt that certain things need updating, repainting and some TLC but in my opinion the situation of the hotel makes up for it. It is literally on the beach and the view is spectacular. The staff are so friendly and willing to help you out in any way possible. Breakfast was simple but pleasant, and my little brother enjoyed having a pool on site! The only thing I would say about room 101 is that the fridge is almost tipping over on an angle and has potential to cause damage. All in all this was the perfect way to end our Californian road trip.

Summary Heading: Great property, great location...the rooms need some work though
Summary: This is a very cool place right on the beach and close to town.  There is a trolley stop right outside so very convenient if you are tired of walking.  It was nice to walk down to the beach and the garden seating area has a nice view of the beach.  I was disappointed in our room though.  Two nights at over $500 and there was peeling paint and the toilet seat had all this peeling plastic coming off it; please, invest the $20 or so to put a seat on the toilet that doesn't look like it's covered in pieces of toilet paper.  We were in one of the "cheap" rooms.  I would return and stay in one of the rooms with a view but I would hope the owners would at least take care of all the rooms to fix some of the minor issues.  One other thing I disliked was not having a vent or AC.  Although

Great view. Not the nicest place in the world, but knew what we were getting when we booked and very pleased with our time there. Great location, walking distance to almost everything. Nice seating area to take in the evening sunsets. Had a pool view the first two days but had to upgrade to the ocean view. The view was worth the price even though the rooms leave a little to be desired. Overall we had a great stay and will definitely be back some day (once I forget how many people there are in California)!

Summary Heading: With just a few changes this place could be great
Summary: This place is all about the location. You are right on the water here. We had a great view of the ocean from our room and everywhere we wanted to go was within walking distance. The beds were comfortable and they offer a continental breakfast that you can eat outside on their patio overlooking the ocean. Unfortunately the pros stop there. Cons: -Our room had no air conditioning, which we dealt with since we weren't in the room much during the day and we just opened the sliding doors at night. But it would have been nice to have been informed of that when we booked over the phone. The people at the front desk kept saying they would bring us a portable AC unit, but never did. -We had to ask the front desk at least 4 times before someone finally brought in the roll away bed we

Listen to the waves. Fall asleep on a lounger overlooking the Pacific coast. Play ping pong with a friend or just splash around in the pool. Or‚Ä¶walk down a flower-lined brick path to the white sands of the Laguna Beach. You won‚Äôt stay at the Laguna Riviera to feel pampered in your room, although the units are comfortable enough, but you‚Äôll love the location.   Just to the north on PCH is the super-quaint Orange Inn, where you‚Äôll find fresh pastries, descent coffee and diverse clientele. To the south are plenty of shops, the Sandpiper Lounge (open later than other bars and it offers live music some nights), some art galleries, and restaurants. Plus, it‚Äôs a five-minute walk from my fav, the Cafe Heidelberg.   Getting around from the Riviera is easy enough; Laguna Beach‚Äôs free

I just spent a couple of days at the Laguna Riviera in June, with my daughter and 2 grandkids.  We were lucky enough to get room 508, and we all absolutely loved it, especially the huge patio!  The grandkids couldn't believe it was all ours.  The greatest thing about this hotel is how comfortable everyone makes you feel.  We usually stay at the Pacific Edge, but we fell in love with this hotel and will definitely be staying here from now on.  The desk staff were amazingly friendly and helpful, as was the breakfast lady, and everyone else we came into contact with.  They were more than generous with the breakfast items, and didn't do like at some places and watch you like a hawk, so that you feel guilty taking anything to eat.  Oh, and we also fell in love with the Tommy Bahama

My family and I have been coming to the Laguna Riviera for 20+ years.  I gave my recent stay two stars ,one for the beach and one for the view.  A few members of the staff are friendly and helpful, however, others are uninterested and disengaged.  They act put out regarding simple requests. I have watched over the last several years the property erode before our eyes.  This year our TV didn't work and it took four days for them to come get our basic cable working. Our ceiling fan above our bed did not work. The internet was very spotty and I never could download the book I wanted to read on my vacation. The rooms are very worn out and dated. As someone who has enjoyed this hotel for many years, I would like to see ownership be more accountable and take a more active role in

Couldn't give 5 Stars because we had to open the windows at night for air in our room, but the fans were wonderful, and we had the most reasonably priced room in the hotel. The location was unbelievable. We felt like we were on a movie set. If we even looked at the water, it was like someone behind a wall said, "Cue the dolphins," and out they jumped. We'll definitely upgrade to a balcony room next time. The staff was terrific. Can't, can't, can't wait to come back!

Good location, short walk to downtown. It's clean, but dated and in need of the attention that most other places take on the little things.  Nice covered pool for the kids and cute little decks facing the ocean.  No restaurant and the typical cereal/banana breakfast offered.  Parking is a challenge.  So, it's a room.  Nice bed, nice shower, Internet, and convenient location.  Nothing special so if the price fits your budget...

Great location. The place is dated, but very well taken care of. It is clean, and has all the amenities. Easy to fall asleep listening to the sound of waves crashing nearby. It was fun to take the stairs to the beach or sit overlooking at the ocean while sipping on a glass of wine.

Loved this cozy place! Everyone was so helpful and very nice! Even brought a rollaway bed to my room for my daughter. The beach was short walk and so nice to sleep with doors open and hear the waves all night.üåä

My wife and I really enjoyed staying here.  Comfortable, clean, great layout whether you want privacy or enjoy meeting new people.  Good access to beach. Easy walk for shopping and restaurants.We will be back.

Good location that is within walking distance to downtown. Hotel is showing its age and it's best days were long ago. Parking is on site and fairly secure. Breakfast is very modest. Cold cereal, very average pastries, yogurt and fresh fruit only. Staff was fairly friendly but definitely need better training. Some rooms are much better than others when it comes to lay-out and views. If you are booking this hotel for its views than make sure your room has one. Not all of them do. Wifi is open and not secure.

Ok first let me start by saying that if you're expecting the Ritz you're way off - go somewhere else - leave these people alone.  This is CLASSIC Laguna Beach, funky surfer beach, artist hotel.  I ABSOLUTELY adore this place.  It was my first time visiting even though I've walked past this hotel a hundred times.  Every single person we can in contact with was super nice, from the housekeeping to the manager/owner.  Not all rooms are going to be the same, they each have their own "look".  Yeah, its a little dated but who cares... you're ON THE WATER!  My bed was amazing comfy.    The photo you see with the kitchenette is the room we stayed in, nice and spacious with GREAT water pressure (that's a big one for me because I hate a limp shower).  The kitchenette was handy because we

Summary Heading: Noting a couple changes with the resort.
Summary: Just got home from another stay at Laguna Riviera, and there are a couple things I thought I'd mention. For the first time, I was charged for my stay upfront as opposed to paying at checkout. The front desk person said they've been doing that for about 3 months. I'm not too keen on this. Also, the wifi is spotty at best, and keeps logging you off. Not only that, but they have wifi access connected to Facebook and every time it boots you off you have to check into FB or use the password. It would be nice if they simply went back to regular wireless access and ditch the Facebook thing, because virtually anyone with an FB account will check in anyway. Inconvenient and we found ourselves using our tablets data connection and foregoing the wifi. Other than those tow issues, we had an

Summary Heading: Value for its location but needs upgrade
Summary: This hotel is right in the heart of Laguna Beach, so location is a bonus. The local free trolley stops right on the door in case you perfer not to move your car from their parking, another bonus. Breakfast is ok but you need to take it back to your room or go to one of the terraces if you want to sit. They run out of beach towels quite early. Wi-fi was not very reliable. The beds were good, but the rooms need repairs and upgrades (paint, carpet, door). In general the place shows its age. The staff is very young and not particularly attentive or skilled.

Summary Heading: Didn't even feel comfortable to stay one night.
Summary: We booked room 302. I called to see if our room was available early. The girl didn't even let me finish my sentence and told me no. When we got there it wasn't what I was expecting at all. The View was beautiful but the grounds and the room were nasty. There is additional parking on the side and there were old mattresses and garbage all around. When we got to our room the mattress was very old and sunken in, there was one stained robe in the closet, the luggage rack was broke, no warm water in the sink. I would not lay my head on that bed for nothing. The vibe I got was that I wouldn't feel safe leaving my windows open while we slept. Not every window had their screens. After talking a short drive everything in me was telling me to leave. So that is what we did. We got our stuff

I first stayed at the Laguna Riviera when I was four years old, staying several times throughout my childhood. When my fianc√©e and I came to LA to visit my brother, I had to get a room here. I'm glad I did. The room was remodeled and comfortable, also included useful amenities like a microwave and a small fridge. The view is still  amazing as I remember and the easy access to the beach is great to relax by the ocean.

Summary Heading: Not a place for a relaxing beach vacation
Summary: The service at this hotel is abhorrent. I stayed at the hotel for a wedding and multiple guests had issues or mistakes with their reservations. Additionally, the condition of the rooms is substandard. The "free" breakfast is a joke; you had to request specific items if desired, they were monitoring guest intake. While there, the electronic lock died on the room door and the maintenance man had to climb through the bathroom window and jump down. Other than beach adjacent location, this property has NOTHING going for it.

I had gone to this resort many times through the years & hope to go back again. I dropped in on a whim & limited finance but found a delightful room. Wintertime, so I skipped the pool but usually enjoy it.  Indoor heated pools are a rare wonder; it's walking back to the room that hurts. Wonderful breakfast goodies & a warm fireplace in the main office each  morning is an extra good point for this wonderful resort!

Loved loved loved.  Location is perfect.  Beach access is right there. they let you check out beach equipment right there very helpful.   We were treated amazing and loved every second. The view from our room was spectacular.

Summary Heading: On our last two stays our cars were dented(and we parked perfectly).
Summary: Stay elsewhere!  We used to go there but never again. First, as other reviews indicate it is not what it used to be.  Next, they DO have cameras covering the lot so you can follow up if your car gets dented.  And, the Police WILL come to site to make a report (even if on site management says it is private property and the police will not respond.  The police did come and help us).   (We had to pick a date below so Feb, 2016.  Our trip was late 2015 but we were too angry at hotel management to write anything)

Summary Heading: The good the Bad and the Ugly
Summary: The good...location and view  The bad...poor customer service-had to change our room 3 times to find a room with a working heater. First room was dirty and view of parking lot. Front desk and manager not to helpful or pleasant.  The ugly...non working heaters and dirty tired rooms

Summary Heading: An "Old Time" Resort/Hotel on the Water
Summary: The Laguna Riviera has so much to recommend it! The views are wonderful as the rooms are "terraced" as they go down the side of the cliffs down to the beach. Lovely for morning walks, and walks up to the center of town at low tide along the water, hopping rocks and feeling the sand between your toes! I grew up in SoCal and spent many summers with my family at a beach house in Newport, which implanted in me a lifelong love of the water and beach. The Laguna Riviera has grassy areas with barbecues, has an indoor pool and spa on the street level, and there's all that great walking up and down PCH. We often parked our car in the garage and just left it there for the week. Room 101 is where my husband and his family stayed for years. They had to "work their way down the cliff" until

Right onn the water . Doesn't look like much on the outside but they  are so accommodating and rooms are big and remodeled. They have kitchens but Free, good breakfast food available ! Our second stay and we will stay again and again!

Summary Heading: So clean, so romantic. O! So lo mio
Summary: Family owned, meticulously kept, beautiful frescoes all the way down to the beach.  We stayed in room 302 which had a gas fireplace and had been recently remodeled.  Lovely front office staff and friendly house keepers. We're coming back next year to stay for a week.  Highly recommended by 2 world travellers from Seattle.

My husband and I stayed in room 303 - a wonderful room with a great view of the ocean.  We absolutely love this place!  We had to check out a day early because my husband wasn't feeling well and the hotel gave us a refund - no questions asked.  It is very rare to get such amazing customer service.

This is probably my 5th time staying in this place. Should I'll be back again...I'm not quite sure.   Rooms: They have different rooms to choose from and it clearly states in their website. We got a surfview room and it is amazing..there is a big balcony where you can seat down and just relax. The room we got has a little kitchen on it which is a plus if your bringing some food that you want to heat up. It would have been perfect if the room was thoroughly clean up to standards..but unfortunately its not. The housekeeping was in such a rush that they didnt really do a good job, sadly this really break the deal for me. I check out the same night cause Im not really comfortable sleeping in the bed.   Amenities:  There is a bbq area which is cool, outdoor sitting area which is

The Laguna Riviera has been our family favorite for 20+ years. It definitely is a unique hotel. Each room is different and has its own view. This hotel's quirks are what create its character. With that being said, it is in desperate need of some TLC. First and foremost, the front desk staff needs a complete makeover.  With the exception of Brendan, everyone else seems clueless and not prepared. They are constantly and publicly blaming one another for something that isn't right in front of the customer.  It seems that there is just one person doing all the room cleaning. She is overloaded.  They seem very short staffed in every department. We love this place and hate to see it not do well. I'm not sure how much longer they can get away with a much needed renovation.

Room was large and ocean front view was fantastic! Large TV, flat screen,  microwave, small refrigerator.  Great beach access, and a nice continental breakfast. It was built in the 40's, but they have updated the rooms nicely. We'd stay again!!!

Summary Heading: We always enjoy our stay here.
Summary: The Laguna Riviera is an older property with character. All the rooms are different, some have private ocean front patios, some are smaller without any view at all. This time we stayed in a very pleasant room with a side view. Close enough to the ocean to open windows at night & hear the waves crashing. We had a sofa and a small kitchen. The cost of rooms have gone up as the years have gone by, but I guess that is to be expected.   I also enjoyed their enclosed, salt water swimming pool and game room where we played a couple games of ping pong.

Summary Heading: No what it used to be
Summary: Was here recently in May with my daughter. This has been our go to close getaway destination for a long time and we have loved it and told everyone about this secret gem. I do have to say that they are no longer on their game here. The place is in  desperate need of some loving care. Our room, 301 that we always stay in needs some repair. The toilet paper holder was gone and one side was missing. The tile around the shower was broken out in several places. The front desk afternoon and evening personnel are not helpful at all. You can reserve a BBQ for 1/2 hour but what can you cook on a BBQ in 1/2 hour except hot dogs and hamburgers. We are looking for someplace else now because unfortunately this is no longer worth the money.

One of our 'go to' places when we visit the area, probably our 5th visit.  Great location and service.  The rooms are a tad worn, but that's not necessarily a bad thing, always clean.  The thing we like most about the place is it's character and proximity to the beach and views from the room.  If you want the best view, get an 'ocean front' room.  You are close enough to let the waves crashing on the shore serenade you to sleep each night and the views are amazing.  If you're looking for the Ritz-Carlton, this is not the place you should be, but one thing any 5* property can't replicate is charm and this place sure does have it, in my opinion.....

Summary Heading: Incredible Experience!  Wonderful place to Stay, Salt water POOL and HOT TUB!!
Summary: My friend and I were driving around California and WE didn't have a room for the night and we went to the hotels tonight app and found this place. It didn't look super great on the little phone, (sorry) so we thought we'd take a drive by, since the price was right.  The fellow at the desk, Brian, said he would honor the price on the app and had Tony show us the rooms we could choose from.  We LOVED room 302 with a VIEW of the ocean and a private DECK!  We were surprised the room had a FIREPLACE, which for me was a Huge BONUS as I live in Hawaii and don't see those too often. The young fellow Tony, was super sweet, Kind, fun, and super patient and took our bags to our room and told us he would be there to carry them back to the car for us tomorrow, not to worry.  It was nice to

Summary Heading: Buyer beware - Bait and switch on reservation rate
Summary: I made an online reservation for this hotel in early May, less then 3 weeks before my arrival date.  The price was $199 per night for Memorial Day weekend.  Upon arrival the hotel was swamped with people checking in.  In a rush to help the front desk get through all the check ins, I signed my paperwork without reviewing it, never expecting that my nightly rate would have increased by $105 per night.  I assumed it was an honest mistake when checking out.  But no, I was told (in a very condescending voice) that everyone knows that we raise our rates on holiday weekends and you (I) even initialed the rate upon check in.  Well, silly me, I didn't think that my reservation rate, made less then 3 weeks ago, wouldn't be honored.  And what if I had flown in from out of state for

My wife and I stayed two nights in April. She had stayed there before and wanted to go back. The location, the views, the feel of the 50's and 60's...this place is just hard to beat for couples. I was impressed at the number of local  people from Laguna who were staying here as a weekend treat. Great beach access, free parking, great restaurants in walking distance....what more could you want? I suggest that you research the different rooms and their views. There are many different layouts and views.

Summary Heading: Relaxing stay after busy days at Disneyland
Summary: This hotel was perfect for what we needed after 3 days at Disneyland. Just parked the car and then after a quick walk down the block for groceries parked our butts for nothing but ocean views, sounds and gorgeous sunsets plus whales and dolphins.  Loved the direct access to the beach, the kitchen and grills.  It is true that it is a little tired, warn and could stand a good deep cleaning but found it to be surface clean and comfortable plus spent most of the time out of the room except to sleep and cook. Also nice to have the indoor pool, hot tub and sauna.  Can't wait to come again.

Stayed in Ocean view Room 508 which has incredible views of the ocean below (see pics). I have been coming to this hotel for over 30 years because of the fantastic view from the rooms, however, on this trip! Yuck! I couldn't believe my eyes! The attached pics say it all. Yes, that's right, the sun deck patio table is a folding card table that they had to find in a dumpster and the deck chairs!! I was afraid to sit on them without protection! Shame on you management!! When one night is $296 plus 20 percent tax you could at lease have a descent patio table, chairs and umbrella! And while I'm venting, who had the brilliant decorating idea to put bathroom sconces in the living room area?! Good grief! BTW, take a look at the bathtub! I was afraid to catch something! Pure filth! The

If this hotel weren't on the beach, they'd go out of business because no one would stay here. It's ugly, inside and out and is extremely outdated. We didn't even feel comfortable walking around our room without shoes on because the whole place was gross.   The bed did seem clean and the view was amazing. But I'd never consider staying here again.

Highly recommend this cool hotel. Location was perfect. Right next to the water. The view from our room was incredible. The room was nice. It included a microwave and small refrigerator. Also included with our stay was breakfast in the lobby.  I will definitely stay there again when I'm in the area.

This hotel from the outside is not much to look at but we soon fell in love with it soon as we saw the ocean views from the deck and our room. Stayed on Laguna Beach as a couples getaway and birthday gift to my girlfriend. After searching high and low, decided on the Rivera and I am so happy I did. The location is perfect!!! We were in walking distance of so many amazing restaurants and art galleries. Most importantly about the location is it's on the ocean side of the PCH which means great views and low noise. Free parking and wifi, nice little quaint breakfast, really helpful staff. Mini fridge in the room, wine glasses and a pretty comfy big bed. The room had a view dings and chips but with views like we had who wants to stay in the room. Also the hotel is right on the water

While as they say..."You Cannot Judge A Book By It's Cover"...LRBR definitely posses that appeal!!!  Located in the heart of Laguna..Riviera is a Blast from the Past...historical landmark and amazing inviting staff...Joseph who hosts his guest with native socal style is the spirit of this gem...food...shopping everything close by!!!  Must add to your SOCAL tour!!!

This hotel is a perfect place to bring your family. Spacious rooms with balcony & ocean views, heated indoor pool & hot tub and continental breakfast with Belgian waffles! Located close to downtown, but just far enough away to be relaxing. Next to a killer ramen house üòç and incredible beach access.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and we are happy you enjoyed your stay and discovered the new Ramen house next door.  We look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: I have stayed at this resort twice and I cannot find one fault with it. Is one one the best places I have ever stayed. I was there the first time in 2008 and  visited again and the rooms were remodeled and now near perfect.
Manager Response: Thanks for sharing your experience staying at the Laguna Riviera.   We look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: (i posted this on yelp too btw)  i LOVED this place. It's a little funky, but in a good way. The staff was super friendly, and upgraded us just because! our room was amazing. we woke up to a panoramic ocean view, and enjoyed morning coffee watching surfers from our wrap around balcony. if you can get it, i recommend room 508 :)  also our room had an electric fireplace, which was the perfect touch.  i can't wait to go back and visit again. i'm attaching the panoramic photo i took from our balcony.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review and you discovered one of my absolute favorite rooms. 508 has some of the most amazing views being perched out front on the top floor.  Thanks again & Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: Dates of visit: 12/18-20 2015 Room: 402  My Wife and I were in Laguna for our yearly December Sawdust Festival visit. We've stayed at Laguna Riviera Beach Resort multiple times. This year's visit was seriously impacted by our Hotel "Neighbors" who thought it would be a good idea to pile 8-10 people in one room and party to all hours of the night...Thanks you guys ! A similar circumstance happened to us there before. The second night of this stay "Brenden" relocated us to Room 201 (Awesome) and was very helpful (@1030pm). We were also given a $100.00 credit for our trouble. I'm not sure right now if we'll ever return to this Hotel...Not because of the Accommodations or Staff but because of how unruly guests are dealt with. There was zero difference in the behavior of our

We stayed at Laguna Riviera for our Anniversary over the weekend.  We're so happy to see Brynden still there and he was very helpful as always.  We used to come here 3 to 4 times a year until eight years(?) ago.  We're so glad to be back to this family operated nice ocean view place.  Since then most of the rooms were renovated.  Our room number was 201 and we liked the location with the great ocean view however some people might not love it, because the bathroom was not updated.  My husband still loved the room b/c #201 was always his favorite room.  If your room doesn't have the ocean view there is nice court yard with several patio tables and chairs to enjoy gorgeous sunset over the pacific ocean.  Overall we really enjoyed our stay and definitely will be back.  Only the

Been coming to this privately owned hotel for over a decade, with kids or as a couple, Laguna Rivera offers a unique and very relaxing experience of a shot at a beach life as close as it gets. Place has it's own private access to the beach, offers rooms with kitchens as well as a large grilling station. No corporate intimidation or services for that matter and that is what I am lookiNg for to get away from all, the routine hospitality chain nonsense. My wife and I get the best and the freshest seafood to grill at Ralf's across the street, also we make our own breakfast while overlooking the ocean, relaxing and having a grand time!

Summary Heading: Great views of the Pacific from many rooms and common areas.
Summary: We have stayed at Laguna Riviera twice and we have really enjoyed both stays. The front desk staff, Brendan, was very helpful when necessary. Tony was accommodating with our requests and really friendly.   The rooms we have stayed in needed some minor maintainence but have been updated.   Overall, this property has great views of the Pacific Ocean!!!

We stayed at the Riviera for week for a family vacation. After reading the mixed reviews we were a little unsure. However, we were pleasantly surprised! Definitely a great place to stay overall! The staff were great especially Brendan who ran the front desk in the evenings.The rooms, though a little worn, were clean and comfortable. The views were definitely the best part! Absolutely stunning! Only few downfalls, we found the mattresses in the pull out beds really need to be replaced. We had booked two rooms and ending up switching the mattress as one of the pull out beds was not in use. Also, I was a bit disappointed with the continental breakfast. The few things they did have were great quality  (the bagels and waffles were especially good). But we found that the options were

Mixed reviews all over the Internet ....my vote is this is the perfect place for a 60/70 (as in the year) type beach vibe.  Looked hi and low for a review on Room 202 and found zippols.  The sounds and breezes are wonderful üßÄüç∏üå¥üèÑüèæ

This place was recommended to us by a good friend. Unfortunately we did not have the good experiences she has had over the years. All the rooms she recommended were booked so I asked the reservationist to recommend a private, romantic room. He suggested room 410. Upon arrival the gal at the front desk was unfriendly and rude. Handed us worn out beach towels to use. They gave no directions or instructions for the room or parking. Never mentioned breakfast or anything else. Found our room by ourselves located in the corner of the parking lot. Housekeeping had their cleaning tools stacked out in front. Room was dark upon entry and had terrible smell of overuse of air freshener. Bathroom lights were burned out, fridge was broken and the lanai overlooked the roof of another room with

Summary Heading: Great Location, but that's about it.
Summary: I'm not a person that likes to complain, and will usually only write a review when I have something nice to say, but I can't bite my tongue here.  I will say the location is excellent, as well as the view from the courtyard area.  That's where any compliment I have ends.    I stayed in room 301 (pictures attached).  As soon as my girlfriend and I walked in the room I could tell this was not what I was looking for.  The hard chemical citrus smell was over-bearing, and the room itself was very unbecoming.  The floors are a cheap laminate, and were filthy.  Walking around in bare feet you could feel the sand everywhere, and we had yet to go to the beach.  IMO, laminate floor, or any hard surface for that matter is definitely not preferable in a beach hotel room for obvious reasons,

Summary Heading: I would probably stay here again.
Summary: The location of the hotel is great, you can walk to the downtown shops and galleries and there are many good restaurants close by.  We had room 517. Although it doesn't have a balcony or patio it does have an ocean view if you stick your head out the window. And it's on the top floor so we were able to leave the windows open even when we went out for the day. There's no A/C but the ocean breeze is good and they do have fans if you ask.  We were 3 adults so having a queen sleeper sofa was why I choose this room. However, the sofa was not usable as a bed. The staff seemed to know that the sofas are useless and offered us a roll-a-way bed which wasn't much better. This is the main reason for the low review. I think if it's advertised as a sleeper sofa it should be usable as such.
Manager Response: Hi Karen3025,  Thank you for the review and we are glad you enjoyed your stay and the amazing views. I appreciate you mentioning the sofa sleeper. They get a lot of use over the summer and this one will be replaced. Now that the heavy use of summer is over we are starting our annual room services to make sure paint, furniture, ect are all in proper condition and ready for next season.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: This was our second time staying here and I must say we had a better experience this time.  Staff was friendlier and we had a larger room with air conditioning this time.  The best thing about this hotel is the location.  Right on the water and close to the village.  You can just park your car and walk. The rooms could use some maintenance on them but they are clean.  The air conditioner was loud and we had a room above us so at times it was noisy.  Parking is a challenge here and one night we came back with the car at 9:30 pm and got the last spot in the garage.  But for the price and location we will stay here again.
Manager Response: Hi Sassiemama,  We are glad you enjoyed your stay and found everything to your liking. We have just ended the summer season and it takes its toll on the room. For the next couple months we are painting, repairing and replacing as needed and getting ready for the next season.   Thanks for your review and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: Great Location! Room Not So Great.
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary a few weeks back and heard about this hotel through a coworker of my husband's who said this was a great place to stay for the price. Let me break this hotel down...  The good:  You can't be the price and the location is great. I don't believe you can get a better price of a hotel that's right off the beach in Laguna. We enjoyed sitting in the courtyard overlooking the beach. It's a cool place to have a few cocktails, watch the sunset and meet new people. Walking down to the beach from it's private entry was perfect!  It's located right in the heat of things, walking distance from restaurants and shops. Right across the street is Okura Sushi, this is one of the best sushi bars we'd ever went to.  My husband, who'd brought
Manager Response: Dear Kim K,  Thank you for your detailed review.  I am pleased to know you appreciate the location and complimentary continental breakfast, views and patios spaces.  If you would like to write me I would like to know which room you had. If sounds like it was not serviced properly and I would like to review that with the company that provides housekeeping service. For the most part we have found them to be very good. They handle the Marriott and other large properties, but on occasion we find shortfalls and always want to address them as soon as possible.  We have in the past provided iPod compatible clock radios property wide and some premium rooms still have them. The issue is we soon found is that not only did docking ports become outdated quickly the radios themselves seemed to disappear at a steady pace.  Artwork varies from room to room and some have even have high end originals from a prominent gallery.  The free parking is tight but works and I agree with you about people who block the entrance. It is an issue we deal with on a regular basis. Even though a sign sits squarely over the door asking patrons to pull forward and not block the entrance, they still do. We regularly have to ask our guests to pull behind the office or into a parking space to allow traffic to continue to flow.   Thank you again for sharing your experience and next time you choose to stay with us please feel free to contact me directly. If you are able to book early, I will be happy to point you to a well appointed room with amazing views and private deck. I would like to make sure you have a great time and experience what keeps our happy guests returning time and again.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: This hotel never disappoints. It is our "go-to" for a relaxing getaway on the beach. The free breakfast is a nice perk, and on our most recent visit, they had added waffles to the choices. There are beach chairs and umbrellas available to borrow from the office, so you don't have to bake in the sun if you don't want to. They also furnish pool/beach towels. Speaking of the pool, it was the perfect temperature and sparkling clean. We took advantage of the on-site barbecue grills and made ourselves dinner on the patio while watching the sun set. We couldn't have asked for a better trip.
Manager Response: Dear Shopgirl5934,  We are honored to be your "Go-to" hotel for for a relaxing getaway. Thats what it is all about when you visit Laguna Beach and stay at the Laguna Riviera. I am please to hear you enjoyed the waffles. This simple addition has been a big hit and we enjoy seeing how much fun our guests kids have making them fresh each morning.  Glad to hear you enjoyed something that never fails to please, making your own fresh grilled dinner from the front patio as the sun sets. We even take time to do this ourselves and it is a real treat.   Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy Travels,  -Kort

Summary: This family owned motel is a gem, for the price, you can't beat the location and amenities. Amazing beach access and views, beach equipment, breakfast, and really everything you need for experiencing the beach. The location also perfect for walking Laguna Beach.  If you want a flawless room with new decor and valet parking, this is not your place. If you want a casual and friendly, old California motel with amazing Laguna access, then this is your place. I will recommend this place to my friends and stay here every chance I get to return.
Manager Response: Dear NMJ11,  Thanks for sharing your experience here on TripAdvisor. You are quite accurate we are a family friendly hotel that is the epitome of classic Laguna Beach so much so, our family is now in its 6th generation living here. We invite everyone to come stay, enjoy and relax without any pretense. That is the real Laguna.  Located on the best beach in town and within walking distance of many galleries, stores and restaurants you park your car (sans valet) and unless you travel out of town probably never touch it again until you check out.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy Travel,  -Kort

Summary: Don't believe the photos of this facility posted online. I regret not taking any of our room because this place is right out of the dark ages. The people at the front desk were not helpful at all and other guests were complaining about illegally parked cars that blocked the lot. Everything went downhill from there. Our room had no central air conditioning. There was a portable AC unit that was more like a toy. The carpet was so dirty we hated to even walk on it. The breakfast here was unlike any other. You do not get your food - a person gets it for you upon request, and there was extremely limited seating. You even have to request coffee. Most hotels have coffee available 24/7. And that's another thing - the lobby is locked until breakfast starts at 8:00 so you cannot watch TV
Manager Response: Dear GuyFromAtlanta_GA,  We are sorry to hear you did not enjoy your stay with us and felt that the pictures online do not match the rooms. Please keep in mind we have 42 rooms and a beach house and they are all different. If you book the same room that you see online it will be much the same when you check in. The only difference is some rooms may show carpet online and have since been upgraded to wood flooring.  While illegal parking on our property is quite rare when it does occur, as noted by the posted signs, we tow the trespasser to make room for our guests. We apologize if your stay was interrupted by such activity.  You are correct not all rooms have A/C and this is called out on our website on a room by room basis. However the portable units do a good job when needed. Being a classic 1940's Laguna Beach destination the electrical service provided by the power company unfortunately is not robust enough to support A/C in every room. The Rivieras recent upgrades to LED's property wide and other conservation measure may allow us to add more A/Cs in the near future as we reduce power consumption.  I'm sorry that the complimentary continental breakfast was not to your liking. We have the pastries baked fresh every morning, coffee & tea, juices, cereals, fruit, hot/cold as well as fresh cooked waffles to choose from. Yes it is not all self serve and our staff serves guests keeping in line with the requirement of our food license. Coffee is available in all rooms to be used at anytime you wish 24 hrs a day, or in the office during operating hours of 8:00 am to midnight. Should you wish a traditional sit-down breakfast there are several excellent choices within a one to two minute walk from the property. Even though our license does not allow a full service restaurant we are happy to recommend one of the many located nearby.  To receive towels for the pool you simply request them at the front office located 10 feet from the entrance to the pool. Just like the umbrellas, and beach chairs they are complementary for your use and we are happy to swap them out as needed.  We appreciate that you you enjoyed the amazing views here at the Laguna Riviera.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: Nice, quaint hotel overlooking the ocean.  We stayed here for one night and were able to make a last minute reservation.  The young man at the front desk was very polite and helpful and explained that some rooms don't have AC.  We had just attended a funeral and needed a place to unwind and reflect and he was very accommodating which put us as ease.  Perfect location right in the middle of the action in Laguna.....awesome views..we'll stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Clay,  Thank you for taking the time to write your review and our condolences for your loss.  We appreciate you chose the Laguna Riviera to take some time to relax, reflect and enjoy the views. Sometimes just slowing down and relaxing is the best thing, and we encourage it here at the Laguna Riviera.  We look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: I have been coming up to Laguna for the past few years. this is my favorite place to stay its steps away from the beach. laid back, relaxing, not a resort-y feel-- it gives off the family owned and run place. I really do enjoy coming here and can't wait until the next trip
Manager Response: Dear Wheatley,  Thanks for choosing the Laguna Riviera. I have to agree we are a bit of the anti-resort in the sense that you don't have to dress up or try to impress. This is Laguna laid back, relaxed and chill in the sun. Being the only original family owned hotel left in town we enjoy sharing the local love of Laguna with all who stay here.  We look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: Had such a great weekend here.  The rooms are nice and clean. The view of the beach is beautiful. Amazing sunsets!   And the staff very welcoming and informative.  Everything is within walking distance. Can't wait to do it again!
Manager Response: Hi Annalisa,  First off Happy Birthday! We appreciate you chose the Laguna Riviera for your celebration. Sunsets become very special this time of year becoming particularly vibrant and fiery looking. What a great way to celebrate.  Thank you and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: Stunning ocean views with a friendly vibe.
Summary: Stayed in a suite (one double bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, dining table, lounge with fold up, extremely comfy, sofa bed). Immediately struck by the incredible views as soon as you enter the complex. Loads of seating/lounging areas and terraces to soak in the surrounding area. Private zig zag walkway down to the beach where you can walk along to the centre of Laguna Beach within minutes. Absolutely fell in love with the area. Made a dream holiday just that!
Manager Response: Hi Joany,  Thank you for sharing your experience while staying with the Laguna Riviera. Even living here the views never cease to amaze and sharing the views from our property with everyone who visits is a joy.   It is great that you were able to enjoy the proper and our wonderful town. It is a unique place where relaxing and unwinding is unavoidable. Thank you for allowing the Laguna Riviera to be part of your Dream Holiday.  We look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: This is our 10th year staying at the Laguna Riveria beach Resort. We use to come to take our children back to school shopping as a bonding time with them before our schedules got busy, and of course we would get a bigger room then. But now they are grown & gone. So now we come for us, and book room 304. It is a smaller room, King bed, and it has air conditioning, beautiful ocean view, a couch, flat screen TV, microwave, refrigerator. It has no desk as other rooms have, as it is a smaller room.      The hotel has, for hotel guests use, beach chairs, beach towels, beach umbrellas, for your use free and boogie boards. They also have a free continental breakfast. But we prefer to walk to breakfast and enjoy the local breakfast places such as Zinc's and Penguin's.       We have tried
Manager Response: Hi Julie,  Thank you for being a long time guest of the Laguna Riviera. Your 10 years of patronage speaks volumes and we are honored. Being the last privately held, family owned hotel in town we take great pride in sharing our location, local knowledge and authentic beach/art colony experience with all that stay with us.  Now that your kids are grown and you are coming as a couple you get to enjoy the off season rates and what I consider the best weather of the year starting mid September. The temperatures are perfect, the water, warm and the town is not so busy with the summer season ended.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We love Laguna Riviera. Location is fantastic right on the beach and within walking distance of so many shops and restaurants. Sunsets are spectacular. The ocean is full of beautiful kelp beds and fish and is inviting for surfers, paddle boarders, swimmers, and body surfers. We've stayed here dozens of times and will be back.
Manager Response: Hi Kathleen,  Thank you for the great review and we appreciate that you enjoy our location and views. We are fortunate to sit on one of the best beaches in Laguna a true favorite of the locals. Great diving, surfing, skim boarding or simply watching the people enjoy the waves and the dolphins passing by.  We look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: A hidden gem in Laguna Beach
Summary: This property is a great location right on the beach and a great value for its location. We have stayed here numerous times and always love the view and great service. The reception are happy to accommodate you and even offered a discount the one trip where a room change was necessary due to a previous guest that spilled something on floor. We have stayed in room 508 which is a ocean front top floor suite with huge balcony right on the ocean. This room has plenty of windows and magnificent views. It also has a wet bar and fireplace like many at the laguna riviera and air conditioning.   Note: some of the rooms do not have AC but there is always a nice ocean breeze and you can always request a portable AC unit which we had in rooms 509, and 514 on last trips.   The housekeeping
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful and thorough review.  You hit on one of my favorite rooms. 508 has truly a magical view.   A bit of history that you may not know about that room. Author Pearl Buck used to stay there and sit on the deck writing some of her many famous books. The Riviera is actually credited in a couple of them for providing a relaxing and inspiring location for her to write.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We love the Laguna Riviera! Our family has been staying here for over 20 years. The location is absolutely perfect...walking distance to all the great restaurants and shopping. Many of the rooms have their own decks and several rooms are ocean view. Bryndon @ the front desk is very helpful and always goes above and beyond to make sure all your needs are met. He has gone out of his way to help make sure our stay is great. Thanks Bryndon for all your hard work and your approachable personality. See you next year!
Manager Response: What an honor to have you and you family staying with ours for over 20 years. The Riviera has become a multi generational tradition for many who used to stay with us as kids with their parents and now as parents with their kids.   Thank you so much for the wonderful review and We'll 2nd your thank you to  Bryndon for doing a great job!  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: A true gem in Laguna Beach!! Had an amazing time with the family! The views were breathtaking!! Thank you to the attentive and professional staff that made sure all of our needs were taken care of! Everyone I came across was great! I can't wait to return to this paradise!!
Manager Response: Dear  Silva,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the Laguna Riviera here on TripAdvisor.  We appreciate the feedback and are so pleased that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us.  The views are indeed breathtaking, even having grown up here they never fail to amaze, and continue to inspire all who take the time to relax and sink into the breathtaking  beauty that is here for all to enjoy.  Thank you again, and we look forward to your next visit to our little slice of paradise.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: Loved our time at Laguna Beach
Summary: We arrived at Kaguna Beach and had concerns over the room we had booked (but it was the only one available on the website when we booked 2-3 hs earlier) - the staff were very helpful and showed us a couple of options which did mean we would need to move after 2 nights into another room BUT so glad we did.  We had room 516 which had a lovely ocean view with 2 burner hod and fridge, lovely table and chairs on balcony.  Was worth the extra money easily as made our stay at Laguna so much more successful - children loved it, we loved it,  breakfast was very good and welcome benefit of stayng here.
Manager Response: Thank you for the lovely review. I am glad we were able to accommodate your stay on such short notice. The summer is very busy and often sells out months in advance. Your room 516 has a wonderful enclosed lanai and a private balcony with great ocean views. It is often unavailable so your timing was perfect.  Thank you for the compliment on the complimentary continental breakfast. The pastries are made and delivered fresh every morning and the addition of the self serve waffle station has become a huge hit.  I have no doubt you enjoyed our eclectic beach front artist community and appreciate that you chose the Laguna Riviera for your accommodations. When you visit next we look forward to seeing you again.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: The worst hotel that I have found during my tour of Usa. Bad service at reception...the staff wasn't professional. The room was dirty, the bed was dirty. I have asked the change of room...the receptionist wasn't surprised by my complaints...he give me another room. The new room was dirty and poor too.  I stayed here because the rate was not refundable...otherwise I run screaming!! The spa was rusty and rain inside. The breakfast...where was the breakfast??!! There was nothing to eat...I had asked an orange juice and they give me a little confit juice. I have pay 130$. Than I think that we can't talk about a "resort". This is a motel. In Usa you can find a lot of lovely place and this is not one of them. I disappointed. The photos that you find in web are not true. ..my  room

Summary Heading: Looking for charm and quaintness...??  This is the place for you!
Summary: I just spent the past 3 days at this beachfront hotel for a SUP/SUP Yoga/Fitness teacher training event hosted by Sunset Stand Up Paddle and Olympus SUP Fit!  This place is charming and nestled right on the coast in beautiful Laguna Beach.  Unpretentious charm, accommodating staff and views to die for!  I highly recommend this  cozy, vintage treasure <3 #lagunasupyogis2015
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and we are glad to hear that not only did you enjoy all the hotel has to offer, but were one of the first to experience the new Stand Up Paddle and yoga events. Its sure to be a bit hit as we move into summer.  Thanks again & Happy Travels,  -Kort

Summary: I have visited Laguna Beach many times over the last 30 years but stumbled upon this place. From the street, it doesn't look like much but you get back to your room and it seems like you're on vacation immediately. There is a Ralphs grocery store across the street so shopping and using the microwave and refrigerator in the room is very convenient. It's walking distance to just about anywhere in Laguna Beach. I stayed here for business but I am definitely returning with my family.
Manager Response: Dear Irene T,  We are so glad you stumbled across our little slice of paradise. Being built in the 40's there is not much to see from the street but enter the property and as you say, "Your on vacation."  With terraced patios, decks, gardens and a pathway leading to the oceans edge it is like stepping into a tropical escape.  Thank you for sharing and we look forward to having you return with your family.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: If you want the ritz, this is nit it.  This is a beach casual hotel on the water.  Small, charming and perfect for me.  I love Laguna.  I love hearing the waves, walking in the sand and people watching.  If I want to be pampered, I go somewhere else.  This is the perfect beach experience.  Great views.  On the beach. Good beds, kitchens, dining room and a private patio big enough for a family.  I will be back!!
Manager Response: Dear Skier003,  Thank you for the wonderful review and we are glad you enjoyed your stay at a true Laguna Beach original. Our goal is to share what living in Laguna at the beach is like with our guests.   Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We got the fabulous opportunity to work out of the "beach bungalow" which I highly recommend!!! Not only was the owner and staff above accommodating, the bungalow had an amazing deck, and a huge window overlooking the surfers, whales and dolphins!!!  This location actually made it really hard to go to work every day!!! We would start by having breakfast and coffee on the patio watching 10 to 15 Wales go by every morning, and being entertained by the surfers.  The hotel is so close to tons of food and shopping, all within walking distance!!  The bungalow was perfect for a group of friends, family with kids or coworkers!  It slept 6 easily, A huge kitchen and a nice big bathroom with the laundry!
Manager Response: Dear Heather W,  Working from the Beach Bungalow..... now thats a great job you have ;-)  . You hit on my favorite of many distractions and attractions here at the Laguna Riviera.  One can easily lose track of time becoming immersed in the collage of beach activities and migrating wildlife that are part of the amazing views from the bungalow and the hotel.   Sitting on the Bungalows massive 800 square foot patio just feet above the sand is a vacation in itself. Even those who live here in town are known to rent it for special occasions and the occasional staycation.  We appreciate the time you took to share your experience, and look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: This resort is perfect, it is comfortable and charming.  You truly feel like you are in a beach city.  They have a variety of rooms, some with full kitchens some with just a fridge and microwave.  Their rooms have different ocean views as well.  Their website easily guides you through choosing the room that will suit you.  They are located right on the beach and have a private access. They provide beach chairs and beach towels for use during your stay. They also have a beach cabana massage service available by appointment.  There are several outdoor decks available to all guests, one has gas grills for your cook out.  The views from these decks are spectacular. I watched the sunset over Catalina Island many nights during my two week stay.  Their swimming pool and hot tub are in
Manager Response: Dear Judi G,  That you for the great review and letting us know the property, staff and location met your travel and vacationing expectations.  It is always wonderful to hear from our guests. We appreciate you took the time to share your experience, and look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: A Bit on Old Laguna right on the Ocean!
Summary: The Riviera is a delightful assortment of rooms cascading down the planted hillside with a private switch back trail to the beach.  The exterior walls are whimsically painted with trompe-l'oeil flowers and vines (Laguna is famous for its artists).  The gardens are lovely - I can still smell the Jasmine and Roses.  A wonderful central grass garden patio with barbecues is shared by guests.  The service is excellent - just ask at the front desk (Brandon and Chris) for anything you need and they quickly accommodate you.  We have gone there for 20 years with my  mother for her birthday (this year the 99th!) and we have also had family reunions there.  It is traditional Laguna at its heart - watching surfers and whales, listening to the waves, lounging on he beach (towels and
Manager Response: First off, Happy Birthday to you wonderful mother now 99 years young. What a wonderful mile stone.  Thank you for the great review and compliments to the staff and property. You are spot on, we are not the Ritz, nor is that our goal. The Ritz is an amazing chain of properties with plenty of protocols an expectations. The Riviera however is here for you to relax, unwind, and not have to worry about what to wear when you go pick up your complimentary continental breakfast.   The Laguna Riviera is here to share with our guests the real Laguna Beach experience. Sitting on one of the best beaches in town, surrounded by local shops, restaurants and art galleries, you get it all. Bring some comfortable clothes and leave your cares at home and relax and enjoy the laid back Laguna Beach lifestyle.  From our family to yours we are honored you chose the Laguna Riviera for your family gatherings and to celebrate such a special occasion. Thank you again, and we  look forward to your mothers 100th birthday.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: Nice direct beach access, but beware of bad front desk service
Summary: Nice location, close to stores and right across from Okura, which is a great restaurant for a quick, fun bite. Also has direct access to the beach right from the hotel with decent decor. However, the wall is extremely thin (beware of noisy night), "semi private" balcony really felt communal, and the attitude at the front desk was sulky, or snobby at best. I suppose it's common for popular resorts such as Laguna Beach but certainly is not enticing for return.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience.   I am surprised and concerned that the person you encountered at our front desk came across as "snobby" as that is the exact opposite of what we are all about. Being the last locally owned and family operated property in town, we always strive to share the relaxed beach experience and make our guests feel comfortable and laid back. Snobbery is not in our DNA, and we have contacted you privately to learn more, and better understand who you encountered so we can address it personally with the employee. It may be common, as you say, at popular resorts, but not at the Laguna Riviera.  I am glad to know you enjoyed the private direct access to the beach, location and room decor. When you next visit Laguna please consider us again and Im sure you will find the desk warm and friendly, and let me know your here so I can say hello and personally welcome you back.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: Short and sweet review lol!  What an awesome place to stay for the night.  the room, 301, was well appointed with a wet bar and microwave, king size bed and a pretty decent view - minus the roof under us.  The hotel is not much from the curb but the grounds past the parking lot were pretty cool!  The hotel goes down to the beach and the courtyard area has two grills - 1 that was in better shape than another, but it worked well nonetheless!  It was truly a great night.  The staff was really cool and really nice.  Can't wait to go back again and again!
Manager Response: We love to hear the Riviera is an Awesome Place. We think so too, but we are a bit biased... ;-) Your comments are we'll appreciated. Thank you.   It sounds like you enjoyed one of the many great pastimes at the Riviera, grilling on the BBQ patio overlooking the Pacific Ocean. While a simple pleasure, it is one that never gets old especially when you get to eat while watching another amazing sunset.  We can't wait to see you back again.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We stayed 2 days as a short side trip. Great location, close to the beach & shopping, big areas to sit & enjoy the ocean, indoor pool & hot tub, a bbq area. Continental breakfast.Even though it's old, we enjoy it. It is fairly well maintained, but a few paint chips, wallpaper tearing. Our bed was WONDERFUL!  We stayed in room 403 which contains a King size bed and a Murphy bed in the living room. My only complaint was no fan available in living room for Murphy bed. You must leave all the windows open to get air. We would stay here again though.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us and sharing your experience. I wish we knew you needed a fan as we have several available and deliver a requested.   We are glad you enjoyed the comfortable beds, amazing views, and complimentary continental breakfast.  Your comments about the wallpaper have been noted. It is a non-stop project combating the ocean air and morning sea mist.   Thanks again and we look forward to your next visit.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: Impromptu trip to the beach with our family of 4. Staff was helpful.  I felt the grounds were well maintained and charming. Would stay here over a franchised hotel any day.  Room was clean and had all the amenities we could need.  We didn't splurge for a balcony or full view stayed in room 307 (?) each room is unique at this hotels layout. We could still see the ocean from our window and heard waves all night. Extremely relaxing.  Breakfast was typical but great pastries that I hope they continue to serve.  Only complaint would be the hours served 8:30 was kind of late for us. We wanted to grab some food before hitting the beach.  Pool was kind of weird on the street. Provided chairs and toys for the beach are nice but you have to haul and it's a steep climb. Totally worth it.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience.  The Riviera is certainly not a chain and has it's own true Laguna character and history having been in the family since it was built and first opened. I appreciate your comment about the pool. As a bit of history when the property opened in 1948 having a pool was not common and was a big draw to travelers. At the time it was the practice to place them in view of the road to attract customers. So we could consider that an early form of marketing.   The pastries are indeed awesome. They are baked fresh and delivered every morning. Since we switched the positive feedback has been great.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: Chipping paint and entry by a dumpster don't make a good first impression.  We did love our large clean room (306) with full ocean view and enjoyed our two-night stay.  Scraping and repainting would make this place look so much better.  Two wonderful restaurants within walking distance are the Orange Inn, which looks like a cute little beach shack, and The Cliff restaurant where dining oceanside at sunset is awesome!
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and taking time to share your experience.   The lower parking entrance, as you mention, is not our most attractive feature as it is where the dumpster sits for it's twice daily collection. Since we are right on the ocean I often feel it is like maintaining the Golden Gate Bridge. The painting and repairs never stop and if they do things can get away from you. That entire side of the building is on our hit list after we complete the new paint in the pool and main entrance to the property.  You made a great choice with two of Laguna's oldest and most iconic restaurants. They are understated and very Laguna with great food. The Cliff is my favorite casual lunch spot with fantastic fish tacos. You made a great choice and the view is unforgettable.  We are glad to hear you enjoyed 306. It is a nice size room with an amazing view and private balcony.    Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Riviera Beach Resort Feb. 19.  We stayed in one of the rooms that had full ocean view. We could hear the ocean all night long.  The room was beautiful and the view just could not be beat.  Sat out on deck and read our books and sipped some wine while reading.  Went to bed early and slept all night, even my husband who rarely sleeps through the nite.   There was absolutely no noise from the the surrounding rooms.  If I could suggest to the management it would be appreciated if they could put a few more of the coffee packets in the room. When we arrived all there was was decaff.  Also, we are from the midwest and we are early risers.  The breakfast was not served until later on in day and the lobby is closed until that time.  However we were so happy
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and I am so glad that we delivered on your expectations. I will speak with housekeeping about the coffee. Every room should have both complimentary regular and decaf coffee so we appreciate you bringing this to our attention.  I hope you had a pleasant trip back home and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy Travels,  -Kort

Summary: We stayed here as a last minute booking going by the reviews. It was just okay nothing special. For a family it would be good but for a couples weekend I would suggest somewhere else. The room had a partial view and reminded me more of a motel than hotel. It was clean but nothing special.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing that your room was clean. We do have many different types of rooms. It sounds like you may have stayed in one of our budget priced rooms, and perhaps one of our superior surf view rooms would have been more suited to your needs.   When you are next in town I would like to show you what else is available at the Laguna Riviera. I believe we could find something you would enjoy better. We offer every thing from a simple non-view studio to a 3 bedroom 1-1/2 bath ocean front beach home with full kitchen, large private patio just above the sand with a BBQ and private beach access.  Please contact us anytime you are in town to view our premium rooms and we would be happy to give you a tour and hopefully earn your business again.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We recently brought our family of 5 ( myself, husband, 7, 4, and 1 year old) to this hotel to get away from our Utah winter, and relax on a beach vacation! We stayed in room 304 and it had THE MOST amazing view! We could see the ocean while we were laying in bed! There was a private deck that we could people watch from, and watch the surfers from! My husband watched the NFL playoffs from the room while I played with the kids at the beach, and he was able to pop out onto the balcony and check on us during the commercials and time outs! ( one negative is the TV reception on Fox channel  was a little fuzzy, but if it weren't playoffs week, we wouldn't have turned on the tv AT ALL because HELLO, WE ARE ATTHE BEACH!) The staff was very kind, especially Susan! I love the location of
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful review. You put a smile on my face and that of the entire staff here at the Laguna Riviera. Sharing our joy for Laguna Beach and having guests like you come experience our slice of heaven and hearing that we delivered a great experience motivates everyone to continue doing better.  The fresh croissants you enjoyed so much are a new addition to the complimentary continental breakfast. They are baked fresh every morning and delivered in time for breakfast service. We have also just added self-serve make your own waffles.   Your comment regarding the TV reception is an issue for us. The cable service is excellent on some channels and less than perfect on others so we are looking into upgrading the entire property to DirecTV with full in home experience so it functions just like you were at home with all the same features.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: I want to love it but just cant:/
Summary: I am very disappointed because in my head I was already planning another trip to the hotel in 2 weeks for a girls weekend. However with all the issues I can't see myself returning. First I arrived 1/9 at 7pm, Chris seemed very put off that I was there and had just made a reservation.. like he was mad that I made him work. There was a woman and a child behind the desk which seemed unprofessional but family owned so I let it slide. Chris didn't tell me where my room was which was odd and I had to wander around to find it and was confused when all there was, was a sliding glass door.. never would have thought to use the key on that. But I could hear the waves and went and got a bottle of wine! It was perfect I slept 12 hours and heard nothing but the waves.   In the morning I went
Manager Response: It is nice to hear you feel are rooms are perfect, comfortable and have amazing views.   We have spoken to the desk staff, reviewed the time stamp of your check in, and viewed the video logs of your interactions with our front desk staff to clearly understand your concerns.  I must apologize if my car interred in any way with your stay, but I find it easier to unload things like the pastries that are baked fresh each morning that you enjoyed so much. The doors on my car are on the long side and I don't want to risk dinging the side of our guests cars moving large boxes out of it. If one or both of the spaces are needed by our guests however it is quickly and easily moved.  Housekeeping does announce their presence before entering rooms and servicing them. If for any reason you do not want service or wish to not to be disturbed as they make their rounds, there is a Do Not Disturb sign that announces your desires. I have discussed your concern about their laughter and they assure me that it had nothing to do with you or your reaction when they attempted to come service the room. Such behavior on their part would be grounds for termination.  Happy travels.  Kort

Summary: We recently stayed  at  the Bungalow, which is right on the beach. There were a few issues with the house, there is a garage for parking that has an inoperable opener, and I spent time getting the door opened, only to be told later that the key fob didn't work. There  were some equipment issues, the  AC didn't work and a bedding request we hade made  wasn't taken care of until there was a visit to the office. I will say that when these issues came up the staff responded quickly and took care of the problems. If you are looking at this house online, the photos don't show the best feature which is a fantastic patio with a grill and seating for six  right on the beach.  There are two small bedrooms which are very comfortable, and a larger room with an ocean view.  Overall it was a
Manager Response: Thank you for the review of our Beach Bungalow and the newly added massive beach patio with BBQ and seating for 6. It is nice to know that any issues you did have were quickly addressed and resolved. As you can imagine maintaining a 1932 Beach Cottage on the ocean is a non stop job as the elements are always present.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: Amazing Views, Great Price, Wonderful Atmosphere
Summary: We spend Christmas at the beach! Laguna Riviera was the perfect location. Our family occupied 5 rooms, one complete with a living room and full kitchen. The unpretentious hotel has friendly staff and feels more like a community that an impersonal hotel at the beach. The views are amazing, the staff friendly, and access to the beach couldn't be easier. I stayed in room 408 and it has a private patio with a table, umbrella, 4 chairs, and two lounge chairs. Oh, and the parking is free. I look forward to returning to this perfect location overlooking the beach.
