Manager Response: Thank you for selecting the Laguna Riviera for your family Christmas gathering. We are honored to have met your needs and to receive such feedback.    Sharing what our family built and loves with others is a joy for us and we look forward to your next stay.  Merry Christmas & A Happy New Year  -Kort  and the staff of the Laguna Riviera

Summary: Pleasant place for Laguna's lovers. The view is just perfect, the rooms are mostly confortable. The oldschool, retro-style isn't a problem. Good location in Laguna, free parking, good service and nice and discret crew. I spent two nights there and I was really satisfied. Enjoy
Manager Response: What a re-View thank you and yes indeed the views from the patios and decks of the Laguna Riviera are beautiful, relaxing and breath taking,   We appreciate you sharing your experience and are happy that your stay was enjoyable and your needs were met.  We look forward to your next stay,  Happy Holidays  From all of us at the Laguna Riviera

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for one night on a week-long trip to California.  The location is really great with a beautiful view of the ocean!  The hotel has its own little walkway to get down to the beach.  Breakfast is served in the lobby each morning.  Parking is free, which was a major factor in choosing this hotel.  (We refused to stay at a hotel that charged for parking during our trip.)  The room had a beautiful balcony where we ate breakfast and looked out onto the Pacific.  The price was fair.  The only caveat is that we booked via a third-party app and were not informed that most rooms DO NOT have air conditioning.  Upon asking at the front desk, they set up a portable air conditioner in the room and it worked great.
Manager Response: To our visitors from New York,   Thank you for the fine review. I appreciate your aversion to paying for parking. We feel the same about all up charges like resort fees, parking and internet access that so many charge nowadays. These extras often take a good rate and move it to being no so great but at the Laguna Riviera we don't play those games.  Not all rooms have air conditioning and we hope to change that. Right now its an issue with the amount of power that can be delivered to the property. With some of the new high efficiency systems we may be able to provide A/C property wide in the near future. Fortunately its not needed very often and we do supplement with portable units as needed. It is good to hear the portable unit worked great for you and you had a wonderful stay as you vacationed your way through California.  We look forward to your next stay.  Happy Travels,  -Kort

Summary: We needed a get away. Three months apart with the occasional weekend visit and dealing with remodeling, we needed a break. We love the Laguna area, as my husband spent many summers here with his family. After some quick searches, we landed on this spot, made a res, got a dog sitter and headed south.   We have walked past this hotel many times, and often speculated about the rooms, etc. I had decided to splurge and we booked a surf view room. O.M.G. Semi private deck, views that could not be beat, and a terrific room. In room coffee, a little fridge for snacks, good lamps for reading, and best of all...the deck. If you are looking for a romantic getaway, get a surf view room with the semi private deck.   The check in could not have gone smoother, the staff was incredibly
Manager Response: Thank you for putting a smile on the face of all of our staff members. We strive to create a memorable experience for our guests and appreciate that you have taken the time to share how you enjoyed your stay.  I appreciate your comment about passing by and wondering about the hotel. Being on Coast Highway many folks don't realize the property runs all the way to the sand allowing the property to offer amazing unobstructed ocean views. We are fortunate that the street that runs between Coast Highway and the ocean takes a pause on our block allowing the property direct beach access.  And thank you for noticing the sheets. In the laundry we use mild eco friendly unscented allergy conscious cleansers to keep the linnens fresh, clean and unobtrusive.  The same approach is applied in the pool area. We use salt water systems so we can avoid harsh chemicals and chlorine.  We look forward to your next stay, and thank you again for the review.  Happy Travels,  -Kort

Summary: Have been traveling to the Laguna Riviera Beach Resort for the last four summers and there is a reason to always come back.  With its location right on the beach, you are literally steps away from the pacific.  The hotel is a welcomed throw back art deco style property that has the character and charm that chain hotels cannot compete with, they have a barbecue available for reservation, plenty of beach toys/chairs/umbrellas for guests to use, and also a large selection of books to check out and take to the beach.  The property is a 5-10 minute walk from main beach and has ample parking for hotel guests.  The continental breakfast is great and they also has a sauna, hot tub, and heated indoor pool.  Very family friendly and great for groups.
Manager Response: Tony G. Thank you for the fine review and comments.  The Laguna Riviera is the last family owned and operated property in town and we pride ourselves in providing local knowledge, and an experience of Laguna that a corporate chain simply cannot.   Sitting on the sand with great rates and one of the best locations in town its hard to go wrong. Most of our guests simply park their car and never start it, until its time to depart. Its so convenient to just walk wherever you need to go.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy Travels,  -Kort

Summary: This is an Art Deco style hotel right on the beach, it is a beautiful 1930's style hotel which has been owned by the same people since the 1940's and they take great pride in their hotel. Only downside is a small main car park but there is extra parking down a side street most of which is undercover. The rooms are great ours had a full kitchen and an ocean view, there are sun terraces with loungers and tables and chairs, free barbecue equipment and a fairly good breakfast. Would definitely stay here again
Manager Response: Thank you for the endorsement with your wonderful review.   Now with the 4th generation of the family working the front desk we have a lot of heritage to live up to and appreciate you see that, and enjoyed your stay. The complimentary continental breakfast was recently upgraded with daily fresh baked pastries which are truly exceptional. They are delivered each morning fresh from the oven just in time to present to our guests.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: My wife and stayed here for an overnight getaway. The room was nothing special. The service was nothing to scream about either but the location is phenomenal. The grounds, depending on the room you book, have decks that range from private to wide open views of the beach and ocean to Catalina Island. We enjoyed a bottle of wine on the deck area as the sun set.There is a walkway down the slope directly to the beach. You can't beat it! Walking distance to shops, groceries and restaurants ranging from tiny and ok to top shelf. We ate dinner at Mozambique about 3/4 of a mile away and LOVED it.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review and your right,  location, location location is the mantra of great real estate. And, we have that in abundance.  We are glad you enjoyed your stay and had the opportunity to visit one of my favorite restaurants, Mozambique. I hope you had a chance to enjoy their roof top lounge and watch the sunset while there.  We hope to earn your business again next time you visit Laguna Beach.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: Family Weekend at the Laguna Riviera
Summary: September 26, 27 and 28 my family and I  (47 of us) spent a heavenly weekend at the Laguna Riviera.  The rooms, the gathering places, the breakfast, the beach, the views were spectacular.  Couldn't have asked for a better weekend.  Our family ranges from 5 months to 80 years old.  Everyone had a fantastic time.  We have been coming here for about 25 years or more.  The recent renovations are lovely.  The 11 great grand children enjoyed the beach and the grassy gathering place as well as their aunts, uncles etc.  The young adults enjoyed the beach, the sunsets, and the many eating and drinking places and shops in town.  We older people enjoyed the sunsets, the ambience, the ease of visiting with everyone and the shops etcetera in town.  Thanks for a wonderful weekend.  Susan is
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review and endorsement. We are honored that you and the family have been vacationing with the Laguna Riviera for so long. It is a true testament to the family environment that is the Laguna Riviera.  We appreciate seeing your family tradition continue. I often comment on working at the hotel when I was young and how many of the kids I met visiting the Riviera with their parents are now parents visiting with their children.  Its a wonderful experience to be part of these traditions and great memories.  Thank you again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: Much cheaper than other beach front opps
Summary: Other choices we're sold out that were three and four hundred dollars a night. this place doesn't look that great from the roadside but inside it's beautiful as it cascades down to the Pacific... We were here for a wedding we were able to walk to the little church by the sea lots and lots of great breakfast places the beach cycling whatever you want its all right here within walking distance less than a half a mile
Manager Response: Thank you for the review. You are quite right. Our prices are the best ocean front prices in town. In addition the rooms were completely renovated a few years back, but we left the exterior style and look to be classic Laguna Beach.   Great food, beaches and galleries are all surrounding the property, and with free internet, parking, continental breakfast in the morning, and no resort fee, the Laguna Riviera is a tremendous family value.  Thanks again & Happy Travels,  -Kort

Summary: My friends and I stayed at Laguna Riviera on Sept 19th and what an awesome experience we had. The beach behind the hotel was peaceful and quiet. The hotel manager Susan had made our stay even better by recommending Mozambique for food and drinks and then we got to see Nick Hernandez from Common Sense perform live at Mozambique. The hotel and staff are very welcoming and really know how to make our wonderful vacation that much fun! I would definitely recommend Laguna Riviera to my family and friends!
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review and kind words about the staff.  The beach in front of the hotel is a favorite for locals and one of the few that allows surfing in the summer making it ideal for relaxing on the sand or watching the action in the water.  You were sent to one of my favorite venues in town. Mozambique has top talent and Nick is a Laguna treasure always delivering a great & soulful performance.  Thanks again & Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: My family and stayed at this hotel and quite frankly, I didn't like it. We were given a room with no AC in it. To stay cool, we were given a portable AC unit. It did work, I just didn't like the fact that there were only a handful of rooms that had built in AC in them. Some rooms had ceiling fans. This place gets a sticker that it's one of the best hotels??? Come on give me a break. I don't know how this hotel still survives without Ac's in the rooms.
Manager Response: We have had a hot spell and I am sorry the portable A/C was not sufficient for your needs.  Unfortunately since the property was built in the late 40's the the lines supplied by the power company are not heavy enough to safely power full size A/C's in every room. This is why we clearly state on our website and when you book what rooms do and don't have A/C.  We are looking into new technology that might allow us to have A/C in all rooms using new energy efficient systems.   Most of the year it is a non-issue as the weather is quite comfortable. I do hope you had a chance to also enjoy the outdoors, beach, amazing views, and our wonderful town while staying with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We love this hotel for large family gatherings.  Everyone gets their own room and we book the suite(room 404&406) for everyone to hang out in.  We had 7 rooms.  Yes it might be cheaper to rent a beach house, but this way everyone pays for their rooms and has their own private space.  There is a Whole Foods and Ralphs close by.  The kitchen is well equip and we all cook together. The rooms are nice, nothing spectacular, but nice.  The decks are amazing,  we spend most of our time outdoors. Parking is tight. The pool and rec room are fun when we want a change from the beach.  Lots of shopping near by. We travel a lot and this is one of our favorite places.  Yes there are many fancy resorts along the coast, but we like the casual, family feel of The Laguna Rivera.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and kind words. The Laguna Riviera has always been about family and and sharing our passion for Laguna Beach and all that it offers. We enjoy knowing that we are part of creating beautiful memories for you and your family.   With so much to see and do in Laguna it's nice to be able to park your car and just walk to the shops, restaurants, stores, galleries and of course all the wonderful beaches and coves.  You can also just relax here on the property and enjoy a home cooked meal.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: We have been going here for 30 years!
Summary: I just returned from 3 delightful nights at the Laguna Riviera. When our family has something to celebrate we always plan a stay at this resort. This time it was a wedding. From large decks the view of the ocean and beach below is incomparable. A special treat this visit was the unusual experience of watching surfers on 25 foot waves caused by the recent hurricane off Southern CA. The path down to the water is attractive and easy to navigate, The resort is family owned and they go out of their way to meet your needs. The son of the owner graciously arranged for transport to the airport for me when I left. The woman who manages the breakfast room delivered a raisin bagel to my room when I said there were none out. While the breakfast does not include hot food you can mix hot
Manager Response: Thank you for the review. We are honored to have earned your repeat patronage for over 30 years. It is a grand testament to the goals and vision of my grandfather when he first opened the doors of the Laguna Riviera in 1948.  Over the last 66 years it has been the families pleasure to maintain the founders standards, keep the rooms up to date, treat our guests like family, and deliver an authentic Laguna Beach experience.   Thank you for being part of the Laguna Rivieras' extended family and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: This was our second stay here.  The location is perfect for us.  Ocean view rooms, easy beach access, comfortable rooms at a comfortable price.  We love that we can walk everywhere.  We parked our car in their lot and didn't use it until we had checked out.  Orange Inn for breakfast/lunch...Cafe Zoolu for dinner.  Out next stay we will use the bbq...and order delivery...I heard there are several places that deliver to the hotel and  I would enjoy staying in and eating there.  We love Laguna and came twice this year.
Manager Response: Thank you for a wonderful review and your repeat patronage.  You hit on a couple of my favorite places to eat. Orange Inn for breakfast and without a doubt Cafe Zoolu for an amazing dinner. And, the best part each is just a couple minutes walking distance from the Riviera.  You mentioned delivery and there are several excellent choices. The front desk is up to speed and can offer several suggestions and your room is equipped with menus from our personal favorites so you can order easily and be ready to dine as the sun sets over the Pacific Ocean.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: This review is log over due! My husband and I have been staying at any and every hotel in Laguna that will have ussince 2000! We have stayed in Laguna several times a year, ever year for at least 14 years! We have stayed at "the Riv" on and off during that time. By far the best location on the beach your money will get you. I have read some awful reviews on here and I have to say if you are expecting extravagance then head to Montage or Surf and Sand (and pay $600 a night minimum). These guys had a room for $200 a night on Labor Day weekend. Packed the car in one hour and drove straight there! They have all the towels, chairs, umbrellas, sand toys,indoor pool, HOT Jacuzzi, Sauna, free games for the kids, Hot coffee and and array of pastries, cereal, juices and milk to start your
Manager Response: Wow and thank you for the thorough and complimentary review. I agree that there is no better ocean front value in Laguna Beach. We keep it simple and don't have all kinds of extra charges that ends up being a surprising blow to your vacation budget upon check out.  It is such a joy to know that our efforts and passion put into the property result in providing such great memories and experiences for those who trust their vacation lodging  with us.  Since you did such a great job there is not much left for me to say other than thank you and were honored you took the time to share your experience with others.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: This is our go to beach hotel when we visit Orange county.  They have a variety of room shapes, sizes, and amenities.  Look at the map of the hotel before booking so you can see what room fits your needs best.  Some have kitchens, some have a small sunroom that fits a rollaway bed, some have full or partial ocean views, some face the street.  This place has it all for families.  There is an indoor pool and game room for cloudy days.  There is direct beach access, you just walk down the zig zag path with beautiful views and you are on the sand.  There is a lovely BBQ area with tables and a great view, that are open for all to use.  We have used this area when we have visited with friends as a gathering spot.  They have beach chairs for you to take to the beach with you.  The
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review and observations.   While we only have 41 rooms plus the 3 bedroom Beach House, you called it perfectly, every room is different and it's always good to review them and make sure you get the one that best suits your needs.  We are honored to know you are amongst the travelers that calls the Laguna Riviera home when looking for a place to stay in Laguna Beach. We look forward to your next stay with us and thanks again.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: At the last minute my wife and I decided to spend the night in Laguna Beach. We checked this place out and even though we couldn't get an ocean view, the one room they had left was great. The place has a lot of amenities which we took advantage of. Everyone we dealt with was extremely friendly. Price was in line with all of the other hotels....but this hotel has air conditioning!  We'll be back!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. Laguna is a great place for couples to get away, with our beach front location, and romantic patios with amazing views the Laguna Riviera is the perfect place to have an authentic Laguna Beach experience.  We look forward to your next stay with us, and thanks again.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: I saw some of the other photos and I was really confused if they were from the same place I stayed last night. Last night and this morning, I had a beautiful view straight into the room and balcony of another couple. I also understand that we're on the coast and it should be cooler, but please, please, please- fix A/C. Since the A/C was not working, I had to toss open all the windows and turn fan on high to keep cool at 10PM. The towels were stained, blankets had stains. Shower and sinks are awkward in my opinion. Property is in some major need of renovation.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience and I apologize that it was less than perfect.  We did have a recent and unusual heat wave and it put a strain on our resources. Fortunately the weather is now back to normal and quite comfortable.   We will be discussing the stains you mentioned with the housekeeping team as that is not acceptable and will be addressed immediately. I would be curious to know which room you had as I cannot think of any that face directly into another room and balcony. If you could shoot me an email and let me know it would be helpful and make it easier for me to look into this as well as to check the A/C issue mentioned.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: Great views, great patios, older interior
Summary: When not on the beach in front of the hotel, we were with friends on the hotel's patio passing the time away watching surfers, boats and the waves below or at night just watching stars and listening to the waves.  A group of people used the hotel's BBQ grills for one dinner.   We were fortunate no one was using the "public" patio when we were. If you can spring the extra money for the private patios, they are well worth it so you won't play a game of chance on them being occupied.  The free breakfast consisted of cereal boxes, bagels, canned juices and...microwave breakfast burritos. Definitely a unique breakfast menu.   Room 512 had a nice view of the ocean and sunsets.  It has a king bed and a twin. The twin made it an interesting sleeping arrangement for four people. I took
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and I am glad you enjoyed your stay, the views and location. You are correct that 4 people in room 512 would be tight. it is actually set for 3 as a max in our system. I will look into who booked it as the computer would not have allowed 4 to be booked into the room if the guest count is entered correctly. I also must apologize for any stains on the blankets. We have switched housekeeping services and are going through some additional training with their staff. It should not be an issue moving forward.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary: I am writing this review from the room.  Booked it over a half year ago for July 4th.  The room is considered to have a view, but all I can see is a gravel roof.  Very disappointed!   My girl had been looking forward to this trip.  The room is fine not fancy but it was supposed to be about the view.  Went and talked with the staff to see if they could accommodate us and they were not at all interested.  Laguna is our favorite beach but I think next time we will look somewhere else.  I stay in hotels about 150 nights a year and as far as value goes this should have been about 1/4 the price.  I guess I'll make the best of it
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. I am sorry you felt our staff was not interested in accommodating your request. They would have been more than happy to help you find a room that met your needs were there any other options.  I wish we were able to move you from your ocean view room to a surf view room but as you can imagine July 4th was completely sold out.   We do our best disclosing the types of views on the website and when guests call. A ocean view room is one from which you can see the open ocean, Catalina island and the wonderful sunsets. This may look out over the top of other parts of the building including the roof top of rooms below you.  This is shown on our website http://www.lagunariviera.com/accomodation.php  A Surf View room is one where you also have a view of the beach and crashing wave either from your deck or from your room.  We keep our rates competitive with the other ocean front hotels in town and consistently offer a lower rate for similar or better accommodations.  Should you visit Laguna Beach in the future and would like to stay with us again, please request a Surf View room and if available I think you will be very pleased with it.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We loved staying here.  We had a surf view room and enjoyed every second of our five night stay. The worst thing about this hotel is having to leave.  We had a few minor problems with the room, for example the towel rack was broken, but everything was fixed immediately.  They supply trays for the continental breakfast and we enjoyed eating it on our deck.  It really didn't matter what we ate, even Taco Bell, as long as we ate in our room, lanai or deck where we enjoyed the breathtaking views. We had a better view than any of the restaurants we ate at.  Everyone was so nice and friendly in this town.  Our son took surf lesson from Soul Surf next door and Jim and Goff were wonderful and had our son standing up riding the waves while we watched (sometimes from our deck). All of the
Manager Response: Thank you for the fine review. It is always a pleasure to hear from satisfied guests and to know that your vacation was everything you expected.   The views you experienced from your deck never get old and even for those of us who grew up here they continue to amaze. I am glad you enjoyed your stay at the Laguna Riviera and congratulations to your son for standing up his first day surfing.   We look forward to your nest visit.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: Older facility but very neat and clean.  Rooms vary greatly depending on size and location to beach.  Stayed one night in rom 201.  Was not disappointed at all.  Great view.  Quiet room.  Easy walk down to beach.  The only negative was the small, cramped parking spaces, but that did not detract from a great stay.  Would recommend to anyone staying in the area.  Great experience!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience of staying at the Laguna Riviera. Room 201 is one with amazing views up and down the coast and of course the beach and ocean.  Many select it because you can leave the shutters open and wake to the view of the crashing waves and sound of the surf. It is a real guest favorite.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: Let me start by saying this place has great views and the people are friendly. My husband and I have been going to this place for over 20 years. Our last visit left us disappointed. We always stay in their suit, room 404 with family in 406. With all the up grades they have done in the other rooms, you would think they would spend some money and provide good bed mattress. In both rooms the mattress were worn and lumpy, especially in room 404, so needless to say our sleep was not good. Also, the patio cushions were new but of poor quality, thin and you can feel the metal chairs when sitting on them. In the kitchen, which should be stocked with pans didn't have pans only pots. Being the second highest priced room I feel it should have better accommodations.  I understand the cost
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and long term patronage. It is an honor to be able to warrant such loyalty and to know that we deliver an experience that warrants many repeat visits.  Room 404, as you know, is almost always booked. With that said it has had several updates over the last few years including the mattress. I will be checking as soon as the room is vacant to make sure it has not been swapped out on us as we have two types of mattresses. 1 is custom made for us and the other is a memory foam. Im sorry the patio cushions were not up to your standard. As you mentioned they are brand new and I'm sure you understand that being on the ocean we are constantly replacing cushions and umbrellas because they don't last long in that environment.  The front office has pans and can deliver to your room whatever is needed. So please don't hesitate to call for service thats what we are here for.  We look forward to your next stay and again, thank you for the long term patronage.  Happy Travels,  -Kort

Summary: We stayed here a couple of weeks ago.  The weekend staff needs a shake up, they were rude and completely un-helpful.  We couldnt get into our room early so we asked if there was a place to keep our luggage so that we could make our appt.  They said they would put it in the office - begrudingly I might add.  My husband went back about an hour and half later to see if the room was ready and there was our lugguage still sitting in the lobby!!  As it ended up we didnt get in till 1 1/2 after check in time - they blamed the new housekeeping staff.  The woman behind the desk was so very rude in her responses to our questions, that I did consider looking for somewhere else to go!  At one point I asked to see if the guest house was available to look at and her comment was "the rate goes
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. I am glad you enjoyed your stay and our wonderful views and location.  I am sorry your first impression with the front desk was less than perfect. We have had some recent hires and training is ongoing. Fortunately you had a great experience Tuesday with the desk staff and saw what we strive to be our standard delivery of excellence.   Your room tip is spot on. Room 508 is an amazing room with brand new furniture and amazing views. It was completely remodled about 6 months ago and is one of my personal favorites.   I'm glad to hear you can't wait to come back and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy Travels,  -Kort

Summary: We stayed at the Laguna Riviera last December. I just finished re booking for this summer and am looking to go back again in December. I.am a single mom on a budget so I did a lot of research so I could get the best bang for my buck and ended up picking this hotel, If you are looking to travel cheap this place is for you. I wanted ocean view and balcony the whole nine yards and for the price you cannot beat it. You get the same perks as the fancy hotels of being on the beach. From the street it's not much too look at, but the rooms are very well taken care of. We wanted to try 2 different rooms so we first stayed in room 516 Ocean View category. Since it is a corner room we could still see the waves crash, yes there is a roof that blocks some of it but I could see ocean for as
Manager Response: Thanks for the wonderful review. We can only agree with all of your comments and are very happy we were able to accommodate your budget.   It often happens that folks staying nearby in much more expensive corporately owned properties discover the family owned Laguna Riviera as they walk the beach. Further investigation reveals significant saving with, what many describe as, a superior location.  We are close to everything without being in the middle of the noise and congestion of downtown, offering extremely competitive rates with no hidden resort fees or extra charges, and on the best stretch of beach in town.   Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We stayed in room 306 best view and we had a private balcony.  Walking distance to all the great shops. I will stay here again if I am able to make it back.  We had a great time and loved our room and view!!
Manager Response: Thanks for your review. The surf view rooms with private balconies are always a treat. Im glad you enjoyed your stay and took he time to share your experience. We look forward to your next visit.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: My wife and I have stayed for two weekends at the Beach Bungalow. The first time was during the construction phase last year and we were fully advised ahead of time of some inconveniences which may get our attention during our stay. Since the retaining walls were being built below, we had the entire upper level of the house and convenient outside deck off of the living area as our personal habitat. The main entry bridge to the house intersects the city beach stairway which gave us direct access to the sand for excellent morning walks and we even walked past main beach to Las Brisas for outdoor afternoon cocktails. Yum.  Now, the two lower terraces are complete and this time we felt like we had our own private resort planet to ourselves. This "vast" lower terrace would be perfect
Manager Response: Wow, thank you for this fantastic and descriptively engaing review. I could not have said it better and appreciate the memories and imagry it brings to mind. Particularly because it was the home of my grandparents who wanted a wonderful beach cottage in which to live.  Since you have said it all, the only thing left for me to say is, again, Thank You. I appreciate the time and thought put into this review.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: My husband and I spent two nights here April 6th and 7th to celebrate a birthday.  We attempted to check in at 3:45 pm and unfortunately the room was not ready, we were told to come back in a half hour, we returned at 4:30.  We checked in and went to the room and the maid was still working there.  We had to wait for her to finish hanging the shower curtain, put towels in etc.....I was a bit dissapointed that the room was still not ready, by this time it was 4:45. We were in room 409, it was ok.....when they say you cant see the beach or surf they are right!!  I was really disappointed with the view as we paid for the ocean front room, so make sure if this is what you want, book a room where you can see the surf. The hotel is older but in good condition, clean, the room was
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review.  Im glad you liked your room, the location and acknowledge that our description of the views is accurate. An ocean view room such as yours in one in which you will see the open ocean, sunsets and on a clear day Catalina Island. A surf view room is where you will see all of that plus the crashing waves and beach from your room and or balcony.  My apologies that your room was not ready on time. This is a situation that has been remedied. We moved to a new service the beginning of April and they were just getting up to speed and now have everything timed out and under control to ensure rooms are ready by check in.  The continental breakfast service is dictated by the health department. We are not allowed to have guests come behind the counter and serve themselves. It would certainly make it easier if we could set everything out and do a self service program. Maybe that will be the case someday.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: Since my last visit there, Laguna Riviera has made quite a few upgrades.  The Beach Bungalow patio and a remodel of the beach walk is quite impressive. Some of the rooms now have new balconies as well.  I have always liked this family-run resort and will continue to go back.
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice review and I am glad you appreciate all of the upgrades we have been implementing. It has been a lot of work but all of it worth it.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next visit.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: I would give this place zero stars if I could. I have never in my life seen such horrible front desk service at any hotel, let alone a pricey beach resort.  I was here as an invited speaker for UC Irvine. I was told the university would be billed directly. The front desk clerk, a young dark-haired woman wearing a silver headband, looked up my name and snarled--and I mean SNARLED--that they would need payment to check me in. My host came to the front desk, and she told him that her boss said they needed to pay for the room in advance. He said no, he'd put up visiting speakers and job candidates there many times and had always been able to pay afterwards with a department invoice. His assistant had confirmed this with the hotel that morning.  Eventually it got resolved, but it
Manager Response: I actually walked in while this guest was trying to check in. Unfortunately they did not have a deposit on the reservation and refused to provide a credit card upon arrival to secure the room. We must have a form of payment and ID on file to check anyone in.  Once I intervened this guest agreed to provide a card to secure the room. Ultimately they contacted their sponsor who should have already arranged payment, but had not, and the entire payment issue was resolved. I do understand and saw that this guest was agitated and embarrassed by the incident being there with colleagues and not having had everything properly planned for in advance of their arrival.  While I appreciate the situation we simply can not check anyone in without securing payment first.   Many rooms but not all have air conditioning and this is clearly called out on our website and when booking reservations. As for the kids asking for keys, that was an unfortunate situation and upon final review they were at the hotel with their parents. Unfortunately we have local kids come to the desk on a regular basis with all kinds of stories to secure room keys to allow them access to the swimming pool. So you can appreciate we cannot simply hand out room keys to every child who asks without any identification.  The law also requires that unless we personally know someone we must verify the guests identiy before issuing replacement room keys. This is for the safety and security of our guests.  In final review I wish this guest had a more pleasant stay and can assure all readers that checking in is quite smooth when payment and ID are not an issue.  Happy travel,  -Kort

Summary Heading: Why we love the Laguna Riviera Hotel
Summary: For 23 years, coming to the Laguna Riviera has offered us a respite from stress and exhaustion of daily living.  We come here for rest, relaxation, and renewal-- and never leave disappointed!! It may not offer the glitzy luxury many seek, but here-- surrounded by flowers and ocean--one can find peace, welcome, and comfort.  It is the "pearl of great price".
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful and serene review.   It is an honor that our family and beach side hotel have been able to provide you with 23 years of service. We pride ourselves on delivering a relaxing authentic Laguna Beach experience sharing our beach lifestyle making everyone comfortable. We don't even try, nor want to be, a buttoned up 5 star property where you have to worry about what you are wearing just to stop by the office for some coffee in the morning. With that said we are constantly striving to be better and offer more at the best ocean front prices in town.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We just returned from 3 days at the Laguna Riviera. Our visit started out poorly, but the hotel went out of their way to make us happy. We had four of us staying (two adults with our two grown children), and I had carefully picked room 403 to face the ocean and accommodate all of us. When we arrived, we were told they had moved us to 401. When I asked why the move, the person at the desk told me it was an upgrade, and that we would also be getting a discount. After viewing the room, it was clear that it was not an upgrade -- it was a smaller room with a pull out sofa rather than a murphy bed. I went back to the front desk and let them know I was not happy with the change.   He said he would see what he could do as it was clear they had a problem. The eventual solution was that
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and such an appropriate title. We are definitely on one of the best beaches in town.  It is unfortunate that the room requested was not available upon check in, but I am glad you found the concessions more than appropriate. Our 1932 beach bungalow is truly an authentic Laguna Beach experience and there is more than enough space for your group of 4. It will comfortably sleep 6 with its' 3 bedrooms and the views are truly amazing.  Your comment about the pool is interesting. I agree, that it would be better positioned by contemporary standards if it overlooked the ocean.   As a bit of history, when the hotel was opened back in 1948 it was a luxury to have a pool so many properties including the Laguna Riviera if they had this luxury would put their pool in a location that allowed passersby to know immediately that feature was available. It was advertising at its' best and worked quite well for its' time.   The indoor sauna, jacuzzi and pool are used frequently all year round and the roof is open most of the time bringing in fresh air and sun. Since we use a salt water system there are no harsh chemicals or chlorine smell to deal with. It is really quite comfortable and relaxing, and while you can't watch the surfers while you relax you can see a parade of exotic cars pass by all day long and the wall and steamed up glass offers sufficient privacy from passersby. Adjacent to the pool is a game room with foos ball, air hockey, and ping pong which the kids enjoy as they bounce between swimming and playing games.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We have been coming to Laguna Riviera about 5 times in last 6 years. We absolutely love this hotel. Since we are traveling from Europe and we are limited on luggages we really do appreciate that hotel provides beach chairs, towels, sun umbrellas and even children beach toys.  The complimentary breakfasts perfectly suits us since we rather prefer bigger lunch in one of the great restaurants that the area offers. For the breakfast you can choose from cereals, sweet pastries, fresh or canned fruit and of course warm or cold drinks. Since me and our children  are not very familiar with the Pacific ocean waves we are really grateful for a pool that is part of this hotel. The pool area includes jacuzzi that can be very relaxing after a busy day. The location of the hotel is great.  It
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review. Repeat business is the highest compliment we can receive and we are honored that you have stayed with us so many times.   The Laguna Riviera has arguably one of the best locations in Laguna Beach and it is clear this has served you well. We are away from the crowds and noise but a short walk puts you in the middle of everything. The beach we sit on is known as St. Ann's and from here and to the south a few blocks is where all the locals enjoys the water and you can relax, swim, and watch the surfers year round.  We hope your trip home was pleasant and look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: This was my mom & I's third stay at the Laguna Riviera & our best yet! We decided to splurge a bit (though the prices here are the best for beach front in Laguna!) and booked room 101. It was well worth the extra money! The room was very large, the view was amazing, and it was a quick walk down to the beach. At one point we needed maintenance and they were there right away & fixed our problem. We loved spending the day out on the private deck reading our books and enjoying the view! We could not have asked for anything better & we cannot wait for our next stay!
Manager Response: Dear Melissa,  It is always a joy to hear how our guests experience the Laguna Riviera and it is great to know that your return visits just keep getting more memorable.  Room 101 is very large and has an amazing brand new private terraced surf view patio. I am glad you were able to use it to relax, catch up on your reading and enjoy the breathtaking views. This time of year it is common to see dolphins and even migrating whales and 101's deck is the perfect vantage point.  Thanks for the fine review and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels.  -Kort

Summary: This was my second stay at the Laguna Riviera and I have finally figured out that it is well worth it to pay for a room with a view! I took my 87 year old mother in law to Laguna for her first visit (she is from Colorado) and we had the perfect surf view room where we watched the dolphins swim by each morning and listened to the surf all night. She had the luxury of the king bed and the queen hide a bed was sufficient for me. I remembered that the continental breakfast was nothing special so I brought muffins and coffee from the nearby Orange Inn to our private balcony each morning. The staff was extremely attentive and pleasant. My mother in law was thrilled with everything and the Laguna Riviera was the perfect place to soak it all in. The weather was gorgeous in February too!
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review and sharing your experience with us. You stayed at an amazing time as the weather has been spectacular and the dolphins closer to shore than usual.  It is great to hear you and your mother in law enjoyed your stay. Im sure it was a nice retreat for her from the Colorado winter weather.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next visit.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We stayed in the Beach Bungalow last weekend and just loved it. The location is unbeatable - literally steps from the water. Even though it was the middle of winter, the weather was beautiful. We walked on the beach, enjoyed beautiful sunsets, and family dinners. It fit my parents, my sister, her husband, my husband and baby very comfortably. We were able to cook as well as enjoy the great restaurants within walking distance. My baby took his first dip in the warm, salt water pool.  Would definitely recommend for family or groups. Perfect for southern California staycations. Those traveling from farther away would also appreciate the restaurants and shops within walking distance. When I travel abroad I like to look for smaller, family run places to get a more unique and genuine
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the Laguna Rivieras Beach Bungalow. Built in 1932 it is the epitome of an authentic Laguna Beach cottage with all the charm one would expect and a location that you can never tire of. Year round the sunsets are truly amazing.  I am glad to hear you and your family enjoyed it as much as we do. It used to be the home of my grandparents. They lived there after building the hotel and it holds many memories of wonderful family gatherings. It is our pleasure that we can share those same experiences with families like yours when you visit Laguna Beach.  Your brother in laws complaint that the ocean is too loud is very funny. We had another guest years ago actually call the office and ask that we quiet the ocean for her. Unable to do so we ran to the local drug store and bought her some ear plugs. Fortunately many find it very relaxing to fall asleep to the sounds of the waves.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We were looking for a beachfront room/suite to stay in for a weekend getaway in Southern California, and found this lovely beachfront property, older (built in 1948) but recently renovated, charming, and just what we were looking for.  Our room was spacious, and looked out directly on the surf.  The sound of the waves lulled us to sleep in the night, and the views and the breeze kept us smiling all day.  We enjoyed a gorgeous sunset that seemed to go on and on from our private balcony, walked on the beach into town when the tide was low, and on the main road (South Coast Highway) when the tide was high.   We were right on the beach, all we had to do was walk down 100 feet to the sand.  The room, though renovated, was not kept up (bathroom fittings were loose, some were rusted),
Manager Response: Thank you for the review. We always appreciate it when our guests take the time to share their experience. You hit on so many high points that I will simply address the maintenance issue.  Being right on the beach maintenance never stops as we are in a constant battle with the element. The salt air and salt water are persistent so rust receives constant attention to keep it under control and our staff is ready to address any issues that may come up. As you, found you only need to notify the desk and then go back to relaxing and enjoying your vacation while we address any issues.  As mentioned there are so many great choices for a substantial breakfast within a short walk of the hotel which is why we simply provide complimentary rolls, cereals, juices, coffee and muffins to help jump start the day. We may add a full service kitchen in the future but, until then, you cant go wrong with the Penguin Cafe or Orange Inn for breakfast.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We stayed here New Year's Eve 2013 and loved it. You can't beat the location, room was nicely renovated, bed comfy, ah and the sound of the waves just heaven!  We like the fact that it is a small run place it has a level of charm you just don't find with the big chain. We will come back and highly recommend to friends.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and we are glad you enjoyed New Years Eve in Laguna and at the Riviera.   Being the last family owned property in town that has never changed hands, we take pride in delivering an experience not possible at big chains or properties owned by an east coast holding company. When you stay at the Laguna Riviera you get the real Laguna Beach with over four generations of local experience here to serve you.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy New Years, and Happy Travels.  -Kort

Summary: We stayed at this hotel approximately 35yrs ago and loved it, planned on one night....stayed a week. Two years ago we stopped in for a visit, couldn't stay as we were on a flight schedule. This year we are driving and the Laguna Riviera is on our bucket list again!! Plan a week stay. The staff were as friendly as ever. It has been updated but still has that feeling one doesn't find in the newer hotels. The beach views are wonderful and easy to access. Can't wait. Restaurants close by and you can walk to shop etc. I am entering a fake travel date just to complete the review
Manager Response: It is an honor everytime we hear about a guests history with the Laguna Riviera. My grandfather who built and opened  the hotel in 1948 would be so pleased to know his goal of making memories for our guests is still at work today.   35 years is a long time and I am glad we stood the test of time and met your needs. We try to stay true to our Laguna Beach roots and avoid the pretense while delivering a great location, views, service and price. Next time you're in the area, please stop in, I'd love to hear more about your first stay.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We stayed for 3 days in the fall in room 409. While the room was renovated it was very small.  It was nice to have the patio overlooking the ocean.  No air conditioning in this room and when you closed it up to go out and came back the room was up to over 80 degrees.  It was pretty warm all through our stay and you have to keep the doors open at night to get any air at all in the room.  Didn't use the pool as it was enclosed in the front of the hotel and extremely hot in that area. There was a big stain on our carpet right when you walked in the room so that was not impressive.  Shower was really small and have to duck down to wash your hair and I'm only 5'5".  Our cups and glasses in the room were not replaced when they cleaned the room. Towels were limited (just two) and not
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience while staying with us. The room you selected at 377 square feet is not one of our larger rooms. The average room runs over 400 square feet and several are over 600 not including any decks or patios, but as you point out there is a private deck with a nice view of the ocean for room 409 which adds additional private space.   We did have some issues with the internet installation team. The system was being upgraded and there were some issues that were finally resolved it impacted our corporate phone system for several days as well. I am sorry that it impacted your stay.   The salt water pool while enclosed does have a roof that is opened during the day to let in the sun and fresh air and to keep the space a comfortable temperature.   Even though the towels were not as plush as you like I do hope you enjoyed the plush bathrobes.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.   Happy travels,  Kort

Summary: We stayed here for a quick weekend trip to Laguna Beach and absolutely loved it! Great value for a stellar view, including a terrace right outside our room overlooking the ocean. The rooms are clean and comfortable, but the property has not lost its 50's charm. Service was good, but could have been more thorough, and it would have been helpful to have access to on-site laundry. Still, I would highly recommend this location for any kind of stay!
Manager Response: We appreciate that you have taken the time to share your experience.   Your points are well taken as we keep the Laguna Riviera in the sweet spot for Laguna Beach when comparing rates, views and amenities. Sitting on Laguna's most popular beach with some of the best views in town after all theses years and growing up here, I continue to marvel at the sight. It feels truly therapeutic and is completely relaxing.   While we do not have public laundry facilities, there are two laundry mats within 2-3 blocks of the hotel as well as services that will pick up and drop off upon request.   Thanks again, and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: They sold us an "updated" room on the phone.  That being said, our room was as old and as musty as my great grandmother, probably even worse.  Be sure you get what you pay for!!!  Must be kidding, the room we had has not been touched/updated since the 60's or 70's.  I wonder if the phone person (reservations) had ever been in that room, likely not, since no-one in their right mind would say such a thing.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review, we want to hear all opinions to help us provide the best possible guest experience. Often times they reveal items that do need correction and we appreciate the feedback.   I wish a room number had been included with this review, as all rooms underwent a major renovation in 2009 and many have been updated further since then.  Because of this fact and the 1960-70s reference I have to question if this guest is reviewing the right hotel. There are other ocean front properties in town that have been partially updated or barely touched in decades.   We are not one of those.  I suggest any interested parties take a look at this reviewers other posts when considering your options.  If this reviewer can be so kind as to send me an email with the date and room they stayed in I would appreciate it. Not only to verify the property stayed at but, if it was the Riviera, to inspect the room in question and address any items in need of correction.  Many of our rooms can be seen online and we are happy to provide pictures of those that are not, upon request and the rooms availability  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: This hotel was built in 1948, but it has been lovingly updated for all to enjoy.  You can park your car in the lot and walk to all destinations in Laguna.  There are no better views for enjoying the Pacific sunsets.  Rooms have refrigerators, microwaves and coffee makers, so you can have a million dollar view on a shoestring budget.  Be sure to make reservations well in advance.  Lawn and barbeques are available for guests as well as continental breakfast.
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice review. You have discovered the sweet spot in Laguna Beach where price and location converge to create the best value. The Laguna Riviera was built for families and our goal has always been to provide an excellent value with no unexpected fees and charges like you will be hit with elsewhere. That is why we never charge for parking, internet, phone calls, beach chairs, towels, or umbrellas. On top of that there is a complimentary continental breakfast to get started in the morning and none of this resort fee nonsense we are seeing so much of as corporations buy up the local hotels.  You are correct that the hotel was opened in 1948 and recently updated. In 2009 we remodeled and re-furnished every room while keeping some of the 1950's charm of the classic tiles in the kitchens and the vaulted beamed ceilings of some of the rooms. While the major remodel was completed a few years ago we continue to monitor and update as needed. So some rooms will have wood flooring and even more recent upgrades.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: This hotel we stay at every year. After Labor day the prices drop significantly. Every room with a surf view is amazing. Clean hotel Family owned. Leave the sliding glass door open all night and let the surf and cool air put you to sleep. You can walk to very nice shopping areas and restaurants. In the morning i get up and walk to the Orange cafe for some great coffee. Later walk to the Penguin cafe for a very inexpensive breakfast. Overall their is no better hotel on the beach in this area.
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice review. Fall is my favorite time of year, the weather is warm, the beach is nice and the town is quiet. Plus as you mentioned the rates drop as well... ;-)  You hit on two iconic Laguna Beach eateries. Both Orange Inn and the Penguin have been here for decades are are frequented by many locals.   Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: So glad they remodeled and upgraded. Several years ago, this place was getting really dated, and run down, to the point that we were considering other places to stay. Gladly, they have since done major remodeling and upgrades as it has become our favorite place to stay in Laguna Beach.  We come here every year for our wedding anniversary.  Continental breakfast could be a little better in offering some hot items like eggs or bacon, but I still highly recommend this place. Would like to see wine & cheese offered in the evening, or at least coffee and cookies at the end of the day.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and we are so glad you like the remodel. It was definitely needed and we are very happy with the way it turned out.   To your point we have been looking at increasing the offering at breakfast. It will require a lobby remodel, some permits and a new kitchen. The plans have been drawn up and we hope to be into that project with a year or two. We need a little time to recover from our last two major projects first.  We are also evaluating a wine and cheese sunset happy hour for the guests.  If we move forward with that, we will implement it before next summer.  Thank you for the repeat patronage it is the highest honor we can receive. Happy Anniversary and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: My husband and I stayed here two nights in August.  We wish we could have stayed longer.  The  room we had was 307, which had a large side window with a great view of the water and we even saw 2 amazing sunsets from the window.  The window was larger and the view was better than I thought it would be.  You can even open your window to feel the cool breeze in the evening.  The room was newly renovated, clean and big enough for the two of us.  The bed was comfy and the shower was also big enough w/good water pressure.  There was also a chair and desk to utilize in the room along w/a nice flat screen TV.  The room had a fridge and a burner to cook things, but we didn't utilize the burner/stove.  We would have liked to have seen a microwave in the room as we had left overs from
Manager Response: Thank you for the very complete review. It is always appreciated when someone takes the time to share their positive experiences at the Laguna Riviera.   I am glad to hear you enjoyed the property and the town. Laguna Beach is an amazing place and the Riviera is the last of the original family owned properties with our family heritage going back now for 5 generations of Laguna Beach residents. All rooms should have a microwave and the staff has already been alerted to make sure the one missing from 307 is replaced. When possible we allow late check outs sometimes as late as 2:00pm without a surcharge. Unfortunately when the rooms are booked a late check out is not possible and we have been very full even coming off of the summer season.  We look forward to your next visit to Laguna Beach and your stay at the Laguna Riviera.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: Beautiful Laguna sunset views and free parking
Summary: The remodeled Laguna Riviera is much improved from the pre-renovation.  A very relaxing setting overlooking the Pacific right on the beach.  As all beachfront properties, summer rates are pricey and the rooms are rather on the small side, but the bed was comfortable and the room was clean. Staff was very accommodating and there was even a free continental breakfast!  If you can't find what you are looking for at Pacific Edge, for a comparable price, I would give this hotel a look.  You can select your room from their website which means you know exactly what you will get upon arrival.
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice review. We are also very happy with the renovation and we are continuing to make more improvements all the time.   I am surprised you found the room to be small. We only have 2 that I would classify as small so perhaps you had one of those. Our rooms are actually larger than the national average. Our average room is over 400 square feet not including any deck, patio, or balcony space.   I'm glad you enjoyed the complimentary continental breakfast. When combined with free parking, free internet, and no resort fees, like they have at the Pacific Edge hotel you mentioned, you quickly find that we have the best ocean front rates in town.  Thanks again & Happy Travels,  -Kort

Summary: My family stays here every summer and this year didn't disappoint. We stayed in room 504 for a few days and loved it. We have already booked 2 more stays here. My only complaint is that the wifi was spotty but that is certainly not a deal breaker. This year we utilized the free city shuttle and there is a stop right in front of the hotel!! Thanks again Laguna Riveria for an amazing stay!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience while staying at the Laguna Riviera. Our repeat guests are special to us and we enjoying seeing everyone year after year. It is a tradition started by my grand father when he opened in 1948 to create a home away from home for families to enjoy their summer vacation together.   The complimentary WiFi is undergoing and upgrade to improve consistent coverage. If anyone ever has an issue you can always get a strong signal in the lobby or use our complimentary hardwired computer kiosk.   The free shuttles in the summer are a fantastic way to get around, see the city, avoid the traffic, and daunting task of finding parking. Some people will just hop on at the stop right in front of the Laguna Riviera an ride a full round trip just to relax, people watch, and enjoy a free tour of the city.  Thanks again and we look forward to seeing you and the family next year.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: My family of 5 (3 young kids) stayed here for a weekend.  We live in Southern California and Laguna Beach is one of my favorite beach towns.  Everything is within walking distance and it has such a great vibe.  Laguna Riviera is right in the heart of everything and it is on a nice beach.  I think for the price, you cannot do much better.  We stayed in room 505 and it was very large.  We had a full kitchen as well as a bedroom with a queen bed and a queen murphy bed in the living room.  They gave us a crib to use for our toddler.  The beds were really comfortable.  They list 505 as having a "private" patio but I think that is a stretch.  It was fine but it was really a shared patio with separate space for the 3 rooms off that area.  We used it for breakfast and sat out there in
Manager Response: Thank you for your patronage and review. I am glad to hear that room 505 met your needs and you found the new ventilated memory foam mattresses comfortable. We have received several requests on where to buy them which is always a good sign.  The rooms at the Laguna Riviera on average are quite large. Your room not including the deck space is almost 900 square feet and the average for rooms on the 5th level is 400 square feet. A recent report by a leading hotel analysis company reported that hotel rooms in the U.S. average 170 square feet while our smallest room is 212 sq ft and we average about 400 sq ft per room not including deck or patio area. A portion of deck space is reserved exclusively for this room but we have not partitioned them yet so it is open to the neighbors. We have found many times friends will rent adjoining rooms and appreciate having the space connected, but also know that others would prefer to have it be more private, so we are looking into portable or curtain partitions so that it can easily convert to accommodate both needs.  Your observations regarding location and price are what make the Laguna Riviera stand out when compared to many properties. Our price for what you get is the best value in town with no hidden charges for parking, internet, or a resort fee and on top of it you get free continental breakfast, beach chairs and umbrellas. The location is on arguably the best beach in town and close enough to downtown to walk but just far enough away to not have all the activity out your front door.   I will discuss your comment regarding explanations of services upon check in. The desk staff has a list of key point to share with all new guests and I suspect they may have been busy and skipped that part. Rest assured that if you ask the desk staff about any events in town, where to eat or how to get there you will receive prompt and courteous assistance.  Summer time is family time at the Laguna Riviera and has been our hallmark for decades. We find that once school is back in session everything quiets own and the couples and more mature guests come and enjoy the amazing fall and spring seasons with us and some even make the Laguna Riviera home for the winter occupying one of our full kitchen units for 2-3 months at a time.  We look forward to your next visit and thank you for choosing the Laguna Riviera.   Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: Love laguna riviera,we have been coming here 20 years ,my grand children and great grand children spend time also.they have many friends that they see each year,so it is a family oriented resort,I have never had any complaints about the rooms ,carpets,lighting or the many famlies as neighbors.,  i try to keep our visiting children to keep the noise down,although we picked laguna riviera because of its family oriented environment.hope to have many more happy years at this resort,and would like to compiment the staff they are great.
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice review. Repeat business is what keeps us going and we enjoy seeing everyone each year. It feels like an extended family reunion.  The Laguna Riviera is a very family friendly resort and has become an annual tradition with many families returning each year.  In the 70's I worked the beach renting rafts and handing out towels to the guests. I met many of the kids who came with their parents each year on summer vacation and today it is a great pleasure and a testimony to the Laguna Riviera to see the tradition continue as they return, now as parents, with their own children.  This is an honor we don't take lightly, we appreciate the continued patronage, and look forward to seeing you again next year.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: Can't beat the price but I could beat the neighbors!!!!
Summary: Nice little family run place right on the beach and in walking distance to a grocery store and many places to eat.  The room we stayed in had dirty carpets but I imagine they are hard to keep clean with sand...tile would be better.  There could to be better lighting in the rooms and the bathroom. My biggest complaint was out of managment  control....the freakishy noise neighbors who let their children run around slamming doors and screaming over the balcony.  Staff is friendly you can borrow umbrellas beach towels and chairs for your entire stay. Free cereal muffins and juice are provided in the mornings.  Rooms have small fridge and a microwave which is nice....I would stay here again but  would get  an upsatirs room and bring ear plugs!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice comments.   It is unfortunate that other guests staying with us disturbed your peace. We are always ready to intervene and ask folks to quiet down and be considerate of the other guests. Please keep this in mind for your next stay. If you have any problems, please contact the front desk and we will do everything we can to make your stay enjoyable. This includes asking those having a bit too much fun to keep it down.  Thanks again & Happy Travels,  -Kort

Summary: I have been staying at the Laguna Riviera for close to 30 years.  I have no desire to stay anywhere else.  I tell everyone I know that this is the place to stay while in Laguna.  I tell them that it isn't fancy, but it's clean and comfortable, and the value received for the money spent cannot be beat. I stay at the Riv one or more times per year.  My family and I spend a week there during the summer, occupying several units. As much as I love it there, this summer's stay left me a bit cranky.  We are blessed enough to count Room 404 as our mainstay unit - how can you beat its size and the absolutely gorgeous views?! - but this year the decor got to us.  Bear with me while I make comment, even if seemingly trivial or petty:  There is a big floor lamp that was added which is quite
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to prepare such a detailed opinion about room 404. All of your comments have been noted and we will be considering each one when we arrive at the end of summer and begin our annual repair/restoration of each room. As you know we sell out every summer and between family gatherings, weddings and vacationers the rooms are in constant use.  Im sorry to hear that the winds caused you a scare. They can get quite strong coming off of the ocean during the winter season. Our staff is instructed to close all umbrellas when we know they are coming but sometimes the heavy winds just arrive and catch us off guard. We have had to retrieve umbrellas from rooftops the winds can be so powerful.  I trust when you return next year you will be happy to see the result of your comments. We listen to all of our guests and appreciate the feedback.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary Heading: We stayed for three, very pleasant nights
Summary: We've been staying at the Laguna Riviera for years and always have a pleasant stay. Their prices have been creeping up, but are realistic for the area. They offer wonderful beach front access, a variety of room styles from little apartments with full kitchens to rooms with a King bed & fridge only. They have a nice inside, heated pool - good any time of the year. They really do need to fix the ping pong table in the game room, though. We'll go again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and your repeat business. Loyal happy customers let us know were delivering a great vacation experience.   Yes, we have been forced to raise rates on/off for the last several years but alway stay below the other ocean front properties. Fortunately rates are remaining the same for 2014 and instead of starting Summer rates June 1 like everyone else in town, we are waiting until the middle of the month. It is also important to consider total cost since we do not charge for many thing that are add ons elsewhere in town. This includes domestic phone calls, internet access, beach chairs and umbrellas, parking, and of course we have no resort fees that go as high as $40 per day and you receive a complimentary continental breakfast every day.  We just installed a brand mew foosball table and air hockey. It sounds like the ping pong table needs to be next. Thanks for the feedback we will be taking a look at that.  Thank you again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: My Wife and I have stayed here many times...Birthday's, Anniversary's, weekend "Get-A-Way's", P.O.M. every August and have really enjoyed our visits. This past weekend we reserved Rm. 408 and we were really looking forward to utilizing the Patio to enjoy the Ocean View. This trip we had the "Misfortune" of being in the Room next to a Room that was utilizing the Hotel for a "Bachelorette" Party...for a while we enjoyed the festivities but after a couple hours we were ready for it to stop. I went to the Front Desk and spoke to "Bryndon" about the situation and he was Great. He upgraded us to Rm. 304...didn't charge us extra and the Girls were able to continue their Party. Thanks again Laguna Riviera ! We look forward to our next visit and by the way...we really like the completed
Manager Response: Thank you for your repeat business. We are honored you trust your vacation experience to the Laguna Riviera. I'm glad we had the availability so Bryndon could upgrade you to a non-bachelorette party area.... 304's private balcony has a great ocean view and is a wonderful location to enjoy that first cup of coffee in the morning.  Your comment about the new walkway is appreciated. It was a long process from start to finish but now that it is complete we are all looking forward to seeing the newly planted landscaping take hold and I'm sure be even more stunning this time next year.  Thanks again and we look forward to seeing you again next year.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We arrived for our annual, summer trip to the beautiful Laguna Riviera with tremendous excitement to see the new patio with the stunning views of the surf and ocean.  The new patio now has metal bars where once there were glass panes.  With the metal bars in place, the view has been somewhat diminished.   In prior years, in the early mornings,I would sit inside with my coffee and stare out to the ocean.  Now, the view is partially obstructed, although I can still hear the sound of the crashing waves.    Service remains tremendous; cleanliness, value and location are tops.  Thank you Laguna Riviera for another splendid trip.    Patio Pros: No more splinters from the wooden deck; beautiful, new lounge chairs  Cons: awkward view of the ocean, staircase placed in the middle of the
Manager Response: Welcome back for another year and thank you for the review.   We are so glad to hear you had a wonderful time and enjoyed the property and town. The new patios at 101 were a result of city requirements as we rebuilt the slope. What I do like is it opens the view from inside the room since it is now a terraced space. Architecturally it  aligns with the railing systems used throughout the property. In place of the wood used in prior years we upgraded to far superior aluminum. It does slightly obscure the view but the trade off is it allows the breeze to pass through making for a much more comfortable space in the summer.  I actually have a guest who used to call the old glass enclosed deck a solar oven because he could only spend a short time on it before going to the pathway to cool off.   Like you, we all miss the tree and tried to relocate it during construction but, unfortunately it did not survive. We have planted the areas on the north and south sides of the patios and when complete the patios will be far more private and hidden behind the greenery and out of view from the pathway and adjacent house. We believe this will make for a very cozy and beautiful space.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nites.  I had also found this place from trip advisor and we couldn't have been happier.  Wonderful beachfront access, within walking distance to many shops and restaurants, and they provided beach toys and rentals for beach chairs and boogie boards.  We had free parking and free breakfast all for a very reasonable price.  They also provided us with a very reasonable and much appreciated late checkout on our last day since we didn't fly out till 630PM.  THANK YOU!!!  The only drawback that we experienced was our room 512 and 412 to some degree at the end of the day when it had reached 86 degrees outside the room 512 was 91 and 412 was 85, and neither room had a/c.  So it took awhile for them to cool off to be able to sleep.  Overall, we would stay there
Manager Response: Thank you for the fine review. It is great to know you had a memorable vacation and enjoyed the location, beach, all of our amenities. While we cannot alway provide late check out, we are happy to do so when ever it is possible. Even if it is not, you are welcome to have us store your luggage so you can go enjoy the beach and town, making the most of your vacation, until it is time to return to the airport.  As we enter the summer it can get a bit warm but in most cases open windows remedy the situation as you enjoy the cooling ocean breeze. Many rooms do have A/C and they are listed in our online room descriptions. We would love to have A/C in all rooms and will as soon as we can get upgraded power lines from the Edison Company. For the time being, we have several portable A/C units available upon request.  Next time you stay please feel free to request a portable A/C unit and our staff will be happy to bring one to your room. The average  year round high in Laguna Beach is 73f and the average low is 52f with the peak in Aug/Sept averaging 80f high and a 60f low so it is generally pretty comfortable. I live just up the street and, like many locals, do not have central a/c but on occasion, like you, would appreciate it during the mid day highs.  We appreciate you patronage and I look forward to your next stay with us.  All the best & Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: Best location!  Best atmosphere!  Everything was in walking distance (Ralph‚Äôs, Starbucks, Restaurants, and beaches). This little hidden gem is hands down one of the best vacation spots in Laguna Beach with free parking, free breakfast and beach access.   This is an older property that that has been recently updated with modern finishes. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: What a great review, short and to the point. We are glad you had a great time, honored by your comments, and look forward to your next stay with us.  Have a great summer.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: I came across the Laguna Riviera online looking for a last minute weekend trip for my birthday. My husband I wanted to be right next to the ocean/beach and this place was AWESOME!! We booked room 510 with a partial ocean view and it was amazing!   What I liked:  - The VIEW!
