Even though we weren't looking right at the ocean, a great view was just steps outside our door.  - The price! You can't beat it!! - The room. It was a great size with a mini fridge, microwave and a balcony! It didn't feel cramped at all and have lots of windows to open up and let the fresh breeze in. - Hotel attendant, he was super nice and made us feel comfortable!  What I didn't like I only have one complaint, and it's super silly...I didn't like the comforter/duvet. The material felt too rough.  Overall,
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience while vacationing at the Laguna Riviera. Relaxing and value is what its all about and Im glad enjoyed your stay.   We strive to provide the best value on the beach in Laguna which is why we keep it simple and include parking, continental breakfast, high speed internet, beach chairs, towels and umbrellas and beach toys for the kids. Add to that there is no surprise resort fee or charge for calls within the continental US and you have a very predictable and reasonable bill.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: Laguna Beach for a Long Weekend
Summary: I‚Äôm writing this review having spent two nights at the Riviera with a third to go before I check out. I have Room 407, which is not the greatest position but that‚Äôs my own fault as I left my booking very late, which eliminated any choice. Having said that, the room itself is plenty large enough, especially when compared to some of the local motel-type accommodation in Laguna Beach. The room is well appointed and has all the basic equipment, including a microwave, fridge and coffee-maker. No electric kettle but that‚Äôs pretty standard even in the most expensive American hotels. Americans don‚Äôt drink tea. Only coffee! I found the room decor borderline dingy and it‚Äôs all to do with the dark and somewhat depressing choice of colours, fabrics and finishes. Dark wood stained furniture
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. As we enter the Summer Season it is necessary to book early to get a premium view or room.  Your room unit 407 has a small view of the ocean, and while not one of our larger rooms is over 325 sqf which is larger than an average hotel room, and this does not include the outdoor seating area. From personal experience traveling to your home town of London and staying in several hotels and high end properties,  I know 407 would be thought of as more spacious than average.  Room 407 was completely remodeled in 2009. While Im sorry the decor is not to your taste I am glad you saw it to be in good shape and not worn. Many have complimented us on the new decor and the work of the designer who put it all together and I am sorry that is was not to your taste but glad you were comfortable.   While we do not stock the rooms with tea or tea pots we are happy to provide them upon request and tea is always available in the lobby during all hours we are open at no charge.  It is unfortunate that the internet disrupted your stay. We were having issues with the service provider and as of yesterday they have successfully restored full coverage and bandwidth for all of our guests. We provide internet access at no charge and like our gusts find it frustrating when its not operating at 100%.  We hope you chose to stay with us on your next visit to Laguna Beach and if you can book early recommend room 508. It has arguably the best view on the property, a private surf view deck and was remodeled this year.  Happy travel,  -Kort

Summary Heading: Very nice resort on the beach
Summary: We stayed for one night and had a room in the older part of the resort with a spectacular view over the surf. We could observe the surfers from sunrise to nigthfall and could hear the surf during the night. The hotel is really clean and nice and offers complimentary breakfast items you can take down to the tables overlooking the beach. The room we have been in had a fridge and microwave and wine and champagne glasses and there are BBQ facilities you can reserve at the front desk. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We can recommend this hotel very much.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience while vacationing at the Laguna Riviera. Our friendly staff and clean rooms are just a start to make sure you are comfortable and ready for a great vacation here in Laguna Beach.  The views and surf are amazing all year round and I am happy to know that they did not fail to make your stay a memorable one. As in your room, all of our rooms include a microwave, coffee maker, refrigerator and are either stocked with wine & champagne glasses or have them available upon request.    You hit one of the many highlights enjoyed by our guests. The lawn and patio area overlooking the crashing surf featuring a pair of commercial BBQ s for guests to use preparing anything from chicken and burgers for lunch to steak and seafood dinners. We used to have one BBQ and found that it was so popular that we had to add a second to make sure everyone could be accommodated during the peak summer months.  Thank you again for the review and saying that ," We can recommend this hotel very much." Coming from a top contributor with over 162 reviews to their credit it means a lot to us.  I and the entire staff of the Laguna Riviera look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: Don't judge a book by its cover‚Ä¶great views for a reasonable price!
Summary: My partner and I celebrated a birthday weekend here, so it was intended to be a romantic getaway with gorgeous views of the ocean and hopefully a comfortable stay. I must admit I was initially a little disappointed as I pulled up to Laguna Riviera by the exterior - it's dated and is a weird pink color‚Ä¶but after we checked in and had an opportunity to see our room, our private patio, and private lanai, I realized that this was perfect!  Check-in: quick and efficient, no issues. I do wish the lady at the front desk had provided a brief overview of the included amenities‚Ä¶I missed the fact that there was a complimentary breakfast and we ended up buying breakfast from down the street.  Beach views and access: We stayed in room 303, which is on the middle level of the resort. The
Manager Response: Thank you for the fine review. I appreciate your initial take on the property and headline of "Don't judge a book by it's cover". It is so true, and I'll share some history that will explain the "cover".   The Laguna Riviera is the last original family owned hotel in town. It was opened by my grandfather in 1948 and created with the architectural flavor and colors of the coastal regions of the Italian and French Rivieras. We have opted to keep the exterior in line with the original design and colors while upgrading the interiors creating a relaxing and tranquil space to vacation.  I am glad you enjoyed room 303 it is one of my favorites and has a wonderful view from the semi-private deck. If you enjoyed 303 I highly recommend you check out 508. The deck is private and the views are arguably the best on the property. Plus, if you stay when there is a chill in the air you have an excuse to enjoy the fireplace.  It is nice to hear we hit the mark of views and value in Laguna Beach. As you know they don't often go together but we strive to make the Laguna Riviera an affordable destination with no surprise charges for things like parking, internet, breakfast or added resort fees which combined can easily add another $50-$70 a night to your vacation elsewhere.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: My husband and I went for a relaxing long weekend. We ended up changing rooms and upgrading and were so happy for it. Room #304. People said the room really matters and I totally agree. I wanted to sleep to the sound of the surf, wake up to see the surf , and relax on the porch. We were lucky enough to see the dolphins swim by. I have booked our getaway for next year. Happy memories. The Hotel provides beach chairs, beach towels and beach unbrellas. Also good coffee in the morning and great muffins. The parking is also free for one car. The hotel is located within walking distance to town, and all in all a very comfortable place.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed room 304. It has a fantastic view from its' private deck. You know it used to be a rare treat to see dolphins out front and now it is a daily occurrence. The rich sea life that populates our shore draws in dolphins, seals, and whales when they are migrating. Even growing up in Laguna one never tires of watching the dolphins swim by and play in the surf.  You hit on some key differences between the Laguna Riviera and many other Laguna Beach Hotels. When you arrive we do not have many of the extra or surprise charges that our neighbors add to your bill. Parking is free, internet is free, a continental breakfast is free, and your beach chairs, umbrellas and beach towels are included without any additional resort fee.  Between resorts fees, internet fees and parking fees, you can easily see another $50-$70 per day added to your stay. I don't like such surprises when I travel so the Laguna Riviera does not do it when you stay with us.   Thank you for noticing the muffins. We have recently changed suppliers and after testing the offerings of several local bakeries we landed on a winner. The muffins combined with your choice of hot / cold cereals, juice, fresh fruit, coffee, milk and several tea choices make for a quick way to jump start your day. Many guests like to eat and visit in the breakfast bar while other enjoy taking their food back to the room and relaxing on their desck or one of the public ocean view areas around the property.  Thank you again for taking the time to share your experience and we look forward to seeing you next year.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: Old charm of the 60's...Nice to earth place to stay.
Summary: Got married 10-11-12 and spent out honeymoon in one of their suites consisting of one large room, king bed, sofa, love seat color TV. The bathroom is on the smaller size but as a big guy I had no problem. Our room, like most of their rooms, over look the ocean and had a balcony to sit out on so you can watch the people play on the beach and a beautiful California sunset. The place is not fancy, as I said has the taste and the charm of the 60's. Originally built when cars were much smaller, parking in their small lot is like fitting a puzzle together. Although we did not use the pool it is heated and enclosed so you can swim in the winter.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review. We are honored you selected the Laguna Riviera for your Honeymoon. We have hosted many newlyweds, and find the sunsets, views, and location always delivers a wonderful experience and great memories. Many of our honeymooners make staying with us an annual event returning each year to celebrate their anniversary.  The property was opened in 1948 when cars were smaller and, like all of Laguna, parking is tight but manageable. The pool and Jacuzzi are both salt water next time you stay I encourage you to give them a try. Its a very relaxing and soothing experience and not like like a traditional chlorinated pool.  We wish you newlyweds a long, happy and prosperous life and relationship and hope to get to say hello when you next stay with us.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary: This was our 3rd time staying at the Laguna Riviera.  This time we brought our family to share our wonderful experience.  We booked 2 rooms next to each other and each had a kitchen and a wonderful shared deck for meals, watching the surf and sunsets.  We were so happy that the walkway to the beach was finished just in time for us. Everyone was so accommodating and friendly.  We had wonderful long walks each way on the sand.  The only draw back with that is we picked up tar on our shoes and feet from the sand.  We ended up buying some fingernail polish remover from Ralphs.  The location to town was so convenient.  There was great access to all the coves and wonderful landscaping along the cliff walk ways. We can hardly wait to go back.
Manager Response: Repeat business is the highest complement we can receive. Thank you for sharing your experience and we are so glad the family had such a wonderful experience.    From your tar experience it sounds like it's time for us to put out the orange cleaner. It works great on removing tar from the feet and is non toxic. While it's not common it does wash up from time to time.  Thank you again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary Heading: Cozy Escape to seaside mural heaven
Summary: My wife and I just spent two wonderful nights in room 515 of the Laguna Riveria.   First, it is much smaller looking in life then in the pictures. And it is definitely an older hotel catering to some long time users and surfers as well, right on a good surfing beach.  Use Google to get street side view.  The office folks are super nice and helpful in everyway.   There is a free continental breakfast, just average, but better then nothing.  The rooms are all unique and we were on the top floor with a room on either side.  Now, you would think being in the middle would be the least private, but actually here it is the most private.   There is an average size room, then a pretty big lanai or wet room, then a balcony.  The balcony has a table, 4 chairs and two comfy loungers in
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to go into such detail on your stay. Your observations will be useful to travelers as they consider ocean front properties and things to do in Laguna.   As you touched on the Laguna Riviera has many different rooms from large suites with full size kitchen, living room, bedroom, dining room and private deck to cozy studios with semi-private decks with spectacular views. Our average room is over 400 square feet.  We have an online grid to help those new to the property make their selection and our knowledgeable desk staff is always ready to assist.  The construction noise is diminishing and many times non-existent as we start to approach the completion of the new retaining walls, stairs and patios for our 3 bedroom ocean front beach bungalow. Once completed it will be spectacular for family gatherings, small weddings and corporate events. You will even have private access to the beach from the lower patio. As always is the case in construction it has taken quite a bit longer than anticipated but we hope to see completion before summer is in full swing. Also note that there is no construction allowed on the weekends.  The Rivieras location is arguably the best in town close to everything yet just far enough away for some quiet solitude. The best surfing in town is at our doorstep and so many great restaurants are within walking distance that you could stay for two weeks and never eat at the same one twice.   For nightlife there is the Marine Room as mentioned, and I would also recommend the White House as it is also in the downtown area and caters to a similar crowd. The Sandpiper mentioned (known to locals as The Dirty Bird) is just south of us, a lot of fun, with a bit more rowdy of a crowd. For the best sound system and often times world class musicians (think Macy Gray, English Beat, and project groups formed by members of major touring bands) I like to recommend Mozambique. They are less than a mile walk south and if you are a guest of the Laguna Riviera free transportation is offered to and from their restaurant and music lounge. If you are looking for Sunday Reggae without the pretense I know you will enjoy Mozambique's service and atmosphere.   Thanks again & Happy Travels,  -Kort

Summary: Kort, you've done so much to make the hotel beautiful and welcoming!  This is my third stay in three years, and the place just keeps getting better.  From the tasteful and clean rooms to the sound of surf, from the great new walkway down to the beach to the enormous flowers everywhere, the Laguna Riviera has become my favorite place for complete relaxation.  My only hesitation in giving you a great review is that other people will book all the rooms!
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive review and taking the time to share your experience with other travelers. It is reassuring to know all of our efforts to constantly raise the bar are making your stay and experience better each time.   Being right on the ocean, while a stunning and beautiful location, presents ongoing maintenance needs that, I'm proud to say, our  staff excels at staying on top of. The Riviera's new private pathway to the beach, railing system, retaining walls, and terraced patios at 101 have been designed to long term durability and safety.   The rooms have been being fine tuned and we are always open to guests comments and suggestions to improve. Thank you again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We were not sure where we'd end up staying while on a one week road trip from LA to San Diego (Mar.9-16/13) Our first night was booked in advance in Huntington Beach from there we were planning to stay a night here and there.  Out of curiosity we popped into the Riviera while doing a walk around Laguna.  Alex allowed us to see a couple of the available rooms ... who could resist the beach front view from this great spot.  We booked it for 2 nights then planned to drive further south however after our 2 glorious days we couldn't bring ourselves to leave so we booked the rest of our stay here albeit in a different room and just did day trips...one hr or so to LA one hr or so to San Diego. Yes there was a bit of construction going on the beach front of the Riviera but we were not
Manager Response: We are so glad you enjoyed your stay and could not ask for a higher compliment than having you modify your plans so you could stay with us longer.   The construction mentioned is all but completed on the hotel side of the property and we are anxious to get started on the landscaping to bring the garden back to our garden pathway to the beach.  Thanks again and we hope to see you next time your travels bring you to Laguna.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: Clean, cozy, lovely view, beautiful view, friendly staff...  My boyfriend and I came here for a romantic night to ourselves. It was such a wonderful surprise to come into our room (which included a private balcony overlooking the ocean: ROOM 203). The room included a flat screen t.v., dishes, a stove, a microwave, coffee maker, a big beautiful comfy bed, and a lovely bathroom. Everything was clean and looked new. My boyfriend and I even commented on how nice the crown molding was.  Laguna Riviera is walking distance from Ralph's grocery store and some great bars/restaurants...didn't even have to use our car. It was perfect.  I also attached a couple of photos. My boyfriend and I are certain that the sunset we saw that night was one of the most beautiful things we had ever seen.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review and those are a couple of beautiful pictures you posted. They could be used on our post cards. No matter how many amazing sunset we see at the hotel each one is captivating and feels like a new experience. They never get old.  I'm glad you enjoyed your room, and the the remodel. We really focused on keeping the exterior old school an very much with the beach cottage vibe, while making the interiors well appointed and comfortable without going over the top. The target was a very relaxing zen atmosphere and it sounds like we hit the mark.  The ramp to the beach is scheduled to re-open within a couple of weeks once the railings are in place to ensure guest safety. The construction, for the most part, has moved over the the beach house side of the property and generates very little noise.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: My family and I stay here every summer for a few days so when I was looking for a place to take my boyfriend for a birthday surprise, Laguna Riviera was my first thought! We stayed in 201(best room in the house) for two nights and we absolutely LOVED it. The winter rates made our stay a little nicer too. I have already booked our room for the summer! Thanks for another wonderful stay!!
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review and I'm so glad to hear you and your boyfriend had a great time. Room 201 is truly unique and romantic with amazing ocean views in north, south, and straight out to Catalina island. I hope you had a chance to enjoy your private patio for morning coffee or a sunset glass of wine.  We look forward to your stay with us this summer.  Happy New Year! & Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for a couple of days (December 2012) and it was a great experience. We are very picky about hotels and while this was not a very fancy place...it was clean, the staff was friendly and VERY helpful. I accidentally dropped my room key in the trash can and when the maintenance person saw me starting to look into the trash receptacle he came right over to help and then insisted that he do it for me. The view is spectacular and the location is fantastic.  If you are snobbish and looking for an upscale hotel at premium prices, this place is NOT for you. However, if you are a family looking for a clean, reasonably priced place in a great location and that employees friendly, down to earth people...then you must stay here! When we get back to Laguna (and God
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience and the praise of our staff. I will make sure they are aware that their actions were so well received. It means a lot.   While our location is world class, the Riviera is certainly not the Montage but we do have some very nice rooms. Your room 402 is a nice room and we have others that are more upscale. Since the property was built in three phases over many years we have 41 rooms and they are all different and unique. It is always fun to watch repeat guests try different rooms until they find a favorite that they return to year after year.   Happy Holidays and we look forward to your next visit with us.  Thanks again,  Kort

Summary: We were very disappointed with this holiday experience. The location we couldn't fault - right on the beach. Exactly how it was depicted in the pictures on the website. HOWEVER what wasn't made clear when we booked was the extensive site reconstruction work - effectively the lower half of the resort was a building site. Balconies were very dusty and the noise of machinery did not go down well when trying to sunbathe. The duty manager acknowledged this and offered to clean our balcony. He then offered us an alternative room - the first we rejected but took the second one. We took the second option 'the suite' which was dated and adequate at best. It certainly needs some TLC. Overall not a holiday experience we would want to repeat.
Manager Response: I agree that everyone needs to be informed, and am sorry this guest was dissapointed by our slope renovation. We have done everything we can to well publicize the repair work. It has been underway since the beginning of the year.   After 7-1/2 years of engineering, design and challenging city roadblocks we finally received permission to stabilize the front slope and protect the hotels buildings. We have been very active making this known to all. If you book online you must acknowledge that you have read the construction notice prior to booking. The front page of our website states very simply and clearly that the slope is under construction, even on TripAdvisor we have a notice that we are under repair with a detailed description available, and when you call to book, the front office makes sure to deliver the message.   Fortunately we are very close to completion and once done a new pathway and landscaping will be installed. Until that happens guests must reach the beach by using the public access adjacent to the property. From many rooms it is the same or a shorter distance and in no case does it increase the walk by more than a minute.  Yes the pathway to the beach is a great convenience and we regret that these repairs became necessary to keep the property safe, but the side access serves guest well to reach the sand. The pathway will soon be reopened and when it is, updates will be posted on our website.   Once the repairs are completed we hope you will give us another try and perhaps an updated review.   Happy travels,  Kort

Summary: I found this hotel from reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. I loved the location since it is walking distance to many restaurants, not to mention it is right on the beach! The view was awesome and not too crowded with the summer crowd. Alex at the front desk was very accommodating. Thanks for the great customer service! I am a satisfied customer who will return again and again.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. It is what the vast majority of our guest feel and I appreciate that you have taken the time to post to TripAdvisor. I'll pass along your compliments to Alex (he lives to deliver great service) and we all look forward to your next stay with us.  Thanks again & Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: My husband, son and i were scheduled to stay a Laguna Riviera Beach Resort for 3 nights as we were in the area for a wedding.  The moment that we arrived we were really disappointed.  The room had a very bad smell of mold and some other disgusting smell.  There was no air conditioning and the temps were very warm.  The  noise from PCH kept us up most of the night along with a group of young people on the floor above us who partied all night.  The carpet was dirty and there were no parking spaces left so we had to park out on the street.  The night attendant was very nice and helpful, but the morning guy was sleeping at 8:30am in the morning and was a bit grouchy. They told us that the path to the beach would definitely be open when we made our reservations, but it was still
Manager Response: We are sorry that you had a less than perfect stay. I wish you had asked for another room if you were not happy with the one you booked. I would like to know which room you had because we have no record of any odor issues in any of the rooms.   With regards to the noise from coast highway. All rooms have double pane glass and only 2 of our rooms face coast highway. These 2 rooms are on the top floor above our office. While we rarely have comments on the street noise there are occasional emergency vehicle that go by which can be heard everywhere in town.  It is unfortunate that the family above your room was creating noise. I wish you had contacted the front desk. We are always available and happy to interven and quiet any guests that are being disruptive.  With regards to the A/C our website clearly states what rooms do and do not have A/C and we have several portable units that are brought to your room upon request.   Our website also clearly states the current status of our slope repair and beach access pathway. As I write this it still shows the path is closed. as it has since the end of January.  Unfortunately the contractor is behind schedule. Fortunately, it is just as easy and the same distance if not a bit shorter to simply access the beach via the side street.   I see from your only other review on TripAdvisor that you stayed across the street from us at the Holiday Inn on coast highway and had a great time. Even though they are not on the beach, Im glad they met your needs, and  that you were able to still enjoy Laguna.   I'm sorry we dropped the ball and were unable to earn your business.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: Stayed here for one night when we were on our road trip of California ,we were finding it a problem to get digs for the night then we came across this place,friendly staff, nice room over looking the ocean complete with dolphins. Every thing we needed was on tap plenty of places close by to get food and lots of bars , wonderful beach,sorry I know you are not allowed to take the shells but I just could not help myself they are sitting on the side of our bath, they remind us of a great holiday and a lovely hotel on the beach,would stay here again and highly recommend.
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear you found the Laguna Riviera when searching for a 1 night stay on your road trip. This time of year it can be tough to find a ocean view room in Laguna Beach on short notice and I'm glad to see we were able to accommodate.  Sighting dolphins used to be a rare experience and more recently it has been something you can do on an almost daily basis. Even living here I always pause to take in their beauty and it's great to know they were part of your vacation. PS I wont say anything about the shells.... ;-)  Thanks for the kind words & Happy Travel,  Kort

Summary: My hubby and I just returned yesterday; we were there from 9/17 - 9/22 (weather was absolutely perfect).  It is located about 1/2 mile from center of town; easy walk.   Stayed in rm. 402 (full ocean view) for 4 nights and didn't want to leave so we got another rm. (407) for a 5th night since our rm. was booked for the additional night.  They have done a lot of renovating since we were there years ago and it looks just lovely.  It had a fridge, microwave, coffee maker, 2 bath robes, flat screen TV, continental breakfast which I took full advantage of, a very nice patio right outside our room with tables and chairs and lounging chairs.  They also have a computer to use in the front office area in case you need it.  There were 2 BBQ's right below our room which we cooked salmon on
Manager Response: It's great to hear when a guest has such a wonderful and memorable time staying at the Laguna Riviera. Thank you for sharing your experience and what a great compliment that you extended your stay. This is really such a great time of year to visit Laguna Beach with perfect weather no big crowds and the ocean still at the right temperature for a swim.  Thank you again and we look forward to your next visit.  Happy travel,  Kort

Summary: My husband and I are on vacation and our goal was to get to California and drive up the coast starting at San Diego. I had mentioned to him that when I was 18 I stayed at this great hotel on the beach in Laguna but I couldn't remember the name. I started looking up hotels on trip advisor and found it!!! It has been extremely renovated but more or less it still looks the same from 20 something years ago. Very pricey but overall it was wonderful room and the view from the multiple decks they have is wonderful. They are still working on the stairs that go down to the beach so you have to walk around abit. So happy to have that experience again so many years later. Beware the cost is $ 200 and up.
Manager Response: Thank you for giving the nice review. We are so glad you were able to find us after 20 years. It's a such a compliment that the Laguna Riviera left such great memories that you wanted to find us while on your vacation this year.  The pathway to the sand is almost complete and now that summer is at an end, the rates are back down. So it's now $138 and up. This time of year, mid September and October usually offers the same great weather as summer but with better rates and a much quieter town.  I'm glad after 20 years you noticed the newly remodeled rooms. They are quite comfortable but we left the exterior alone keeping it vintage 1950's.  Thanks again and I hope we see you back before another 20 years go by.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: Just got back from the Laguna Riviera with my husband and 10 year old daughter.  I loved this hotel.  The room was basic (402) but clean, and had a little fridge and coffee maker.  Where this property really shines is its location.  There was a patio right outside of our door outfitted with chairs and tables and the most beautiful views of the ocean and crashing surf that you can imagine.  There are barbeque's set up for people who wanted to grill (and a grocery store just a block away).  Parking was plentiful and convenient.  The steps to the beach are right on the side of the hotel while they fix the on property steps.  The construction didn't bother us.  All we had to do is move down the beach a bit if it bothered us.  The hotel provides beach chairs, umbrellas and beach
Manager Response: We wish you could have stayed another week as well. The weather is spectacular and it's a great place to be this time of year.  I appreciate that you have taken the time to share your experience with others and agree that the Riviera is indeed a Cool Funky Hotel. With the recent room upgrades we have created new beachy comfortable zen like interiors while avoiding being too trendy or modern. These new rooms combined with the old school original 1950's Laguna Beach exterior gives travelers a nice blend of both worlds.    I'm glad the renovation of our ocean front slope was not intrusive and we have to thank the contractor and his crew for going out of their way to keep noise and dust as suppressed as possible.  I'll pass your shout out to Bryndon (if he has not already read this ;-) and look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: READ ALL REVIEWS BEFORE YOU CHOOSE
Summary: This hotel has very nice rooms with seaview terraces which are reserved early for families that visit every summer for many years. Occasionial visitors like us were treated to a room facing a noisy thoroughfare. Since the room had no airconditioning (an unrevealed surprise when we made the reservation), the noise was unbearable, because of the open windows. The beach is literally five floors below the hotel and accesssible only by climbing a narrow, open staircase. Good for exercise but a pain for those who carry blankets, towels, bags, etc. to the beach. The common spaces are borderline sloppy, with many of the  staircases and walkways within the hotel covered with filthy carpeting (and it is not just sand). The so-called " free continental breakfast'' contains about $1.50
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience while staying with us, and like you,  I also encourage readers to peruse all reviews, explore our website, and call with any questions to make the most informed decision possible. Thank you for complimenting our very nice rooms and location.  I'm sorry that our ocean front location does not provide an elevator to the beach, but unfortunately, that was not a viable option when the property was built in 1948, and today we could never get a retrofit approved by the city. Fortunately it is an easier walk than staying across the street or at one of the many properties in town that are not actually on the ocean.  While our beach pathway is closed for renovations (expected to reopen soon) you do need to use the adjacent public stairs down to the sand. All in all it takes 2-3 minutes.  Yes you are correct we are very busy in the Summer with many families returning year after year and often selling out a year in advance. Anyone traveling to Laguna Beach on short notice in the summer will likely not have access to the preferred rooms unless there is a cancellation.   The worn exterior hallway carpets mentioned are schedule for replacement after the summer season closes. They do get a lot of abuse being outside and on the ocean and it is unfortunate that they impacted your stay with us.  The configuration of all of our rooms, including if they have A/C or not, is clearly called out on our website, and for those without A/C who do not get enough relief from the cool ocean breeze we offer portable A/C units like the one you mentioned that you were offered.  Our FREE Continental breakfast is dictated by the health department to be individually wrapped which could cause one to believe it is junk food. It is not. The pastries are prepared fresh and delivered daily, the fresh fruit usually consisting of bananas, apples and oranges are straight from the farm, we also provide name brand cereals both hot and cold, along with coffee, an assortment of teas, several fruit juices and milk. We may be expanding this offering in the future pending approvals to upgrade our food service permits and install an approved kitchen. The continental breakfast is complimentary and a nice way to get started in the morning. If one needs a more robust breakfast there are several great options within a 1-2 minute walk of the hotel, or you can have the folks next door deliver to your room.  You can certainly find less expensive accommodations in Laguna Beach but not on the ocean. If price is your main concern I encourage anyone to check rates on the North end of town at the properties inland of Coast Highway. If your desire is to stay ocean front with direct beach access, then we offer the best value in town. Unlike many ocean front properties, we do not charge for parking, internet, continental breakfast, beach chairs & umbrellas, and the new resort fee showing up everywhere. If price is not an issue I encourage anyone to look at the Montage, a truly amazing property or the Surf & Sand, both just to the south of us.  You are right, we are a family friendly hotel and because of that we have many loyal return guests every year. If one is looking for a quiet romantic retreat without the presence of family activities, please consider the off season when kids are back in school and both the hotel and town are much quieter.  Happy travel,  -Kort

Summary Heading: 17 years of great vacations at the laguna riviera
Summary: can not say enough about how great this place is,we have been bringing grand children for 17 years ,now they have grown up and we bring our great grand children,you can not ask for nicer and helpful staff ,we missed joan this year and were sad to hear she had passed away.room 403 the deals
Manager Response: Repeat business is the highest compliment we can receive and we thank you for your continued patronage. It is validation that we are successfully carrying on the tradition established when the Laguna Riviera doors were opened in 1948 by my grandfather, Mr. Harry Willats.  It is a testament that the town, location, and property create such special feelings and memories. I have to share that when I was a kid in the early 70's working at the hotel I met many kids vacationing with their parents and grandparents. Today I still run into some of them as they continue the tradition and are now vacationing at the Laguna Riviera with their children.  You selected room 403 a great 1 bedroom suite with an ocean view and a full kitchen. A very popular room with families for the views and functionality.  Thank you again for the review, sharing your history and the kind mention of Joan. We all miss her.   We look forward to your visit next year.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: Beautiful location, right on the beach. Family owned and very comfy. Indoor pool and hot-tub. Staff is extremely friendly. Loved it!
Manager Response: So glad to hear you enjoyed your stay and one of the finest beaches in Laguna.  We hope to see you back soon. Thanks for taking the time to share your experience and everyone here appreciates your compliment to staff.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: In a city of over-priced beach resorts, the Laguna was a terrific find. It's quaint design reflects it's history, and it has been modernized just enough not to kill it's charm. Very comfortable beds and bathrooms.  It's right in town, so you can walk to all of Laguna's  shops and restaurants. Easy access from the freeways, or take a drive up/down the coast to get to it.  Friendly staff and housekeepers, and guest actually socialized with each other!  Finally, don't be afraid of the "cheaper" rooms.... they still have a great view!
Manager Response: You have summed up the Laguna Riviera very well. Thank you for this fresh and spot on review.   The Laguna Riviera is the last of the original family owned and operated hotels in town. It was built by my grandfather and opened in 1948. Today, family members along with Laguna locals continue to operate and work at the hotel. We have been careful to embrace the old Laguna feel and beach vibe by keeping the exterior of the property as original as possible with with all its old school charm while giving all of the interiors a major upgrade with a zen feel so your comfortable and ready to relax the minute you arrive. You have a pallet of earth tones reflecting the coastal colors, luxurious bedding, flat screen HD televisions, proximity door locks, automatic energy efficient lighting and switches, and upgraded bathrooms, kitchens and kitchenettes.   With a great location and beautiful rooms, views, and grounds we still keep our rates the best in town when looking for a beach front vacation. Amenities like property wide high speed internet access, surf view  commercial grade BBQs to cook your evening diner, parking, beach toys, umbrellas, chairs and towels are all inclusive with your stay as is the continental breakfast hosted each morning in the lobby. These complimentary amenities combined with no resort fees make the Laguna Riviera a great value.  Thanks again for taking the time to share your experience with others and I appreciate your comment about the less expensive rooms. It is so true, the upgrades and remodel have made them all comfortable and tastefully furnished.  We look forward to your next visit.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary Heading: You might want to skip if you have small children or are physically challenged
Summary: Let me preface this review by telling you I have been staying here for many years and currently have ANOTHER reservation for this same location soon after this review will be published. I apologize in advance for the lengthy review, but so much is wrong with this last stay I feel it should be noted. Let‚Äôs start off with the ‚ÄúUgly‚Äù and move on to the Bad and Good. THIS HOTEL IS UNDER MAJOR CONSTRUCTION! Yes, when I say major I mean a major feature of the hotel is not available and that is the beach access. You see, one of the nice things about this hotel was that it had (notice I said HAD) a gently sloping switchback (with no stairs) in the back of the hotel with direct access to Laguna Beach. This switchback allows anyone with small children or physically challenged people to
Manager Response: Thanks for sharing your impressions of the hotel project, and let me take a few moments to clarify what is going on.  Yes after 7-1/2 years of design and city applications finally approval has been granted to repair the landslide suffered on the ocean side of the property.   This fact is highly visible on the front page of our website and has been all year, along with pictures that are updated regularly to offer a clear idea of the scope and location of the project. During this repair the pathway to the beach is closed and beach access is out the side of the property and down the public stairs. The side access is actually the shortest route to the beach but is not as scenic and does involve stairs, rather than a pathway with switchbacks. This is all a short term inconvenience to create a long term solution to a major issue. While we expected completion by June the circumstance of the local geology combined with a very complex build has unfortunately extended our deadline until after summer.  There is printed notice of the work and new beach access clearly and predominately posted on our website, at the check in desk, it is given when reservations are made, plus there is signage on the pathway and all of this has been in place since we began at the beginning of this year.  The construction is isolated to the slope and is not a property wide major project. With this said you may hear some of the equipment from time to time or an infrequent jack hammer if an unforeseen boulder is unearthed, but fortunately on the hotel side it looks like most of the digging is complete and we are now in the final stages. We will be back-filling dirt and gravel as the final block walls are stacked and the pathway is restored to its original location with new railings and lighting to improve safety.  I'm sorry to learn that neighboring guests gathering on the public deck disrupted your stay. And, should note that it cannot even accommodate 100's of people. It has two tables and in it's entirety is suitable for 15-20 max. However, in situations like this, we are more than happy to intervene and quiet things down so that everyone has a restful and enjoyable stay. Please call the office and we will take care of it.  With regards to the parking we have parking for every room. If one cannot locate parking just talk to the desk and you will be accommodated. If employees or contracted workers are taking any spaces they will be asked to move immediately as they are already not allowed to park onsite. If this still fails to produce a parking spot we will pay for your parking meter.  While I am sorry and concerned that this guest fell down I must assure all readers that there is no construction debris in any guest accessible area. It is all behind blockades or areas clearly marked "No Trespassing". The only impact that the construction has caused us is a light dust that floats up towards some of the directly ocean facing areas when we have an onshore breeze. This, housekeeping stays on top of and the work crew is constantly watering down the actual construction site to keep this light dust to a minimum.  I took a look at the nice video link with the great ocean view shared by this guest and you can hear a jackhammer at work. This activity was short lived to clear a boulder and is not something that is ongoing.  We know that such work can be disruptive and very clear information has been posted on our website all year offering complete disclosure for all to read. Please feel free to visit and see as things progress, and be notified when everything has been repaired, and the pathway returned to its original location and rebuilt to a safe standard that stabilizes not only the slope but the entire hotel.  Thank you for sharing your photos and I encourage everyone who is interested in seeing more to visit our website lagunariviera.com and monitor the weekly progress. In the meantime anyone interested in the current state of construction can feel free to contact me at the hotel or via email at kort@lagunariviera.com to learn more.  Happy travel,  Kort

Summary: As always, an amazing weekend at an exceptional hotel on an extraordinary section of Laguna Beach! Love the relaxed, laidback feel amid all the excitement happening right on the beach! On this most current trip (customer since 2001), we missed our favorite, Room 101 with the fabulous private deck but we were treated like VIPs and given the Beach Bungalow (due to renovations)- WOW!! Thanks to the entire staff for their helpfulness and hospitality! When it comes to Southern California beach towns and spots, the Laguna Riviera on Laguna Beach is #1. Gabriela
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review and your 12 year of patronage. Repeat business is the highest compliment we can receive.  I am so glad you enjoyed the Beach Bungalow it is a special place and built in 1931 is truly an authentic Laguna Beach cottage but with all of the expected modern upgrades. Hey we even swapped out the gas lamps for electricity, but kept the original glass fixtures. We will have 101 completed for your visit next year. It will have a new terraced front patio, and as always, amazing views.  We appreciate yours, and everyone's, patience while we complete the rebuilding of the ocean slope stabilizing it and upgrading the ocean pathway. The work is taking longer than originally planned due to the geology and very tight building location but when complete it will be a beautiful upgrade to both the hotel and the house providing years of functionality and customer enjoyment.  Thanks again and we look forward to seeing you on your next visit.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary Heading: Unexpected jewel-location, customer service and beach atmosphere all in one place
Summary: This was a last minute trip to Laguna, a place I only was on TV.  I searched the web and I saw many 'boutique' places and vibe was all off.  I kept going back to the site for the Laguna Riviera and they have such an user friendly room availablity system.  I finally narrowed my selections and called rather than book online.  Even though I called several times to ask  questions about location or activities that will be happening around town, the excellent customer service from Alex and Brendan finally sold me. I asked about some room choices and they suggested a few and I decided on Room 302.  My wife and I drove 4 hours from Las Vegas and even arrived after hours, so to speak,  but Bredan still greeted us with a smile at the door and  and made our check in a breeze.   Room 302
Manager Response: I'm so glad your online research paid off and you discovered the Laguna Riviera and that we met or exceeded your expectations.  You selected a very cozy room with a great view, large deck, and fireplace. I know that our staff will appreciate your kind words and we will post your review where they can see it and know their efforts are appreciated. They do try to treat everyone like they are part of the family, even if you check in after hours ;-)  The slope project has gone over schedule and is a pretty monumental task, but the crew is doing their best to be as quiet and unobtrusive as possible. It is an impressive undertaking and I encourage everyone to take a look from the beach and see what they are doing. Once complete it will stabilize our slope, improve the pathway to the beach, add a terraced patio to 101, and open up the 2 patios below the house.  Thanks again, and to answer your question, Yes, you are welcome to stay anytime.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary: We stayed at this hotel last week.  Our group had 2 different rooms, an ocean view and surf view. The view and sounds of ocean day and night were awesome in the surf view room.  The ocean view rooms do have ocean views and sounds of ocean during the day, but when doors are closed and locked at night you can't hear the ocean. So if hearing the ocean at night is important you will have to pay for surf view. The main grilling area with chairs and tables is really nice so no matter which room you have, you can grill and hang out ocean front. We grilled 3 of the 4 nights we stayed and loved eating dinner and watching the sunset. We even saw dolphins 2 of the nights. We ate their breakfast 3 of the mornings and there is fresh fruit, hot and cold cereal, muffins , coffee and juice. It
Manager Response: Thank you for the fine review and enjoying one of the favorite features of the property. It is such a special moment when you can sit down watching the last rays of the sunset, while watching passing dolphins and taking that first bit of freshly grilled fish or steak, add family and friends and you have that perfect moment.  At the Laguna Riviera our goal is to offer the best value in town when comparing price, location, amenities and service and we are glad to have hit this mark for you. The price of the room covers everything you could need, including parking, high speed internet access, phone service, continental breakfast, beach towels, chairs & umbrellas and absolutely none of the resort fees we are starting to see everywhere.   Thanks again, the staff and I look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: Overlooking ocean from multiple decks with comfortable seating
Summary: Sitting on the deck listening to waves crash is the best!
Manager Response: We are very glad you enjoyed your vacation at the Laguna Riviera and the views and crashing waves were a highlight. It is certainly easy to sit and just take in the views for hours, spotting for dolphins, and whales, while watching the surfers and passersby.  The ambiance and location of the Laguna Riviera provides for a truly relaxing vacation and we look forward to your next visit to Laguna Beach and the Laguna Riviera.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: I read all the reviews and decided on this place because of all the people that keep coming back year after year.  It was very important to me to have a fabulous beach/ocean view and this place has it for sure.  I was traveling by myself and felt very safe the whole time; I even left the door open to the room while I took a nap.  Never have done that before!  The room was nice and clean and nicely refurbished.  The staff was friendly and helpful and welcoming.  I was happy that I chose the Laguna Riviera for my LB vacation.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review. I am glad to hear you had a great experience and that the Riviera met your expectations. We look forward to you becoming one of our regulars and look forward to your next stay.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary Heading: Another wonderful stay at this fine hotel
Summary: This is a great place for a low key, beach-oriented escape from everyday life.  Go to the Surf and Sand or Montage if you crave Hollywood flash...this is an old school beach hotel with the luxury of an indoor pool for those clammy days/evenings with the "marine layer" hiding the sun.  A short walk to Forest Ave (downtown) and several excellent restaurants and almost too many shops, yet on the beach with great views of Thalia Street - a hard core surfing spot.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and we are happy to hear you enjoy what the Riviera is all about. Its about sharing with our guests the authentic Laguna Beach experience.   There is no flash nor pomp and circumstance, we are about the beach life. From our family to yours we keep the experience fresh and relaxed where you can lounge on, or looking at, the beach all day. You can stroll downtown and enjoy the many shops and fine restaurants or just kick back poolside on a cool day and read a new book.  Thank you again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  -Kort

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel every summer since 2007. They have since renovated the rooms and they are much nicer, but we love the quiet feel of this beachy hotel. This time we stayed in the Bungalo and it was very nice with a beautiful view. This hotel is a hidden gem. Doesn't look that great from the outside but we love it. You can always see dolphins in the water, hear the waves from your room, it's clean and continental breakfast is good. It's also convent to all restaurants and shopping.
Manager Response: Repeat stays are the highest compliment we can earn. Thank you for being our guest for the last six years and appreciating the constant improvements to the property. You have joined the ranks of honored repeat guests, some going back as far as 50 years now.  The Laguna Riviera strives to provide affordable, comfortable, and relaxing ocean front vacations. With the Pacific Ocean and Laguna Beach as the back drop the location takes care of itself. Seeing dolphins, whales and more from the shore used to be a rare occasion and now it is almost a daily occurrence. Just the other day we witnessed 12 whales migrating north swimming in a single column.  While that is quite an uncommon sight it was certainly awe inspiring.  I'm glad you enjoyed our classic 1930's beach bungalow. We have strived to keep it as original as possible while adding all the modern amenities. This is evidenced by the original glass gas lamps on the wall that have been converted to electricity. When the downstairs, two lower terraced patios, and private stairs to the beach are re-opened later this year it will be a spectacular venue for that perfect family reunion, special birthday or intimate wedding, and I look forward to you seeing it on your next visit.  Thanks again for sharing your experience.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary Heading: Falling asleep to the sound of waves ...
Summary: It took a TON of searching for a hotel somewhere between San Diego and LA that would be right on the beach, with a suite, and at a reasonable cost -- Laguna Riviera met all 3, and I fell asleep to the sound of the Pacific crashing just outside the windows! Sure, this is no luxury haven -- the (included) breakfast is minimal, the hotel exterior is motel-y, and the sound partitions could be better. But who cares, when we have an apartment-sized suite overlooking the lovely, luxuriant bbq area, palm trees and the ocean! Plus, the rooms are newly done is excellent, minimalistic style; the free wi-fi is great; the concierge recommended a truly outstanding restaurant a couple of blocks away with excellent seafood at bar prices; the murals that cover the property are a lot of fun to
Manager Response: We are so please that your research paid off and you discovered that the Laguna Riviera met all your needs. You make a great observation in that most hotels, while having "beachy" names, are not actually on the beach. Very few between San Diego and Los Angeles are properties actually touching the sand as we do.  Being established in 1948 the Laguna Riviera is indeed a classic beach property with an old school vibe on the exterior that is contrasted with a lovely interior remodel. The fact it has never changed hands or been sold to a conglomerate has kept the rates reasonable and the staff local and knowledgeable. We pride ourselves on being relaxed and family friendly so we don't go for pretense, rather we settle for a comfortable zen approach striving to make everyone comfortable and feeling at home.    Laguna has some fantastic world class restaurants and several hidden gems. Our staff is here to understand what you are looking for and give you the best recommendations possible. It's great to hear they directed you to a spot that delivered what you were looking for.  We look forward to your return to the Laguna Riviera and thanks for taking the time to share your experiences with us.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary: Our 3rd visit. We come from noisy, dirty London so this place is Paradise. We like room 507, with its kitchenette and breath taking views. This was the first year we'd seen a pod of dolphins swimming and jumping. I got quite a tan from the sea wind as I read my book and drank white wine on the terrace. We ate at The Watermark - good but pricey. I watched The Oscars on TV, but got a little distracted as the noise of waves kept lulling me into a snooze. Thank you to all the team and see you in 2013.
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive review. You came at the right time of year to see both dolphins and whales. However the whales are more difficult to spot as they surface for just a short time then stay under for quite a while. The dolphins you can now see year round, with some patience and a sharp eye. The upper patio is a great vantage point for scanning the waters.  The vantage point from your deck in front of suite 507 is an even better location to spot from because of the elevation.  We are honored to be part of your vacation and happy to provide an experience to remember. And, while I can‚Äôt promise the waves will be any quieter, we look forward to your stay in 2013.   Happy travels,  Kort

Summary: This will be our 3 rd year staying at the beach house!   We love the owners and how easy they are to work with.  We bring 5 families and stay throughout the property, including the beach house.  Each family has their own favorite room they rent every year.   They room renovations are great!  The location is super and an easy walk to the grocery store or downtown.   Highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your history and experience staying at the Laguna Riviera with other travelers. Your feedback and comments about our renovations, staff and management is very welcome.   By this time next year (completion expected June 2012) you will have an incredible space at the beach house for your family get-a-way. The two ocean front terraced patios will be completed for outdoor entertaining or just lounging around, and the house will have its' own private access directly to the sand.  Reviews like this keep us motivated to keep raising the bar.  Thanks again & Happy Travels,  -Kort

Summary: My wife and I have stayed here at least four times beginning in 2006. We keep returning because it is an excellent value, and a very relaxing place to be. We love the quaintness! It works well for us. Have never had any trouble with staff. We usually use room 306 because we love the private balcony and the wonderful surf view.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great endorsement. Seeing guests return year after year is the highest compliment we can earn.  Room 306 is in a great part of the building with the large rooms and private decks overlooking the beach. This February has had great weather. Im glad you were able to enjoy it while staying at the Laguna Riviera.  We look forward to your next stay.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary: My In-Laws have been staying at the Riv for about 14 years now, wooed from another hotel farther up the PCH. My wife and I joined them in 2006 and loved it.   The first time we went it was a bit rustic. Clean and maintained, but a bit old fashioned (in a good way). The second time the rooms had a very nice remodel done to them; a bit trendy, but it worked. I especially liked the new showers.  The location is great, and the beach access very convenient. The staff is helpful and understanding, management fair and knowledgeable, not like the monsters you might read about in lesser reviews.  Choose your room to meet your needs; there are plenty to meet your needs and price.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience, it means a lot to us.  We are constantly looking for ways to further enhance our guests experience. For 2012 we have started our slope project and by next summer will have new pathways and terraces to the ocean, a two level surf view patio for room 101, and two ocean terrace patios and private direct  beach access for the bungalow.  When the bungalows patios are re-opened, it  will be an excellent venue for small weddings, family reuniouns, and parties.  Even, as is, with 3 bedrooms it is perfect for a single or multi family beach vacation. Please stop by the office during your next stay, if it's not occupied, it would be my pleasure to give you a tour.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary: My husband and I first stayed at the Laguna RIviera back in 1985. Very funky place at that time..but suited our needs. Over the past few years we have stayed 3 times, Rooms 406, 511 and 101. I would recommend all of them with maybe the exception of 406. The hotel recently remodeled and room 511 was beautifully done. Room 101 was very private and was also very nice. I will be staying again in February...this time I have chosen Room 203.  I am sure my stay will be just as nice. The beach is just steps away and it is a nice walk to the Main Beach shopping and restaurants. Also a plus is that the hotel does not charge parking. P.S Glad to hear the gal at the front desk is no longer there...she was a bit brusk!  While I would love to stay at the Surf and Sand...for my money...Laguna
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice review. It is great seeing the observations of a repeat guest who has watched as we continue to improve and upgrade the property.  I would suggest that for fun, you ask to see room 406 on your next stay. It used to be, in my opinion, our least desirable room. Because of that we put a great deal of effort into upgrading it, and while not large, it is now a very nice room with more space, a beautifully upgraded bathroom, and additional amenities. If it was allowed, I'd love to include pictures within this reply.  Room 203 which you have selected for your next stay is very nice and I look forward to hearing your comments. Room 101 that you mentioned will be down for a while as we add a new retaining wall and a terraced front patio that will offer one of the best surf views on the property.  While I agree that the Surf & Sand is very nice property. I enjoy dining at their excellent restaurant Splashes regularly. The Riviera sits on an arguably better beach, our rates are about 1/2 of what you will pay for a king room with a surf view, and we have no added fees for parking, internet, etc.  Thanks again for the review and please feel free to introduce yourself and say hello on your next visit.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary: This interesting property sits overlooking a beautiful sand beach and has tremendous ocean views.  A pleasant zigzag garden path leads right to the beach.  That's why you would stay here.  Our room inside (#508) was nothing special - a large room with  a foldout bed and sofabed;  noisy heater-air conditioner;  fireplace did not seem to work; fairly standard furniture although the sofa was very comfortable.  Good bath facilities and amenities.  But it has a private deck right over the ocean with a fantastic view and plastic lounge chairs.  Small garden areas on the slopes have flowers, grass and palm trees.  Outdoor hallway areas in the hotel have colorful painted murals, completing the impression of a true beach hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice review. The views and, of course, the town is what brings our guests to Laguna Beach and the Laguna Riviera year after year.   Your room, 508 is one of our most popular rooms for couples because of the privacy and it has, arguably, the best view on the property. The bed is a fold out, or more accurately a Murphy bed. It is like any other regular bed, except that it retracts into the wall to create more space during the day. It uses a regular queen mattress that is of the same quality as any top end hotel mattress.  This room is so popular that when we did our room upgrades it was rarely available to work on, so the upgrades were minimal. It is now scheduled for additional improvements before summer of 2012 is upon us that will bring it to the same high standard as our other newly renovated rooms. The fireplace is also scheduled for service as the electronic ignition system has been effected by the ocean air causing intermittent issues.   The Laguna Riviera was opened in 1948 and has hosted dignitaries, celebrities, and families from around the world for almost 65 years while still providing the relaxed, low key, unpretentious charm one expects from a family owned classic beach property in an eclectic town like Laguna Beach, and we are glad you chose to stay with us.  Thanks again for the review and we look forward to your next stay.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary: Well,, the pics looked great on the website and we booked room 409 where we are staying right now.  The "resort" looks like a glorified motel, renovated, but still distinctly motel ambiance.  Our room overlooked a a dirty roof, complete with a dirty rag, champagne cork, broken plastic fork and a general shabbiness that completely interfered with the legitimitely lovely view of the.  The "private deck" is nothing more than painted lattice that "separates" one balcony from the next, making us very vulnerable to the cell phone gabbing upper neighbor's conversation. We asked to see another room which had no private deck, and was so close to a communal deck that any noisy neighbor or late night revelers would have truly created a sleepless night. The carpeting between rooms on the
Manager Response: Thank you for the high points on our amazing location, and sorry the young man at the front desk did not live up to your expectations. We strive for a very high level of customer services and while we receive many compliments on his performance your experience will be discussed with him to make sure everyone receives the same high level of attention.  It is unfortunate that your view was disturbed by wind swept debris. Unfortunately we find it necessary to clean the lower roofs from time to time to clear the stray champagne cork, paper, leaves and other debris that can blow off of the upper decks and in from the surrounding area.  Like many hotels several of the private decks are separated by walls and latices. These are not designed to block the guest from all potential noise but rather to lend some privacy from view. Having just returned from a vacation in Hawaii staying at a 5 star hotel, I experienced the same issue with my neighbor. He was constantly on the cellphone and while annoying, I distracted myself with the ocean view and conversation with my wife. Since the rooms and decks share a common wall I understand complete isolation is not possible.  When staying at the Laguna Riviera, if your goal is to have a quiet room as far away from other guests, and the public areas, please let us know and we will accommodate as best we can with what is available. Rooms like 406 can be very quiet save for the sound of the crashing waves.  While I understand this guests concerns about the potential of noisy neighbors and what they could do and what might happen, it appears that none of it actually did happen, and they slept quite well.  We find that our guests are generally considerate of others, but should such a thing happen, and anyone is bothered by noisy guests please contact the office so the issue can be addressed. While certainly not a common occurrence, families on vacation can sometimes stay up later than usual visiting and sitting outdoors in the warm evening air. We understand this, and our staff is always available and happy to intervene asking guests to quiet down and be respectful of others.   Being right on the ocean the Laguna Riviera, like many of the other ocean front hotels in town is constantly maintaining and servicing the property to stay ahead of the harsh salt air and coastal winds. It is truly a full time job which is why we have several maintenance staff members who are dedicated to doing this on a daily basis year round.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary Heading: Beach cottage right above the water!
Summary: We stayed in the beach bungalow last June.  It was amazing.  For less than the price of two hotel rooms at other places, you had a full, three bedroom cottage, right on the water in the center of town - walking distance to everything.  Now, if you insist on marble and high end fixtures, you might be disappointed.  But this is just like a family beach home.  Everything you need is there.  Views are incredible, and you have a sense of privacy right in the center of town.  It is very comfortable.  The staff is great - Alex at the front desk was so helpful.  Our three tennagers loved it.  The only thing is, if you have a rentl car, get a small one, because getting into the private garage is a bit tight.  We would definitely choose the cottage on a return to Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience in, and opinion of our Beach Bungalow and your positive review of our staff. The Beach Bungalow is an amazing value and you could easily spend the same  amount or more at other hotels for a single ocean front room.  By summer of 2012, we plan on having the lower patios  completed and ready for use. Once done you will be able to relax outdoors and enjoy the sand, surf & sunsets from your own private lounge just feet from the crashing waves, or entertain under the stars with Catalina Island on the horizon while cooking from your private seaside BBQ.   Thanks again and we look forward to being your destination of choice when you return to Laguna Beach.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary Heading: A wonderful beach front vacation resort
Summary: Me and my family keep going back to this wonderful resort. It is right on a beach, rooms are remodeled and really comfortable and price for Laguna Beach surf view really isn't that bad.  Can't wait to go back next year!
Manager Response: Thank you for the fine review and sharing your experience with other travelers. We look forward to your visit next year.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary: We chose to stay here on our wedding night because the price was affordable for a room with a king size bed and jacuzzi in the room on the ocean. We stayed in room 301. The sleeping are was spacious and appeared as if it had been recently updated and tastefully decorated. The bathroom had not been updated. The toilet & bathtub were very old. We didn't even shower there because it looked so nasty. The front desk staff were friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice review and accurate comments regarding price and location, decor and staff. We strive to offer the best value on the ocean in Laguna Beach. I'm concerned about your review of the bath area in 301 and will have it inspected to see if improvements are in order. Having just come off a sold out summer we spend much of the off season putting everything back into top shape and preparing for the next summer.  Thanks again & Happy Travels.  Kort

Summary: Incredible views, nicely appointed room. I would highly recommend this place to anyone seeking a coastal yet quaint hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice positive review. 203 and all of our surf view rooms have amazing views that guests remember for years. The sunset behind Catalina Island is a favorite.  Happy travels  Kort

Summary Heading: Excellent value in a very expensive area
Summary: We stayed in this property for five nights in September.  Our stay was very pleasant as we had a beautiful ocean and coastal view room.  My partner and I also inspected several other similarly priced options as we decided to return for one night a week after our initial stay; our conclusion was that the Laguna Riviera offered the best value and location in its price range in what is a very expensive resort area.  I have chosen to give the property 4, rather than 5, stars for two reasons: 1. the employee who checked us in was less than welcoming..I personally sensed an indifferent and unfriendly attitude from her.  All other employees we later came in contact with were, however, very accommodating, 2. the decor was more funky than elegant...of course, this is simply a matter of
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your evaluation of the local market and our place in it. Your observation is quite accurate and Im sure those looking to travel to Laguna Beach will find it useful.  We go out of our way to offer a tremendous value for ocean front rooms in Laguna Beach.  It is unfortunate that your initial encounter with the front desk was less than perfect. The receptionist you had this encounter with, is no longer with us and those remaining are all dedicated to ensuring our guests experience the warmth and hospitality of Laguna Beach.  We strive to offer a true relaxed Laguna Beach experience and share the Southern California lifestyle with our guests. Our newly redesigned rooms were created with this in mind with the goal to be more zen than flash. We encourage our guests to relax, refresh and renew during their stay and designed the decor to encourage this state of mind. I encourage anyone comparing local hotels to visit our website to see the decor and everything else we offer  first hand.   Thanks again & Happy Travel,  Kort

Summary: What an amazing weekend!  5 shared the Laguna Rivera Beach Bungalow and it was wonderful.  The view from the front room and deck were amazing!  I loved going to sleep and waking up to the sound of the ocean.  I can't wait to do it again next year...or sooner!  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  It's in a great location to walk to all the local restaurants.  Thanks again for the great experience.  M.Morrow, Moorpark, CA
Manager Response: We are glad you chose the Laguna Riviera to be part of making your reunion special and look forward to your event next year. When you arrive you will see many new features available that will make your stay even more enjoyable.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary: A wonderful weekend in Laguna Beach!  The Bungalow at the Laguna Riviera was the perfect location for a girls get-together weekend.  We had plenty of space for the group and incredible views from both inside and outside the bungalow!  This would be a great choice for any group of friends or family, wonderful accommodations and an ideal location.  Being able to fall asleep  to the sounds of the waves was incredible!
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice review and we are happy you had a great get-together. When you return next year the lower patios just feet from the sand are scheduled to be open and available for your use.  Happy travels  Kort

Summary: We stayed at this hotel in late September and booked the best room, although the room was clean we found the decor rather dated and the kitchen was dated and smelly with a lack of cutlery, also the bathroom was very shabby. I could not recommend this hotel at the rates they charge.
Manager Response: I am sorry this guest did not find the accommodations to their taste, and felt the price was high, but am very pleased to hear that they rate our location and service highly.   Our best and yes most expensive room is $599 per night which is almost the same rate as a non-view studio at the Montage or a standard ocean view room with a king bed at the Surf & Sand, both great properties just south of us.   But, for that price, at the Laguna Riviera you get a classic 3 bedroom beach cottage on the ocean that is valued at over $4m. The kitchen has all of the modern amenities one needs and it is stocked with table service for 12. The larger bathroom is approximately 100 square feet, has a tub, shower, full facilities and a laundry area. The smaller one is a half bath in the master bedroom.  If one finds that they need more than the kitchen is equipped with, a call to the front desk will quickly remedy the problem. While this is a classic 1932 structure which may classify it as dated, it has modern amenities such as flat panel televisions, provides amazing views, has a private deck overlooking the ocean, and the furnishings are Tommy Bahama.   A check of the local rates at properties with ocean front locations offering comparable accommodations will quickly show that the Laguna Riviera offers a tremendous value. With rooms completely remolded in 2009 and more upgrades scheduled to complete before the Summer of 2012, then add on free parking, free internet, free beach equipment use, free continental breakfast, and no resort fee, the Laguna Riviera, we feel, offers our guests a tremendous value.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary: Stayed here 4 nights in mid October 2011. Staff friendly,helpful. Room 515 comfortable;enjoyed the ocean view;very relaxing listening to the sound of the waves. Laguna Rivera has a good location can walk to restaurants,shops, There is a Ralph's Supermarket close by. We enjoyed our stay and looking forward to coming back again  G.M. Allen,Tx
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive review. We find as you stated that the guests love the location. Unless you want to go out of town there is no need to move the car once parked. Fine dining, shopping and groceries are all within a short walk of the property.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary: Great location right on the water. Family owned for three generations. Clean and comfortable accommodations. What a great find, this will be our regular spot when we come to visit this area from now on.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the great review. We look forward to your next stay with us.  Happy Travels,  Kort
