Summary: My high school girlfriends (we graduated in 1978, Sonora HS), decided to have a weekend away...we picked the Laguna Riviera Beach Bungalow...WHAT A GREAT CHOICE!!!! We had an entire house on the beach.  BIG, CLEAN, ROOMY, & COMFY!!!!...it had everything as if we stayed at someones house with NO CLEAN UP for us!!! The hotel staff was excellent and answered all of our questions about where & what to do in Laguna Beach. We have decided this will be our yearly trip together...THANK YOU LAGUNA RIVIERA.
Manager Response: We are happy your reunion was a hit. It's hard to go wrong when you are feet from the shore enjoying a classic 1932 Laguna Beach cottage upgraded, of course, with all the necessary modern amenities. We look forward to your return next year and by then will have the two ocean front patios completed to further enhance your annual gathering.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary: This was our second time this year staying at the Laguna Riviera, and both times were great! Unfortunately, we only stayed for one night, but it was well spent in room 402. The view of the ocean was great, and there isn't anything like waking up to the sounds of the waves and looking out the window to see surfers. The room was decorated beautifully, and most importantly very clean; the only thing, which others have stated, is that the shower has no light, but it really was not an issue. The easy walk down to the beach is also a big plus! We took advantage of the grill, which I highly recommend, and enjoyed our meal while watching the sunset; the front desk kindly provided us with plates and silverware, since our room did not have a kitchen. The service is great, and there was no
Manager Response: Thank you for the fine positive review. You hit on one of my favorite activities here and that is using the ocean front grills to cook up a fresh meal then dine on the front terrace as the sun sets.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary: What a unique property, We stayed in room 516, a corner room with a great view of the ocean and the mountains.  Swam in my first enclosed salt water pool (with retractable roof), right along the Pacific Coast Hiway!. what a fun expeirence ,so much more refreshing  than a clorine pool.  Very convienient to shopping and restaurants.left the car parked and walked the town exploring the various shops and great places to eat.  We would start  our day with the nice complimetary continental breakfast and finish the day with a  glass of wine watching the sunset off Catalina Island.  Can't wait to go back and enjoy this resort again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice review. It is always a joy to hear from satisfied guests who appreciate the location and uniqueness of the Laguna Riviera. We are always looking for ways to improve our guests experience and the salt water pool & jacuzzi, you mentioned, are just one of the many recent improvements.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary Heading: Great location, nice rooms friendly staff. Stayed in 506
Summary: Great location. Updated decor. Beautiful views. Safe in room, nice kitchen, nice bath, shower has no light, too dark to see...carpets need cleaning beds and pillows marginal. Overall a nice stay, air conditioning needed. Parking difficult. Will go back, good value. Great staff!
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice compliments regarding our decor, staff and of course location. We are constantly looking for areas to improve the property and our guests experience. To that end, improving the lighting in the shower has been addressed and is scheduled to be installed next week.   Beds are replaced on a regular schedule and we are now installing high end memory mattresses that we have had nothing but compliments about. Only some rooms have built in A/C as we fully disclose on the website and A/C is rarely needed because of the local climate and ocean breezes. With that said we have portable units and happily deliver and activate them upon request.   Thank you for the feedback and positive comments. We appreciate your patronage and look forward to your next stay.  Happy travels,  Kort

Summary Heading: Don't come here for peace and quiet...
Summary: I so wanted to love this place.  I booked their best room, #101, over six months ago for my husband's birthday.  Front desk service from Ana was very cordial.  Yes, parking was tight but we lucked out on a good safe space by the office.  Yes, we had to lug all of our luggage down stairs and a steep path to the room.  Found the room air conditioned and clean.  Lovely deck, but everyone can see you and everyone needs to walk past to get to the beach.  Settle in to a comfy chair to relax in the room, close my eyes and .... what's that??  Sounds like a herd of elephants upstairs.  Back and forth, stomp stomp stomp.  Non stop.  There's two room above ours and ZERO noise insulation between our ceiling and their floors and decks.  Thankfully they were older and went to bed early, but
Manager Response: It is unfortunate that noisy neighbors colored this guests entire stay. While we cannot predict the occasional noisy family with kids that are having too much fun, when notified, we intervene and ask them to quiet down and respect our other guests. It is unfortunate that this guest had to endure the noise rather than contact the office.   During our recent remodel, cork was placed between all floors to help deaden the sound, but in the end, this is an ordinal wooden building that does not have the isolation of modern concrete towers. The Laguna Riviera is a classic ocean front property.  I must take exception to several of this guests opinions as I believe they have been unduly influenced and exagerated by their experience with the noisy guests.   1) The pool area is a salt water system for both the jacuzzi and pool. The most common compliment we receive since the conversion is how great the water feels on the skin and how fresh the area smells. No more chlorine fumes.  2) Not only do we not have a broken down pool table, we don't have a pool table at all.  3) Towels are replaced yearly and a single stain or hole takes them out of service. After this review I toured the room and the laundry to confirm we are not issuing frayed towels with the ability to scratch. 4) This room should have come with 2 bathrobes and if housekeeping missed one, a call to the desk would have had a second one delivered in minutes. The bathrobes also are replaced as needed and are of the highest quality made of high thread count Egyptian cotton. I still use mine daily from our first order in 2003 and it still feels like new. You can purchase the same brand and style in major department stores for $75-$95 each.  Our guest enjoy them so much that we have a Christmas rush on the ones we retail for only $65.oo ea. 5) We do not as a rule provide DVD players, but do have a couple on hand that we lend out for free. If maintenance is available they can install it, but off hours it is up to the guest to understand how to plug in and operate the complimentary DVD player.  6) There may be a small rust spot or two on the refrigerator, but it is not all rusty. Since it sits by a often open  double wide sliding door a few yards from the ocean the interaction with the salt air is unavoidable. The fridge is cleaned thoroughly after each guest checks out and operates perfectly.  While it is very unfortunate that this guest had their stay interrupted by the noisy group on the deck above theirs, I wish they had taken the time to let the office know so that we could remedy the situation before it colored their entire stay. We are more than happy to intervene in order to help everyone enjoy their vacations.  Happy travel,  Kort

Summary: Let me start by saying that I had an idea that this would be an older, cutesy  bed and bfast kinda place to stay and it is... Sort of. Now for the problem, After staying here, I don't think I really like it as much as I thought I would! Let me explain, service at check in was poor. We Arrived after a very long drive late at night, tired but happy to be here. There was no one avail at the check in.... Sign said back in 15 minutes.... Ugh! Fortunately they arrived after a few minutes and we checked in. We asked about parking since we were arriving late and everything looked  full. We were told to "try" around the side that there "should" be parking. Not very comforting but ok. We asked where our room was and she waved her hand across the parking area and muttered something about
Manager Response: It is unfortunate that this guest had a poor experience with our night manager. They arrived while the night manager was experiencing very severe health issues for which she is now hospitalized. Under normal circumstances the night manager is more than happy and capable to assist our guests locate a room or find a parking spot. Im not certain which room this guest stayed in, but the check in area is on the 4th level so their room was up one level.  While, like this guest, all of our guests are perfectly capable of pouring coffee and collecting the complementary continental breakfast in the morning, the Health Code requires that a staff member hand the food out, and that it is aseptically wrapped. The woman who staffs the breakfast is very friendly and processes all requests as quickly as possible.    We are looking into upgrading our kitchen and food license to offer a full service breakfast and may have it implemented by Summer 2012. But, for now, we offer a  free continental breakfast to get started, and for those looking for something more substantial, there are several restaurants to choose from.  The Laguna Riviera is a unique boutique hotel with 41 different rooms averaging over 415 square feet. The rooms underwent a major remodel in 2009 and we have many happy guests return repeatedly. All of the views and rooms are clearly described on our website and recent pictures are available for many of them. The reservations staff is available to answer all questions and clearly explain every rooms location, view and amenities.   We hope this guest choses to stay with us again and can assure them that checking in and finding their room will be far less complicated.  Happy Travels,  Kort

Summary: We had originally planned to stay 3 nites but ended up staying only for one due to the smell in our room.  To their credit, they moved us to another roon, albeit much smaller, but it was already late evening and they did not seemed interested in refunding us so we stayed for one nite.  We did love the sound of the waves and the views of the ocean.  And we were able to go to the Sawdust Arts Festival, which we really enjoyed.
Manager Response: Thank you for the compliment regarding the properties location.   I have discussed this review with the staff and have, thus far, found nobody who recalls a request for a refund instead of a move to another room so I am at a loss to give a complete response. If this reviewer would be so kind as to contact me I will be more than happy to investigate further.   Being on the ocean there are occasions when we have extreme low tides that can raise a more significant presence of the scent of the kelp, salt water and coastal area. Rooms closest to the ocean are sometime affected by this and, while it bothers some guests, others are happy with this "coastal experience" .   Being summer, I am glad we had a room to move to as we are generally sold out. If a guest checks in and does not like a room our policy is to refund the deposit as long as the room has not been used to the point that housekeeping would need to service it.  I look forward to this guests next stay with us and encourage you to contact me if you have any questions or wish to discuss this stay further.  Happy Travels,  Kort

Summary: We stayed here for four days in August, two adults and two kids in room 516. If anything, the room was undersold with views of sea, crashing waves and mountains. The room was well equipped and the hotel fun and quirky. The service was exemplary, the room was clean and we loved Laguna. This was our first trip to California and we stayed in 9 hotels in our three weeks of adventure around the county. This was the best of all and we want to come back.
Manager Response: Thank you for the fine review. It is such a pleasure to hear from satisfied guests and know we are delivering on our goals of providing an experience to remember. We will share this with the staff.  Thanks again & Happy travels,  Kort Pearson

Summary Heading: Very NICE - wish we could have stayed longer
Summary: After been driving a lot each day, we really enjoyed that we could park the car and then walk everywhere we wanted to go. Beach is just next door, restaurants 5-10 minutes walk away, supermarket nearly just across the street. We enjoyed this place a lot, it was nearly like being home. It was possible to make a bbq in the evening with oceanview. It was a very quiet place the only noice we had was from the street when we opened the window, but I'm sure if you get a room with view towards the sea you only hear the ocean.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review.  I know when traveling from another country you are never sure what to expect. I am glad that the Laguna Riviera helped make your trip to the US from Denmark an enjoyable and memorable one.  Mange tak and happy travels,  Kort

Summary: This place is in a great location, and provides everything you need for a day at the beach - beach towels, chairs, etc. It was after we returned from the beeach and needed some extra bath towels that the service went down hill. It took quite a bit of effort on my part to get more towels. Other than that - the stay was nice, rooms were clean and kitchenette was stocked.
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive review about our location, and complimentary  beach towels, umbrellas and chairs. We also proudly provide complimentary parking, wireless high-speed internet, and continental breakfast each morning.    Thank you for complimenting our clean and well stocked rooms. You sound like you had an enjoyable time staying with us durring your July vacation which is also the busiest month of Summer break.   It is unfortunate that our temporary shortfall to provide extra towels in a timely fashion had such a significant impact on your experience. We strive to over deliver and make sure every guests needs are met in a timely fashion.  Even though we purchase additional inventory in anticipation of the seasons demands, during heavy beach and pool use we can, on occasion, have a small lag between towels being turned in, and having them washed, dried, folded and put back into service. This is further compounded when towels are left at the beach or when new ones are requested and the old ones are not returned.   We are glad you enjoyed yourself, enjoyed the fantastic views and location and had a great nights sleep. When you next visit, please feel free to contact me in advance and I'll make sure the crew stocks your room with a set of extra towels so you do not run out.   While we regret we may have come up a towel short for this guest, rest assured that it is our goal to make sure all our guests have a great vacation experience while staying and vacationing at the Laguna Riviera.

Summary Heading: Great Location, Friendly Service , Relaxing & Fantastic Views
Summary: We recently visited Laguna Beach for the 4th or 5th time in the last ten years and  on the advise of a friend chose the Riviera for this trip. They have won us over. We will be staying with the Riviera each time we visit Laguna. The staff was fun and friendly and the location and property were exactly what we look for, a combination of local flavor and guilty comforts.  The Riviera is what can be referred to as a hidden gem. From the street it looks classic and as I understand it, it was built in the late 40's. This older building covered with colorful murals (that we watched being touched up by the artist who creates and maintains them)  these murals make it a rather fancifulness place but lend to the rich artistic ambiance that we enjoy and look for on our regular treks to
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the fine review and taking the time to share your experience. I will  print a copy for the staff. We all appreciate the positive feedback.  Thanks again.

Summary: rooms are very clean kitchenette was nicely stocked we had room 410 great balacony with ocean view. only problem the map on the website said 2 twin beds and I confirmed it a week before but when we got there it was one queen bed. They said it was just remodeled. pullout was not great. recommend bringing food to BBQ they have a great area with tables overlooking the ocean with two grills(you just need to reserve a time slot which was great) you should plan a sunset dinner the sunsets were spectacular!!!! lovely walk down a winding path with wonderful flowers to the beach. beach is small but nice. located in a great little town. don't miss the art galleries.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review. The amazing views even keep those that live here in awe each evening enjoying the brilliant sunsets.  The view is further enhanced by dining on your private deck or in the front courtyard after grilling up a fresh meal on the surf view BBQs. I'm glad you had an opportunity to enjoy one of the most popular Summer activities that guests look forward to year after year.  Thanks again & Happy Travels,

Summary: Not fancy, but clean and functional suite with great access to the beach.  Our rooms had an ocean view but no private deck, but the decks for general use were almost always empty and had excellent views over the Pacific.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and your accuracy. The Laguna Riviera strives to be a comfortable, clean, family destination with the best ocean front rates in town.  The recent room renovations were designed to be tranquil like the ocean and beach without the extravagance one might find in a 5 Star resort. The goal was zen on the beach with great views, comfort and no pretense.  Thanks again & Happy Travels,

Summary: I had been planning my family's vacation for a while, and had been hunting for the perfect beach front hotel. I finally found the Laguna Riviera, and I'm glad I did! The hotel definitely lives up to its good reviews! And for the location and quality, the prices were not bad at all. From the moment we arrived the staff was so helpful & friendly. Parking was never an issue either, since they had multiple places around the hotel to park. We stayed in room 517, which looks as good in person as in the video on the website! It was a "partial" ocean view room, which had me expecting a slight glimpse of the water, but to my surprise we had an amazing view of the ocean! Since we had a little kitchen, we got groceries at Ralph's, which was in walking distance. The steps to the hotel lead
Manager Response: Thank you for for writing about your experience while staying with us at the Laguna Riviera. I will share your review with the staff to let them know their diligence is so appreciated.  Thanks again and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This a cute renovated motel in a fabulous location in Laguna Beach.  It would be a great value fir the money, if poor service didn't mar the experience.  When we first arrived, we had a cute little room.  Then, it rained--and a leaky window leaked on the bed.  No problem, we were upgraded to a lovely room with balcony.  But two days later, they moved us into one of the upstairs rooms.  The walls were so thin, it made sleeping impossible.  But the kicker was when we got up at 5 am for our flight, only to find a huge truck had parked us and five other guests in.  The sign on the windshield said to contact the office if you needed the truck moved---but the office was closed and nobody answered the phone.  Finally we located the manager, asleep in a guest room upstairs.  She took 15
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive review regarding the property and location.  I am very disappointed by the experience you had with our night manager. It is a issue that is in the process of being dealt with and I again apologize profusely. We strive to make everyones stay memorable and for all the right reasons, not because somebody parked in the wrong place.  Your call to the night manager should have been answered and you should have been on your way in short order.  Please feel free to contact me personally if you incurred any losses because of this inconvenience.

Summary: We come here every year...off season...for a wonderful, uncrowded and relaxing getaway. We always try to get Room 201. Its all by itself, no one above or below. It hangs out on the last cliff before the sand. A wall of floor to ceiling  windows looks out over the sand and surf below and across the water to Catalina Island. The windows can be opened and the sound of the surf soothes your cares away. We were pleasently suprised this year as the room had been remodled. The mattress was heaven and the new flat screen TV and modern vanity was nice. There is a little private patio area with a table, umbrella and chaise lounge chairs so you can sit with your coffee or pizza (Gina's delivers and is fantastic) and watch the surfers or the dolphins or the amazing sunsets. The property has
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review.  201 is truly a special room with the most incredible views, north, south and off shore to Catalina Island. It has the ability to make guests feel like they are on their own in a cliff top cottage overlooking the ocean.  Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again next year.  Happy travels.

Summary: Let me say this resort was just what I wanted-location on the beach-awesome ocean(surf) view-able to listen to the ocean waves all night long-Room was the perfect size-Price was best I could find in Laguna--Literally fit my vision of a Laguna Beach bungalow type room as I did not want the cookie type found at the chain hotels-Room was clean and furnished perfectly--I prefer pillowtop beds but this one was adequate-Pool and hot tub was nice-LOVED IT LOVED IT LOVED IT--will definetly return
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with Tripadvisor.  Our goal is to provide a true Laguna Beach experience as you stay in the only family owned and operated property in town that has never changed hands or been sold to a big corporation.  I am so pleased that we met or exceeded your expectations.   Being a 4th generation Laguna Beach family we are always happy when others are able to share the spirit and beauty that is Laguna. Reviews like this keep us motivated to continue to discover more ways to  improve.  You stated it perfectly, there are no cookie cutter rooms here. All the rooms are different. Some actually do have pillow top beds, others have memory foam, and there are few more variations.   We look forward to your return and truly appreciate your kind words.  Happy Travels

Summary: Our second stay at The Laguna Rivera. We come from London just to stay here. Last year we had Room 101, this year Room 506. 506 has the most beautiful view, recently redecorated with a new bathroom. We squealed with delight. Our 3 night stay was marred on the first night by a group of rowdy men in the next room. We asked them twice to tone it down but they shouted and argued until 3.30am. We complianed to reception the next morning and the group was asked to leave immediately. I think this is my favourite place in the world.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the warm review of the Laguna Riviera. Great reviews like this make us want to keep finding more ways to make our guests vacations even more memorable.   Im sorry you were disturbed by the guests next door, and glad you brought it to our attention. We try to remedy such disturbances as fast as possible. Im alway disappointed when a guest endures such an intrusion rather than let us know.   We will share your review with the staff and look forward to your next visit.

Summary: I've stayed at the Laguna Riviera on several occasions, usually with family or alone on business. The location couldn't be better: it's right on the beach near downtown Laguna, and most rooms have views of the ocean. (And Laguna Beach itself is well situated between Disneyland and Legoland, our primary family destinations.)  The building is one-of-a-kind, and looks a bit like an old-time cruise ship set into the bluff. My kids love the easy access to the beach, and depending on which room we get I can often see them from our deck. The facilities sometimes suffer from exposure to the salt air, but in my experience that's true of any of the local beach hotels. The owners have raised rates a bit in the last few years, but it remains a terrific value. Highly recommended.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience and opinions about the Laguna Riviera. We share all reviews with the staff, and accurate reviews like this one keep them motivated and looking for more ways to increase guest satisfaction.  The Laguna Riviera is indeed a well situated beach front hotel from which to take exciting family excursions to the North or South to experience many world famous attractions. You can be at Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm, Legoland or the Zoo all in less than an hour, or stay in Laguna to enjoy the beaches, many tide pools, shops, galleries, and restaurants. Whatever you are looking for in your vacation to Laguna Beach, we are here to help. The front desk is staffed by family and locals who grew up in Laguna Beach. We are all here to help, offer the best suggestions and do all we can to make your vacation a wonderful and memorable experience.  Thank you again for taking the time to share your experience while staying at the Laguna Riviera.

Summary: Headed to Laguna Beach on a whim, the first weekend of December.  We did not have reservations anywhere, so stopped in at a couple of different places to check availability.  Most were quite expensive until we tried Laguna Riviera.  Very reasonable, especially since we were staying only 1 night.   Nice room.  We liked the kitchenette and the the remodeled bathroom was wonderfully clean.  But the nicest surprise was the fact that the room was just above the beach.  We could hear the sound of the waves breaking all night long.  We spent a VERY romantic night here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am very glad that  the Laguna Riviera met your needs and you enjoyed the sound of the crashing waves.   We have several guests who spent their honeymoon at the Laguna Riviera and for the same reasons you have shared here they have made a tradition of returning each year to celebrate their anniversaries.  We do provide the best ocean front prices in town and the rooms underwent a major remodel recently making the Laguna Riviera and exceptional beach front value.  Thanks again,

Summary: When I made a reservation in Aug of 2010 for Jan 2011 (MLK weekend), I was told that Room #401 would be closed due to remodeling.  I asked if the remodeling were completed before that date, I would like to be placed on the waiting list. The receptionist said that they could do it.  I reserved suite #306 in the meantime.  When I arrived at the hotel that weekend, I found that Room #401 was rented out.  What happened to my being placed on the waiting list?  I have been a loyal customer for over 10 years (always the same weekend).  I was truly disappointed.
Manager Response: I am very sorry that after so many years of visiting and enjoying the Laguna Riviera that this valued guest has given us a 2 and has indicated that they would not recommend a property they have enjoyed for at least a decade. Unfortunately, their review has been posted without having all of the facts, or a clear understanding of the status of room 401 during their stay with us.   The facts are that room 401  was being worked on and was not occupied when this guest checked in. It was only used for one day out of the 3 day holiday, when the painters were not available, with the understanding that painting was not complete.  The room this guest chose while booking, and stayed in, room 306 has a private deck and a great surf view.  It is a very popular room and in high demand.    Had  room 401 been completed early and available for occupancy over the 3 day weekend, they would have received it, but it was not. The reality is that they were advised that it was closed for maintenance, they accepted another room, they were put on the wait-list in the event the room opened, and when this guest arrived at the hotel room 401 was in the middle of being painted.   I am sorry that this valued guest chose to post a negative review based on a misunderstanding of the facts and would have appreciated the opportunity to address these concerns before such a review was posted so they understood that their request was not ignored.  We provide a great ocean front value, do not ding guests for parking and other amenities, strive to meet and exceed expectations, and do all we can to make your stay enjoyable and memorable. when staying at the Laguna Riviera if you have any issues we are here to help. our many positive reviews and wonderful guests who stay year after year tell the real story.  Happy Travels

Summary: The hotel was really cute and great value for the location.  The lady who works nights was very nice allowing us to park in two spaces with our large SUV when a guy took up too much room with his mega truck.  The only downside was how thin the walls were.  On our last night we were subject to a four second love making session from the people downstairs that left us feeling more sorry for the girl than us.  The hotel is over 60 years old so thin walls are expected in a place like this.  The value is great for the great location.  All in all there is a good chance we'll stay here again but probably bring earmuffs.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words and nice review. We listen to all comments and adopt ideas when they make sense. Even though we recently implemented several enhancements to isolate rooms from outside and adjacent sounds, in some areas, it can be a challenge.   We will be stocking the front desk with complementary ear plugs for anyone who wishes to have a pair. As for the couple downstairs they will have to seek out their own solution as I found nothing beneficial as I perused the innkeepers manual for dealing with extraordinary events.   I am just glad that the fleeting disturbance did not exceed the average TV commercial break and interfere with your good nights sleep.  Happy travels

Summary: Good hotel... Nice hot pool and nice deck... Excelent location, but not very clean rooms!
Manager Response: Thank you for the compliments about the nice hot salt water pool and our great location. I am surprised that you did not find your room perfectly clean and would like to know which room and when you stayed.   Our house keeping staff is dedicated to providing exceptionally clean rooms and their performance is constantly monitored. Please call me at the property or email me directly so that I can better understand your experience and be able to properly follow up with the staff member responsible for your room.

Summary Heading: Restful ocean side gem of Laguna
Summary: Laguna Riviera continues to be the perfect place to enjoy R&R and escape from cold Seattle. I returned December 26 - January 1 to share a very comfortable suite with my parents. Room 401 gave us ample room with lovely kitchen (with table seating 4), bathroom, private bedroom for my folks and pull out couch for me. We enjoyed the option to eat in the room or on the massive deck overlooking the beach. The location gave us the best of all worlds, room side deck for watching surfers, pelicans and dolphins for my parents and beach access for me to walk every morning and afternoon. Our ritual was to regroup for a gorgeous sunset each evening. This time of year Catalina island is silhouetted brilliantly at sunset.  This room and several others are ideal for those with limited mobility.
Manager Response: Thank you for this nice and well written review. We always enjoy hearing from our many satisfied guests as they share their experience with other travelers.  We strive to constantly improve, listen to all comments,  and deliver a great vacation experience for all who choose to stay with us.  Everyone at the Laguna Riviera takes pride in their job. I share all reviews with the staff and this one will put a smile on their faces.  Thank you and happy travels

Summary Heading: Pay for the location...give up sleep
Summary: The good: It is on the beach with beach access; walkable to downtown area The bad: So called ‚Äúfree‚Äù internet access was about 15 minutes in the evening (I could not get back on). When I phoned the front desk the comment was that the computer in the office was working, so it had to be my computer!  I was given a room on the first floor with 2 sides facing the parking lot. I endured hard footsteps over my head past midnight due to the room above and the walkway right over my room, a car blaring a radio for over 20 minutes just outside my window past midnight, and awakened by footsteps on the walkway above my head and Spanish workers yelling to each other in the parking lot (for over 5 minutes).   The blanket had multiple holes. Nothing from the ‚ÄúFree‚Äù breakfast due to begin at
Manager Response: I am sorry that this guest had a less than perfect stay. I have reviewed the registration records and she stayed one night on New Years Eve which can be loud just about anywhere. I apologize if the guests above were a little too enthusiastic. We do have 24 hour guest services and one call to us would have put those ringing in the New Year on notice that they need to settle down.  We take guest satisfaction very seriously and would have done what was needed to make this guest comfortable even if it meant upgrading her to a superior room. The room she occupied, while it can still see the ocean, is our second to least expensive. The rate this guest paid was only $124.20 for New Years Eve on the ocean in Laguna Beach.   I will be personally inspecting this room when the current guest checks out. We use comforters on most beds and if blankets or any linens are found with even a single hole they are donated to a local charity that helps the homeless and less fortunate.   While we did have internet outages during the record setting storms just after Christmas, a check of the logs shows that it was online and operating fine over New Years. We do have several neighbors and a local service that operate secure WiFi connections and if you do not select the complimentary service that we provide, and configure your computer properly, you will not get a good connection.   During New Years we show peak usage at 2.4 MB/sec which leaves a lot of room for more users and confirms the complementary system was operational. I apologize that this guest had difficulty connecting to it. We do try to help with guests computer configuration issues when there is a knowledgable staff member available, however it is not part of our official services offering and not all staff member are comfortable working on guests personal computers.  Contrary to the insinuation, while the complementary pastries are aseptically sealed and packaged in compliance with the local health code requirements they are not the sort mass produced and found at 7-11. They are delivered fresh every couple of days directly from the bakery. The complimentary continental breakfast is free for those looking for a quick snack. It consists of coffee, teas, a variety of juices, rolls, muffins, hot/cold cereals, and fruit both fresh and pre-packed. For those looking for something more substantial a single phone call will have it delivered to your door within 15 minutes or a 30 second walk North or South will have you reading a menu with a large variety of choices.  The Laguna Riviera provides a great value, location and exceptional pricing for one of the best beach front locations in town. We do not charge extra for parking, internet, morning snacks, or beach chairs and umbrellas. We strive to make all of our guests feel comfortable and at home. Regrettably we failed with this solo traveller during her New Years Eve stay, but I believe that had there been some communication of needs, we would have over delivered. The many reviews from highly satisfied travelers speak for themselves and are truly indicative of the experiences of the vast majority of both our new and our long time repeat guests.

Summary: We stayed in room 306 for a week in December of 2010. For an extended stay, the maid service was very important to us and we were not disappointed. The room and hotel grounds were well kept and very clean. The room was spacious and well furnished with a beautiful view. Every room is different, so be sure to compare them on the hotel's web site. After seeing the sterile environment of the resorts down the beach, we were glad to have chosen a hotel with its own unique character.  The only negative is the so-so continental breakfast which is not served until 8:30 a.m. Normally too late for us. However, I was forewarned of this by the other reviews and wasn't concerned because the location is within walking distance to several restaurants and shops and there is a supermarket with
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful and accurate review. The Riviera is the only hotel left in Laguna Beach that has never changed hands or been sold to a big corporation. We pride ourselves on delivering the true Laguna Experience and part of that is providing a variety of room formats each comfortably appointed and unique.  We have recently partnered with GoKos Cafe down the street to provide daytime room service. Their expansive breakfast & lunch menu is now available in every room. Dial the extension to have healthy tasty food delivered promptly to your room.  We are also in the planning stages of reworking our lobby so we will be able to provide a much more significant breakfast ourselves.    We look forward to your next visit.  Thanks again and happy travels

Summary: The hotel doesn't look like much from the street and we never had a chance to check out the pool or amenities but we loved the 3 bedroom beach bungalow.  I had a business trip to Anaheim and my grown kids suggested a holiday trip for Christmas.  We love Laguna Beach but could not afford the high prices of Surf and Sand or some of the other high end resorts.  I found the 3 bedroom beach bungalow on familyvacations.com and felt it was perfect for our needs.  I was right.  The room, the ocean, the waves and the location were great.  The weather wasn't good the first two days with fog until 3:00 every day and then the sunsets at 4:40.  The sunsets were amazing and we walked downtown Laguna Beach daily for lunch and dinner.  Great time and a great bungalow!
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review of our 3 bedroom beach bungalow on the beach.  It's wonderful you were able to share a memorable time with your family and our authentic 1932 home helped make it special.   This time of year the the sunsets are truly amazing and, just like you and your family, even the locals take time to soak them up. They are always different and never get old.  Thanks again and happy travels

Summary: My sixteenth birthday at the Laguna Riviera in their Beach Bungalow was better than I could have imagined. I walked into the beautiful house with the giant window overlooking the beach.  I was so happy. My friends and I couldn't wait to go down to the water, so we walked down a few steps and there we were!  After swimming and relaxing in the sun we walked back up a couple steps and we were back at the beach house. The master bedroom overlooked the beach and had a fireplace. It's in walking distance of many restaurants so we walked to dinner then came back and went in the jacuzzi and sauna. In the morning when we woke up and sat on the balcony and watched the surfers. It was so awesome. Although we only stayed for one night, it was a night I will not forget. The staff was nice
Manager Response: Thank you for the happy and positive review of our 3 bedroom beach bungalow and your time in Laguna.  It's a great place to celebrate a milestone event like your sweet 16 birthday party.  I'm glad the Laguna Riviera could be part of it and helped make a memorable experience for you and your friends.   BTW Happy Birthday!!!!!!!   ;-)  Thanks again and happy travels

Summary: I spent three nights at the Laguna Riviera, and will definitely be back. It's a delightful example of California quirky, with mural covered outdoor corridors and beach wall. The hotel was right on the beach (accessed down a switchback ramp), and there is free off-street parking.  I had room 516 at the top, and had a wonderful view out to Catalina Island and up the coast. The only downside is that the view also included a balcony and rooftop below, but it wasn't a major issue for me. The room itself was a charming studio apartment with comfortable, stylish furniture and windows that actually opened. The small galley kitchen was nicely stocked with dinnerware necessities.  The location was within easy walking distance of the charming shopping area with many shops, galleries, and
Manager Response: Taco Loco blackened shrimp quesadillas are awesome. Good call. Now I know where I'm having lunch tomorrow. That place is excellent and a classic Laguna fixture much like the Laguna Riviera.  Thank you for the  positive review and comments. It's reviews like this that keep us motivated to provide the best Laguna Beach experience possible and continue to seek out ways to improve.  We look forward to your next visit.  Thanks again and happy travels

Summary: This hotel although rustic it had nice charm and very hospitable staff. The young man that ran the show while we were there was excellent. Very helpfull and friendly.  The hotel does show age but many others in the area did as well. There was upgrades done to the bathroom and a newer pull out couch in the living room but this is all we saw for updgrades. The hotel will lend you out complimentary tommy bahamma beach chairs and umbrellas along with toys for the kids. The view from our balcony was gorgeous and especially sunsets. It was nice you came out of your sliding doors where up a step there was patio chairs and tables in front of each room where you could meet and chat with other guests when they were out. Breakfast was more then adequate for a continental. The hotel parking

I spend a few days in Laguna Beach every month. I have tried several hotels, mostly on the beach side.  You cannot beat the Laguna Riviera for location, service, value and cleanliness. Also one of the few offering free parking, a $10-$15 nightly savings.

Our stay was for one night Saturday, 10/2/10. We had room # 308 and although told the room didn't have a view, we were delighted to be able to see the ocean from our window. The room was boardering a side street but the noise was minimal. We were also located across from the Maids laundry room but no issues/loud noises.There is a room with a deck above us and some noise was heard early Sunday but tolerable. We were there with other family members( two other rooms) and their rooms had fantastic ocean views. Most of the rooms there seem to be unique in there own ways and many with their own decks and ocean views.. The hotel was built over 50 yrs ago but has character to it. The ocean view decks are plentiful and the lawn with the BBQ is fantastic for a family get together. The

This is indeed the "Hotel from Hell"... Great location, but held together with hundreds of layers of old paint, not enough parking, rude staff, and belligerent cleaning people... BUT that's not the worst of it. The managers are so negligent and forgetful they cannot remember how long you book your stay for and do not communicate with their employees; and those employees are rude and have NO idea of how to behave in the hospitality business. The owner did not advise them of our third night so on a sunday morning the front desk called the NEWPORT BEACH POLICE DEPT  who banged on the door when I was in the shower. Upon review the police left appolgizing and the other manager apologized for their employees behavior. Too long a story to tell but STAY AWAY from this place. The maids
Manager Response: This is a most unfortunate review that must be addressed.   This guest booked a 2 night stay. When he checked in he signed a form indicating a 2 night stay. He may have felt he booked for 3 but it is simply not the case. The day which would have been the 3rd night had he booked it was already booked long before he made this reservation so a 3 night stay was not even possible.  Our check out time is noon. We called the room at 1:00 to see if it was vacant. The guest being woken up, verbally assaulted the front desk staff saying he was in for 3 days and is not going anywhere. The desk then explained to the guest that we have another guest checking into the room and we need it vacated. If he wanted to stay a 3rd night we would see if another room is available.  At this point the guest threatened physical harm to our staff if we were to push the issue. This guest went so far as to say he was friends with President Obama and would use this powerful connection to "Destroy the life" of the young man working at the front desk.  He again reiterated his position that he was not leaving and again threatened physical harm to our staff and hung up.  At this point to ensure the safety of our staff and guests the police were called in. They accompanied our clerk to the room. The clerk knocked on the door and as it opened the guest was in the process of lunging at our staff member until he realize that he was flanked by 2 police officers.  If this guest is truly in the hospitality business I should expect that he understands what the registration form means when he signs for a 2 day stay. He can consider himself lucky that the desk clerk did not press charges. In California if one feels physically threatened by the actions of another it is cause for arrest.  The Laguna Riviera is a family friendly beach resort and we do not tolerate violence in any form. If in the future anyone again threatens physical harm to any of our staff or guests we will again call the authorities and, as in this case, have it dealt with promptly.

Summary: I stay at laguna riviera a lot and its really a great experience- especially if you have one of the ocean view rooms. the real benefit is the lawn area with BBQ overlooking the ocean where you can bbq for lunch or dinner. the hotel is situated on in my opinion one of the best views in laguna beach which has many. they just updated the rooms so they are all modern and most have some sort of kitchen. to me it compares favorably to the pacific edge and i highly recommend staying there. the parking can be kind of annoying if its crowded but im being picky on that....the staff are all really nice young kids from the area and its family owned.

Summary Heading: Enchanting California beachside terrace resort parallels European Mediterranean Riviera experience
Summary: Improving on perfection, that's what this family run resort continues to do in caring for new and returning visitors alike. The ocean view is exceptional! Don't have a ocean room balcony, no worries. Plenty of lounging area on the communal terrace patios, very popular gathering place at sunset. There is easy access to the beach on a gentle pathway that winds through garden terraces and past colorful murals decorating the exterior room walls throughout the resort. The rooms are newly refurbished in luxuriously soothing color pallets and fine fabric textures. Great care was taken in creating a cohesive look and feel to all the resort rooms, while integrating unique artistic pieces and architectural embellishments to give returning visitors a variety. We've never stayed in the same

This place has some rave reviews on Trip advisor but I must admit to being a wee bit disappointed. The location is undoubtedly fantastic but read the room descriptions carefully. We unfortunately had to move from room 305 to 408 as the first wasn't available for all 4 nights of our stay. Room 305 has a 'surf view' which is fantastic but beware there is no air-conditioning, only a floor standing fan, which makes a terrible din and the noise of the ocean is loud! It is in desperate need of a silent celing fan- which 408 had- so actually managed to get some sleep in that room!   Room 408 although an 'Ocean View', overlooks an ugly roof and has a noisy water heater on the deck next door which drones on incessantly. The room description does mention the fact you overlook this roof,

Summary Heading: Situated between a busy street and a...
Summary: Situated between a busy street and a parking lot and the ocean. This place has great strengths and major flaws.  The main strength is that half of the property is located on a beautiful terraced bluff directly above and adjoining the beach.  St. Ann'a beach is a nice little beach for swimming, surfing and snorkeling.  The property is near shops and restaurants.  The negatives are so bad they could be a deal breaker.  The property needs a major facelift. Moreover, there was an overwhelmingly horrible stench of toxic cleaning chemicals in most of the common areas, no doubt bad for the environment.  Our room was quite noisy one night.  The place feels like a cheap roadside motel that's been a little updated.  Note, our room overlooked the cramped parking lot, try to get a room on
Manager Response: Thank you to this guest for pointing out the fact that we have great views, are centrally located and family friendly. These parts of the review are quite accurate, and much appreciated.   And yes, as mentioned, we are situated on Pacific Coast Highway, the main travel corridor through town but contrary to the insinuation, this is not a negative.  Every hotel in Laguna Beach from the world famous Montage and on across the board is situated on this same busy street. Four or five  are actually on the ocean side of the street and offer direct beach access from the property, like we do at the Laguna Riviera. Others are on the other side of the street, or do not go all the way to the bluff or do not have direct beach access.   We are not situated between a busy street and a parking lot. We are between the highway and the ocean. We have residential to the north and south and retail across the street. If there was a large parking lot nearby it would be very useful however because of the tight parking situation that exists all over town. I invite anyone to view Google maps to confirm this.  The Laguna Rivier went through a major renovation and upgrade one year ago. Photos may be seen on our website, so contrary to this review, almost everything has been updated from the furniture, carpet, tile, bedding, window coverings and crown moldings to the wall mounted plasma TV's, iPOD clock radios, salt water pool, salt water spa and granite enclosed dual BBQ area overlooking the ocean. We even have more renovations coming soon on the front bluff and walkways once approved by the city.   With regards to noise, we would have responded immediately had the front desk been notified. This is Summer and we have a lot of families visiting and vacationing. They are enjoying themselves as one would expect, and this can create a little festive noise.   With regards to the property wide chemical odor, this is where I must take exception. The only time we experience any type of widespread change to the smell of fresh ocean air is when the tide is very, very low and you can then smell the seaweed and more distinctly the ocean. We use many "Green" cleaning agents including those based on orange oil. We use hypoallergenic detergents and softeners for our linens in consideration of guests who may have a chemical sensitivity. This is Laguna Beach where we have been eating bean sprouts and avocados since the 70's and avoiding toxic cleaning chemicals while doing all we can for the environment. This approach is evidenced in our chlorine free salt water pools, complete conversion to energy efficient lighting, and adopting all measures of water conservation.  If you are looking for a 5 star modern resort, I highly recommend the Montage. It is a stunning property with every imaginable amenity. If you are looking to vacation at an amazing location, in newly renovated rooms, on the ocean at a great price, at a property that has been a part of Laguna Beach culture and history, and in the same family for four generations then you will truly enjoy and appreciate your time at the Laguna Riviera, and we appreciate and look forward to your stay.

Summary: Our family had never been to the coast of CA before and picked Laguna Beach and the Laguna Riviera based on Trip Advisor reviews.  We were not disappointed!  We went during the week and requested an upgrade.  We were upgraded to an awesome room!  The room was recently remodeled and was perfect.  The few times we chatted with staff they were more than helpful.  Leave your beach towels and sand toys at home - they have them.  Pool is perfect for the kids too!  Loved watching the surfers and dolphins in the morning from the balcony.  Free continental breakfast was more than adequate (cereal, oatmeal, danishes, fresh fruit - not served until 8:30 am!)  Had postage stamps available and a computer that we were able to print boarding passes on in the lobby.  Visit the Orange Inn and La

Summary Heading: The perfect beach hotel with charm, location & service.
Summary: We just stayed at the Riviera and had a great time. The location is amazing with views of the ocean and Catalina island. We watched surfers and dolphins in the ocean from our deck. the room was large compared to most hotels and the bedding and furniture was very nice. Alex at the front desk was very helpful and told us that the rooms had just been remodeled in 2009.   We shopped around and even had some friends who live in Laguna personally visit our top 3 choices and I feel what we received at the Riviera was not only the best deal for a property that is actually ocean front and on the beach but they had better rates than one of our possible choices that is on the other side of the road.  A grocery store down the street and walking distance to several fine restaurants and the

Summary Heading: Nice Location, iffy service, room choice is critical
Summary: Just returned from staying at the Laguna Riviera.  We went down to get away from LA as a belated anniversary present to each other.   Stayed in room 409.   Although the hotel web site did specify that we'd be looking out over the 300 rooms roofs, they did not mention the exhaust vent that comes up through the "semi-private" balcony.  This thing would go on and off, loudly, at various times of the day and night.   Relaxing with the doors open, listening to the waves on the beach below, when suddenly this whining vent would start up and drown out the ocean.   It would effect room 408 to a similar degree and 410 to a lesser degree.    It looked like some of the other rooms had better views/privacy but we didn't bother to change as we were only there 2 nights. When I asked the kid
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback on our rooms and service. We have recently undergone a major renovation both aesthetically and environmentally.  It is our goal at the Laguna Riviera to provide a great family vacation experience at the best ocean front prices in Laguna. If you are looking for ocean front value, this is it. Dirt cheap however will not be found in Laguna Beach, and certainly not sitting on the sand overlooking the Pacific Ocean.  The noisy vent in question is indeed from a hot water heater that was recently replaced with the latest eco-friendly model. It includes a special venting system that, was looked at as a result of your call to the office. Maintenance is in contact with the manufacturer to find an appropriate way to further quiet the system.  Being a small family owned property the desk is not manned 24/7 even though staff is available and on-site if needed. To keep the rates more than competitive the office opens at 8:00am and closes at midnight. With that said there is a manager on-site and available whenever needed.  The complementary, free continental breakfast is there for those who chose to partake and includes fresh fruit, packaged fruit, cereals, fresh wrapped pastries, juices and hot fresh coffee & tea. For those looking for a more substantial start to the day, there are many choices from basic to gourmet all within a 1-3 minute walk.  The new high efficiency venting system in question is being addressed now that we are aware that the new eco-hot water system may have a noise issues and I thank you for bringing it to our attention. Our intention was to  upgrade to an environmentally friendly  hot water heater and without such feedback we would not have been aware that it created such an intrusion.  Thank You.

Summary Heading: First time try leaves much to be desired
Summary: The positives are the views and the rooms, very clean and nice. The views are as you can expect on the sand in Laguna. Mother's Day weekend and Friday night we lose water for about 5 hours,no flushing toilets, washing hands, showers, you get the picture. People running and yelling past 2AM on the deck above my pregnant daughter's room, Mgmt either did not care or could not control it. Parking is a problem due to lack of spaces for all the rooms, there aren't enough even if each room parks one car. I had 2 rooms and had to park one car on the street Sat. to Sunday(metered on the street). The continental breakfast is SAD, packaged pastry from a 7-eleven. This could be a great hotel with a little attention to these shortcomings. I have tried many hotels in Laguna through the years
Manager Response: First off, thank you for the compliments on the nice clean rooms and the views. The rooms have been recently remodeled and the views are indeed stunning. We pride ourselves on providing a great family vacation with the best ocean front rates in Laguna.   I'd like to apologize that your stay with us was interrupted by a burst water pipe and unruly guests. Had the front desk been notified of the disturbance we would have addressed the issue immediately. We unfortunately are not able to know what is happening in each room at any given time, and would have dealt with the issue in a prompt manner upon notification.  As you can imagine in any property there are the occasional plumbing issues. We unfortunately experienced a burst pipe that effected a part of the property. An emergency plumbing service was called and the issue corrected as fast as possible. While we are unable to prevent or predict such rare events we do address and remedy them as fast as possible.  We provide parking for 1 car per room which is clearly stated on our website and when booking a room. If a guest brings 2 cars we offer them the opportunity to double park in our lower area or they must park the 2nd car off-site. Like most of Laguna Beach, parking is tight, but we do accommodate one car for every room.   Our continental breakfast is composed of fresh fruits, packaged fruits, juices, cereals, rolls, muffins and plenty of  fresh hot coffee and tea. The State Codes require that we serve "aseptically packaged goods" (wrapped in plastic or otherwise sealed). The baked goods are delivered freshly made and wrapped each week from a local bakery and not from 7-eleven.  This service is provided at no charge. It is complimentary to anyone looking for a nice morning snack. For those looking for something more, there are several excellent breakfast locations, serving everything from protein shakes and organic sandwiches to lobster eggs Benedict within a very short walk of the property.   If this guest would like to contact me directly I'd be more than happy to arrange another stay that I'm certain will have less interruptions so they can thoroughly enjoy all that the Laguna Riviera and our wonderful community of Laguna Beach has to offer.

Summary Heading: About as cool as dolphins and standup paddleboarding.
Summary: What a trip. I'll be back. Thanks. Lots and lots of cool stuff to do.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Views, Great Rooms, Poor Parking
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Laguna Riviera for 2 nights in early April. We were in an ocean front room overlooking the beach and ocean.   The positives: the view from the shared deck in front of the room was awesome; the room appeared to be recently upgraded and was exactly like the pictures on the hotel's website; the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom clean with a large shower, there is a porch-like private area on the shared deck (we didn't use it but it would provide privacy for an evening glass of wine); there are good restaraunts within walking distance - we ate dinner at Hush across the street (good food albeit a little pricey), we tried to walk-in to Zulu which is a block away and highly rated in Trip Advisor but reservations are required; access to the beach and
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice review. You hit on the highlights of location and newly remodeled rooms and our one area that can sometimes become an issue. Parking can be tight that is why staff is not allowed to park on-site when we are near capacity. There is space for 1 car per room and unfortunately that rule is not always followed and people on occasion take more than their allocation. If you are unable to locate a space and it is before midnight the front desk staff will assist and find a solution.  I'm sorry your were forced to park on the street and will take care of the parking ticket. If you have already paid it, please send us a copy otherwise send the ticket and we will take care of it for you.  Kort Pearson Owner/Manager

Summary Heading: Mixed reviews - not a romantic getaway
Summary: I've never stayed at a hotel in Laguna Beach, so we were walking into this blind.  Perhaps my expectations of what I could get for the money were out of line.  We stayed in room 302.  There was an 18 month old running around in the unit above us.  Spring Break partiers were outside on the lawn next to us.  There was free parking, but the parking lot was crammed.  A first impression of the place was not good - sort of messy looking.  Our room did not have a bath - only a shower.  The towels were scratchy, the sheets were just OK.    Yes, once the noise died down we could hear the ocean from our room and there was a path right down to the ocean, but this really was more of a family place and not a romantic getaway - at least not from our perspective.

We were in 101 - the best room in the hotel for the view and privacy. A little tired, shabby chic, very rundowm bathroom and smelled a bit of cats. But you can't beat the view. Watching the surfer-dudes all day, the 6 o'clock sun down, and the sound of the waves all night.  The room has a double fold down bed, very comfy and double sofa bed, not so comfy. We were a little cross the maids wouldn't wash up the few coffeee cups. A nice complimentary breakfast offered coffee, cereals, juice and fruit. The best manicure I've ever had in the place opposite Wholefoods.

Just returned form our stay at the Laguna Riviera. I have to say it was pretty much everything I hoped it would be. The property is obviously older but clean and well maintained. They have done a lot to try to update the rooms and we were over all very happy with our accomodations. We were lucky enough to stay in room 101. The room itself f was plenty big enough for us & the kitchen & large table were a big bonus. The bathroom was  small and the tub/toilet area was a little outdated but was clean. The beds were very comfortable.The best part was the HUGE deck. The only big downside was that there was no sandy area in front of the hotel. Pictures showed a sandy beach. Staff said the recent rain/storms washed away the sand which obviously there is nothing they can do about, but it

My mother and I planned a grown-up vacation together and choose the Laguna Riviera Beach Resort for the price, location and most importantly the beach.  We wanted a no-hassle ocean front room in the heart of Luguna Beach for a reasonable price.  We got exactly what we were looking for plus more at the Riviera.  Granted it is not the Montage however for us it was quite and peaceful and each day there was something new to view oceanside.  We stayed four days in room 101 (excellent choice right over the water) and watched surfers, dolphins, surfboard canoeing, and the most amazing sunsets different each night over Catalina Island in the distance.  The room was large with updated furnishings, the bathroom vanity was updated however the shower was older...but this didn't matter it

Summary Heading: Great Location, Great Value! Wonderful View of Ocean from Room Balcony
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Laguna Riviera in May of 2007. I just now became a member of Trip Advisor so this review is long overdue. I realize many things have probably changed since my visit a few years ago but nonetheless, I wanted to post an honest review. We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights as a little get-away. We are from the Midwest and were visiting my sister who lives close to Los Angeles. We had always wanted to see Laguna so we decided to book a little trip. I was a little skeptical when we arrived at the hotel because it wasn‚Äôt the best looking hotel (compared to some others) but for what we could afford, this was one of the only affordable options. Our room had a nice balcony that overlooked the beach. We had an unobstructed view which was wonderful! I spent a

Summary Heading: Laguna Riviera Beach Bungalow OK, not great
Summary: --The Luguna Riviera Beach Bungalow cost us $575 per day including tax at Christmas.  It was okay for the money, but not a bargain. --When we arrived, a bell boy helped us down to the bungalow from the parking garage.  There are about a dozen relatively steep steps down to the sidewalk to the bungalow, so I wouldn't recommend for anyone with bad knees or hips.  If you're healthy, it's not a problem. --The bungalow has a large metal door that locks.  Then you reach the wooden door to the bungalow.  Almost every wall and celiing in the bungalow has wood paneling.  With the high ceiling in the living room and dining room, it reminded us of a ski chalet. --The view of the ocean from the huge living room window is spectacular.  You can see all the way to Catalina Island.  We could

Summary Heading: Great value for hotel on the beach
Summary: My brother and I stayed 4 days while visiting our uncle. We really enjoyed the beach access and great location. The room (410) was mostly remodeled, comfortable, had a lovely view, and was very clean. The bed and pillows were really good, and the sofa bed wasn't bad as far as sofa beds go. The free continental breakfast (nothing fancy, but well stocked) was good for a quick start to the day. The staff was very friendly and polite, and the night manager who checked us in was absolutly wonderful. She gave us an upgraded room and had amazing restaurant suggestions. I highly recommend K'ya Bistro (about 4 blocks south) and Las Brisas restaurants (just north of the main beach). I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Great central location in Laguna Beach and Southern California. The

Summary Heading: Great stay at a very cool property we will definately return
Summary: We spent just shy of a week at this unique Inn. The room was was very stylish and comfortable. The views were spectacular. We had an ocean front room I believe it was number 303 with a semi-private deck which is where we spent a great deal of time. The bathroom was newly remolded with a very large stone shower with a seating area and heavy glass door.   There was a kitchenette with a microwave, fridge, stove top, and coffee maker.  TV was a nice large plasma. The wireless internet access was free and very fast. I was impressed that they also include parking and a morning snack in the lobby including juice, coffee, cereal, and pastries.   The locating fit our needs perfect. We walked to downtown and all the galleries and restaurants on our to do list.  I'll have to say the

I continue to return to the Laguna Riviera for its terrific oceanfront location, ample ammenities, and friendly staff.  Amazing views, many rooms with kitchens - love that they recently updated the room interiors, but kept the charming exteriors the same. Hands down, it is the best value in Laguna.

I just came back from a 2-day stay at the Laguna Riviera Beach Resort with my wife. Overall, we loved the place and had a wonderful time there!  In my opinion, the Riviera offers the best combination of price, location, and quality in Laguna Beach.  Our room had been remodeled recently: it had a flatscreen TV, nice pillows, new furniture. The bathroom was also recently remodeled and was very nice: with a swanky sink and a glass shower cabin.  From looking at the photos posted here by previous guests, I expected a standard worn-out motel room. Our room turned out to be so much better than what I expected!  The location is great. The beach is 30 yards away. There is a Von's supermarket 1 block away, and a great coffee and breakfast place (The Orange Inn) is also a block away.

My wife and I just returned from our week long stay at the Laguna Riviera. Last year we stayed at the Pacific Edge Hotel and we both seemed to be happier at this hotel. We had an ocean front room with a semi private balcony/deck. The room was decorated with newer amenities and a plasma tv. Great views and couldn't ask for a better location. We were able to walk everywhere for dinner and a short stroll to downtown. We will absolutely be staying at the Laguna Riviera again next year!

Booking through the website is easy and there is good, accurate information there about all the rooms, their facilities and outlooks. My stay did not get off to the best start as I interrupted some sports event on TV so the young man on duty had a conflict for his attention and the game was taking priority, but from then on everything was fine and all of the staff (including him) were pleasant and helpful. The Riviera's location is good: a reasonable walk from town, restaurants, shops and supermarkets and great views over the ocean, perfect for sunsets. Direct access to the beach, down a steep path, and beach chairs are available. The room was spotless and comfortable, with a coffee maker and fridge. Breakfast is provided in Reception: basic but adequate. If you want something

Summary Heading: Our best stay yet..... What a fantastic get-a-way it was for us
Summary: We have just arrived home after another great stay the Laguna Riviera and just wanted to congratulate them on such a wonderful make over. The new rooms are stunning and beautiful.   We were not too bothered by the old d√©cor because we stay at the Riviera for the location, great pricing, and the hospitality of the staff, but what a treat when we arrived this year.  Being retired we avoid the hustle and bustle of the Summer and stay mid September when it still feels like summer and the prices are lower and the traffic more easily navigated.  If you have never stayed we can highly recommend this hotel. It is an eclectic authentic Laguna experience and exemplifies what Laguna is all about.

Summary Heading: Buyer BEWARE ... You may not get what you're expecting!
Summary: It breaks my heart to write this review ... sadly 'tho, I feel compelled to.  After nearly 20 years as loyal guest of the Laguna Riviera (my photo is even on one of their postcards), I feel I have no option but to discontinue my annual visits.  Not because the beautiful Laguna Beach sunsets have changed, but because the accommodations I have booked for all these years have changed drastically.  I have had a great experience in the past, but sometime over the past seven years, the management has changed hands and I have found them to be very inconsiderate and disingenuous.  I have had problems nearly every year since then.  For example, they gave my normally scheduled week to someone else and moved me a week earlier (completely without my approval); last year, they asked me to
Manager Response: Having received a variation of this review some time ago as this guest tried to negotiate a complete refund from us after making use of 2 premium ocean front rooms for 8 days each, in the middle of Summer, I‚Äôm disappointed but not surprised to see it posted.  We simply cannot, and will not, give into such incredible and unwarranted demands. With that said, we did make an extremely generous offer of a 50% refund AND a 1 week stay off-season in our 3 bedroom ocean front beach house (which rents for $600 per night).  One of our standards is fairness, to the guest, but also to us.  We feel we were being more than fair in making the very generous offer to her.  From her point of view, it wasn't enough.  People differ.  From our point of view, we did everything reasonable to accommodate her needs.  Due to real needs of other guests, we were unable to meet her repeated requests for special reserved parking for two vehicles. We regularly reserve preferred parking spots for those who are handicapped, very elderly, or otherwise in need of special assistance.  All parking is within easy access of the rooms and is complimentary. While this guest is quite able bodied we still accommodated the best we could, and gave her one reserved parking spot for her entire stay.   This guest never called and asked me if there were any upgrades or changes to the property. But even so, I have apologized both verbally and in writing that she was not notified of all upgrades and renovations in advance of her arrival.   This guest chose to stay and make full use of the property, its‚Äô open decks, ocean views, and accommodations even though they live only 30 minutes away, and even though we had other rooms available, as did all of the properties in town due to the unfortunate current economic conditions. There were plenty of options including the Sunset Cove Villas or the Surf and Sand as she has mentioned. But, I must make one correction, while they do face the same ocean; their rooms start at twice the price of ours.   I will not take time addressing all the complaints this guest has such as concrete decks, (They are in fact not concrete. They are wood coated in commercial grade non-slip decking material, and have been for years), or hand railings repaired with tape that I must ask, how would that even work? I will instead, they are vacant, shoot and post some pictures of the rooms in question 302 & 303 in the accommodations section of our website and leave it to those reading to decide if they are to your taste and are suitable for your vacationing needs, because in the end that is the reason you are reading this.  The founder of The Laguna Riviera Beach Resort always adhered to the principles of honesty, fairness, and the highest standards of hospitality.  And, as I said, the best vacation experience a family can have.  As his grandson, I am devoted to maintaining those standards. Clearly it is not possible to please everyone, even after spending over a million dollars on new furniture, upgrades and renovation, as is evidenced here, and some people just don‚Äôt like change, but I believe the multitude of positive reviews we receive, reflect the true feelings of the vast majority of those who regularly vacation and enjoy their stay with us here at the Laguna Riviera.   Happy travels to all,  Kort Pearson

Summary: We stayed in a surf view room just steps to the beach, which was not crowded at all when I walked down in the morning to enjoy my cup of coffee while watching the morning surfers.  The room was very spacious and comfortable with modern decor.  The view of the coast and also Catalina Island in the distance surrounded by a gorgeous sunset was just spectacular!    We walked downtown to the restaurants and shops and then strolled up the beach back to the hotel.  The experience was just so serene and peaceful.  Truly relaxing!  We would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Summary Heading: Laguna Riviera Makeover - WOW! WOW! WOW! (Did I say WOW?)
Summary: We have been coming to the Riviera almost every year for a summer retreat  for at least 16 years. We have always enjoyed the great location on the beach and the close proximity to downtown. In all that time we saw no real changes or renovations and were worried that our favorite hide away was wearing away.  Well when we arrived this year we were blown away. In a good way. Wow wow wow what a great transformation and face-lift. the ready to retire decor of the 70's has been replaced with beautiful relaxing furniture made of richly colored solid wood and no longer Formica laminated particle board. Gone are the blue or green rooms. They have been replaced with relaxing neutral tones clearly influenced by the natural surroundings of sand, stone, and shells found in front of the hotel

Summary Heading: Best bargain - best stay - on the California, or French or Italian, Riviera.
Summary: My stay was so very good.  The location is the best in Laguna.  I've been on the French, Italian, Spanish, and Greek Riviera coasts, Laguna is the best there is.  This hotel (The Laguna Riviera) is the best spot in Laguna.  Also the best bargain - probably 20 - 30% lower than most other ocean front properties.  A great staff, good rooms, a nice friendly (family friendly atmosphere). The buildings are old - like Vacation Village and Surf & Sand, but well kept up.  They do as well as can be expected with what they have to work with.   Close to town.  I walk everywhere.  I leave the car at the hotel.

We stayed in #516 which was clean and roomy for three people.  The view was good but other units closer to the beach had a better view.  The location in town was perfect.  It's in the thick of shopping and restaurants. Pool area was near the street and wasn't attractive but you're really there for the beach, right?   Continental breakfast was the normal hotel fare, coffee, cereal and packaged pastries.

Summary Heading: Sh! Quit telling people how great this hotel is!!
Summary: We love this hotel. I hesitate to write a review, as reservations are already hard to get. We stay here any time we can get in. Our first stay was over 15 years ago.  It is eclectic, and wonderful.

This was our second stay at Laguna Riviera.  Just as the first time, we couldn't ask for anything more.   I don't understand the negative reviews for this location.  It is made clear by other reviews that this is not a posh 5 star resort.   If you want a spa, gym, overpriced dining room and want to pay to park your car, then please go pay their prices and stay there.  If you want a nice family owned, peaceful place to chill out and enjoy incredible views, then stay here.  There is a grocery store and anywhere you could want to eat within walking distance.  Sit on the balcony, have a glass of wine and watch the sunset, then fall asleep to the sound of the surf.  Sounds like vacation to me.

Summary Heading: Best Value in Laguna Beach (shhhh, don't tell anyone)
Summary: I have been coming to the LR for about 50 years -- learned to swim here, met my future husband on a date here while staying with my aunts, brought my children here and grandchildren here.
