Yes, it is that good.  Over the years we have experienced the tiredness that some have mentioned.  Yes, it is quircky in a loveable Laguna Beach way, but we just can't seem to consider another location (and we've looked).  Last year it looked particularly worn and sad. But we brightened up when we were assured that a new renovation was in progress and were able to see a "mock-up" room.  It was fabulous.  Can't wait to see what is in store in October when all the work is done.

Summary Heading: Excellent location, beautiful sunsets, comfortable accomodations
Summary: We had a magnificent stay at the Laguna Riviera.  Just steps down to the west is the pacific ocean, complete with stunning sunsets.  Walk north and you'll  find yourself in charming downtown Laguna Beach.  Venture anywhere around the hotel and you come upon unique shops, terrific restaurants, and opportunities to hear live music.  Stay at the Laguna Riviera and you'll enjoy a great room connected to the outdoors and beautiful Laguna Beach.  We enjoyed our stay so much that we'll be back in May.

On very short notice, right before spring break, I call the Laguna Riviera and asked about accommodations.  I was serviced immediately and I was given a room with a commanding view of the ocean.  Very clean , modern amenities and a very delightful staff.  I will be returning to Laguna Riviera Beach Resort whenever I am able to get to Laguna Beach.

I do not understand how this seaside oasis could get a bad review.  My cousin flew in from St. Louis for a week and she asked me if we could spend most of our time at the ocean (I live in San Diego).  So, I did much research to find the perfect place for us to spend a few days.  I finally decided on the Riviera and I'm very glad I did.  We just got back last night 3/25/09 and it was amazing!  Our room was clean and perfect.  We had a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen which enabled us to cook and prepare breakfast, lunch and dinner.  We parked the car and it stayed in the same spot until we left.  Our deck over looked the ocean with stunning views up the coast.  We practically lived on the deck watching the surfers, a sea lion or two and the pod of dolphins that came to visit

Summary Heading: Awesome Views at a Bargain Price
Summary: I have stayed in several rooms at the Laguna Riviera over the years including 101,  201, 301, 305, 410, 508 and most recently 515.  I was reading a previous review from a "CapeTownFriend" giving my personal favorite hotel a 2 rating for some knd of buzz sound.  That review has prompted me to set the scene in the proper light and post my first review on Tripadvisor.    Well, I'm sorry but the truth is that I stayed in the same room, 515 one week ago for 3 nights, Thursday, Friday & Saturday, while visiting Laguna for a birthday party.  The room had just been newly renovated (nice), all new amenities, etc..  The only sound that I heard at night,  except for the occasional guest returning from dinner was the ocean.   I found the staff to be very accomodating and the manager Mr.

I came despite the bad reviews.  I asked Kort Pearson to send pictures, which he did, of the remodeled rooms.  They are fine.  The balcony was beautiful.  The Wi-Fi was great, though a bit spotty at 4 AM (I will explain why I was up at that hour in a minute). The location is lovely.  Here are the major downsides.  First, when I checked in, the woman who checked me in delayed speaking to me for a couple of minutes because she was peering outside at the black man who was standing and waiting for the bus.  Finally, as she checked me in, she told me she was suspicious about this person because he was loitering.    Second, in Room 515, and perhaps in the rest of the building, there is a humming sound that goes on at night, too fast even to be soothing, really quite loud, and
Manager Response: First off, thank you for saying the rooms are fine, the balcony is beautiful and the WiFi is great. It seams that the issue is a buzzing sound that occurs at night and inaccurate information from the front desk.  I have spent the last several days trying to identify or even hear the buzz described. This is not saying it's not there, my hearing is not that great. Due to the fact this reviewer experienced it at night and it stopped during the day, perhaps it's a failing street light. I have asked our current guests to see if they have the same experience and if they can identify the sound. If they hear it, and it is a street light we will contact SCE to remedy the situation. If it can be identified and its on our property it will be taken care of.  I appreciate being notified of such annoyances because without customer feedback we cannot address issues that are not readily apparent to management or staff.  Our policy while renovation is underway is no heavy noise prior to 9:00am. The workers are on site earlier and are instructed to involve themselves in painting and prep work that should not disrupt the guests. We have clearly posted on the main web page and at the check in desk that such work is underway and regret that it prevented this guest from having less than a perfect stay.  Knowing that renovation would be occurring during this winter season we kept all rates for the entire season lower than scheduled to offset short term issues that always  arise while building long term improvements. This guest took the time to request pictures which I supplied, had they shared their less than perfect stay with me, we would have taken every measure to make sure things were made right.   The Laguna Riviera has been in business for 62 years and we take pride in delivering a great vacation experience to all our guests. We extend our sincerest apologies that we missed the mark with this guest.

Summary: I can only say that when I arrived and saw the moldy, tired room that was billed as "Surf View", I was ready to drive back  to Los Angeles.  It was that bad.   I should have realized this when we pulled into the parking lot .   First, recognize that this is really a roadside motel, not a resort, not even a regular hotel, just a barely renovated motel whose one salient factor is the ocean view.  When you visit the website, you won't see any pictures suggesting the dank reality of the situation.    Skip this place -- it's an overpriced dump!
Manager Response: I am very disappointed by this review and for several reasons, suspect it is not even written by a real guest, but if it is I'll make a generous offer at the end of my response.   We are in the middle of a  renovation, making major upgrades investing in the comfort and travel experience for our guests. While all rooms are not yet complete, we expect most if not all to be done by June 1 when we kick off the summer season. If you visit our website, pictures will begin to be posted mid March so you can see first hand what we are up to. The multitude of glowing reviews we have earned were pre-renovation so rest assured that once we are done the rooms & facilities will be even better.  Now for the offer; If indeed this is a legitimate complaint we wish to make it right. Our goal is to always deliver great service and accommodations at a reasonable price. If this reviewer contacts me and can confirm their stay in a Surf View room I will extend a complimentary stay for the same number of days in a newly renovated room or perhaps our ocean front 3 bedroom beach house and to sweeten the deal include dinner for two at a local restaurant. All I ask is that if after the complimentary stay, they feel differently they share it here for all to see on TripAdvisor.  Kort Pearson Owner/Manager

Summary: This "resort" looks very nice and clean from the photos but is the most horrible place we have ever been. Although it has been awhile since we went there, it is still a joke between my husband and I. Upon check in, it was raining very hard and we had no idea where to park. The woman inside at the desk was cranky and spoke to us like we were morons. The parking is tight and sparse. I asked her about the ping pong tables they had and she said she was missing a paddle so we couldn't play. Our room was really small, old and filthy. There were stains on the curtains and the carpet was stained as well. Our "balcony" overlooked some type of metal roofing that was rusted and dirty. The whole balcony and surroundings were rusty or had chipping paint. That is probably what we noticed the
Manager Response: When I see fabricated reviews I sometimes wonder if they should even be dignified with a response. None the less I feel compelled to set the record straight. Nothing from this review rings true and I find it curious that the stay is said to have occurred March 2006, nearly 3 years ago. We do not even have a steel roof as suggested in the review.  I am not sure if this is written by a newcomer to the local hotel business trying to up their rankings, a disgruntled employee, or a guest who has simply written mistakenly about another property. In any event the facts are, not only is the property in great condition we are in the midst of a major million dollar plus investment, upgrading the rooms and grounds in order to exceed our guests best expectations.  The website at this point is dated. The rooms are better than depicted, as is the complete property and associated amenities. If you are concerned with the inflammatory allegations of this misplaced review and would like pictures of your room or the grounds as they are when you make the request, please let me know. I will be more than happy to supply current date stamped photos to immediately discredit the fraudulent allegations of this unfortunate review.  The multitude of positive reviews show the true character of the Laguna Riviera. Please feel free to contact me with any questions or for any additional information or photos of the property that may help you make the best choice for you Laguna Beach Vacation.  Happy travels Kort Pearson Manager / Owner

Summary Heading: Gorgeous Hotel on the Beach Near Downtown
Summary: From the minute I walked into the lobby to the day I checked out I felt like a special guest of this very comfortable beach resort.  The room was recently remodeled and much classier than I expected. The grounds were immaculate and some of the murals painted by a once resident Laguna Beach artist made it feel like a real beach town hotel.   Nicely manicured tropical landscaping and parking was no problem.  The Laguna Riviera Beach Resort was a true find.

My husband and I went for our annual anniversary trip and this time we stayed at Laguna Riviera.  We had a room with a private deck and that is where we spent most of our time.  The view was amazing.  There were surfers right under our room, the sound of the waves crashing was really relaxing.  The sunset was lovely.  The room?  Well, after pulled our murphy bed out of the wall at night, it was a little cramped, but like I said, we loved spending our time out on our deck with a book and good company.  The bathroom had rust and cracked tile and I'm not sure why they don't just do a little basic cover up repair (I'm sure some rust remover would do wonders in that sink) but the rates are so cheap, maybe thats the answer why. It was a $500 a night view for $200 a night, so we'll be
Manager Response: Thanks for the wonderful and accurate review.   We are listening to everyone, online and off,  as a result  the Laguna Riviera is undergoing major room and facility renovations and upgrades to be completed before Summer 2009.  The rooms are being taken to a new level and the finished product will be up to par with the great location and the never ending ocean views.  Over the next few days I will upload some pictures of the first room to be completed. This will give everyone an early look at the beautiful, luxurious and comfortable upgrades our guest will soon be enjoying.  Our thanks to all of the feedback and great suggestions.

Summary: We had two different rooms during our stay 512 and 302. The first one did not have a deck and was really run down(512). The second room had a great ocean front deck and was a much nicer room. Neither room had AC which we thought was a problem. While it was great to leave the windows open and listen to the ocean, you could also here people socializing until late at night. This hotel is really all about the views and decks, it is a 2 star property in an incredible location. One problem that we found is that many guests invite friends and family to visit, which can make the hotel feel more crowded and add to the late night outdoor chat sessions. We would definitely return to this place but only if we could get a room with a private deck. Laguna Beach is an amazing location, we

I stayed for the weekend with my family, and found the room to be a weird mix of upscale amenities and problems I would expect in a one or two star hotel.  The sofa had tape covering what I assume were holes, and the bed was extremely uncomfortable.  We also had trouble sleeping due to parties next door on both nights.   On the upside, we had a lovely private balcony and a view of the water, and the hotel provided robes, beach chairs, and beach umbrellas.

We are a family of 5 and booked into room 516 at the Riviera.  After reading some of the reviews I was slightly unsure if this would be one of those Hotels you check-in, then after seeing the room check-out. The reviews written regarding this Hotel do prepare you for the fact that this is NOT a Big Box Hotel/Motel chain, it's family run and therefore not a sterile environment. Our room was huge with a great kitchen area and plenty of storage space.  Room 516 is listed as an Ocean View room, however because the room is on the side of the building you do get a partial Surf View...don't tell the owners.  There is a inside deck area that was perfect for drying off the swimsuits etc.  The outside deck is private, and roomy enough. I agree that a fresh coat of interior paint and some

Summary Heading: Our best stay yet at the Riviera
Summary: This was our 3rd and so far best stay at this wonderful hidden gem in Laguna Beach. The rooms are fresh and clean, the views are unbelievable, and the staff was friendly, helpful, and attentive.   From our room and deck we could watch the dolphins in the morning, surfers in the afternoon and blazing sunsets in the evening. It reminds me of the tip of Baja without the heat. The weather was great with just the right heat tempered by the ocean breezes it was unbelievably relaxing.  We did our usually run through the art galleries, picked up some fresh fruit at the farmers market and tried a new restaurant just south of the hotel called Saphire. It's the old Pottery Shack renovated into a new shopping area. The restaurant has outdoor seating and we followed it up with a drink across

i LOVE this hotel... i know some of the reviews talk about it being a little run down.. and it is true the rooms could use a little updating. but come on now you are on a vacation at the beach, how much time to you really need to be spending in your rooms complaining about the way it looks.   the views were amazing, its so close to the beach that even with a non ocean view room i fell asleep to the sounds of the ocean every night.   it is within walking distance of down town laguna which has restaraunts for every taste imaginable. (its about a mile) its nice to walk out along the beach and enjoy the AMAZING sunsets  the staff was nice, i asked a couple stupid questions but they were very nice to me the entire time  parking is a little difficult but you can make do... especially

I booked into the Laguna Riviera through my travel agent. I told her I wanted a hotel in Laguna on the ocean that reflected the local culture and community and I wanted a reasonable price. Time to give her credit, she delivered in aces.  I was in Southern California from Michigan on business. I had several meetings to attend over the course of a week in Orange County and Los Angeles. I thought using Laguna Beach as my base of operations would work well and make it feel more like a working vacation. When I pulled up to the Riviera it looked rather ordinary, but once I parked and made my way to the ocean side of the property the views blew me away. On my first look out over the ocean I saw a pod of dolphins migrating and just watched until they were no longer visible. That was the

I read all the reviews of this place and booked my stay more than a month in advance of my arrival. After booking some reviews showed up that  caused me a great deal of concern--especially the one from the guest who checked out after less than six hours. Since I often rely on this website and have found the reviews to be very accurate I was unsure of what to do. My arrival was to be late in the evening after a east coast to west coast flight. I knew I would be tired and not willing to deal with locating another hotel at that time of the evening. After much consternation I decided to stick with the reservation. I had already changed my location once from a popular chain hotel inland where I have stayed previously with pleasant results. The appeal of this place from the earlier

Like the recent reviews, out family walked away from the Laguna Riviera with mixed feelings.Our family of four had different agendas.My twelve year old son wanted to surf, the seventeen year old girl wanted to walk around and shop, my husband needed and TV and a hot tub, and I wanted to be surf side at a reasonable rate. My son rented a board and a wet suit from a surf shop two blocks away. When he needed a break, he brought the board up the beech access and left the board on our deck . This was really handy. He loved the indoor pool! My daughter and her friend walked a few long blocks and explored the cute little shops, My husband liked the proximity to Ralph's, the grocery store. We took several long strolls through the neighborhood on search of restaurants, which proved very

I feel obligated to post my bad feelings about this place as a service to other readers, because I don't want others to be misled about this place like I was by the crazy reviews here that have made this place appear to a Laguna Beach beginner like me to be the third best property in Laguna Beach.  I also want to note that the web site this hotel operates is very spiffy and again very misrepresentative of the place and seems to show lots of view without lots of what the rooms actually look like - take note of that.  I can't fathom who these people are who are writing these glowing reviews and why they are misleading people like this, but anyway, onwards with my task...  So, booked our surf view room, I think that's what they call it, the one that's the highest up, was expecting

Summary Heading: Acording to my daughter this place is the Awsomenest
Summary: My husband and I along with our daughter stayed for a week in September and had a great time. Our daughter is 6 and described our vacation and stay at the Riviera as the most awsomenest time she's had. That may not be a real word but describes the property well.  The hotel has a great location and the staff is pleasant and helpful. The decor, is simple and clean. I'd call it a well maintained Laguna classic. It's been around for over 50 years according to a regular we visited with. It seems that no two rooms are alike and I think some are outfitted with significant upgrades. While our room had a regular 25 in tv we passed a room with a large private deck and noticed they had a very large plasma tv and a fireplace.  We had a surf view room with a private balcony that offered us

Summary Heading: Great hospitality and compassion for fire evacuees AAA+++
Summary: We were recently evacuated from Fallbrook due to the firestorms and were fortunate to find the Riviera. While other hotels closer to us along PCH were increasing rates to take advantage of the situation, the Riviera offered fire evacuees a nice discount and allowed us to bring our animals which under other circumstances would not have been allowed.   When we arrived the place was full and they were cleaning and reopening rooms that had been closed for upgrades and off season maintanance.  The front desk staff was very helpful and showed genuine concern for our situation and made every effort to help us feel at home.   We had never stayed at the Riviera before and I have never written a review before, but I can tell you they made us feel very welcome and went above and beyond to

just got back from 3 day stay , booked last minute as had to change location due to california fires. This motel need serious updating.The furniture is out of date and shabby, such a shame as it has a perfect location for surf watching, beach access and close to all shops and restaurants. the breakfast was very poor, fortunately good places nearby to sit and have a delicious breakfast. The owners of this place need to give the place a lick of paint and get some clean carpets and better furniture.

Great place to stay in Laguna Beach , California.  Located right on the beach, close to downtown,  and down the street from Ralph's grocery store.  Hotel workers and staff were very friendly and helpfull. Please be patient with the parking (Which is free), and there is free trolley shuttle service to all of the Laguna locations on Coastal Hwy durning the main seasons.  If you are use to 5 star service and prices I would reccomend staying at a differen't place.  This resort is a true laid back California beach resort - Relax and enjoy!!!  My family and I will  continue to stay at the Laguna Riviera Resort for many years to come if the service and rates  remain true to the California beach vacation.

Summary Heading: What a place what a town we will be back
Summary: We booked our stay almost a year in advance so we could get 2 weeks. This under the recomendation of my father in law and the reviews here. I don't normally write reviews but I just want to give two thumbs up to this property.   We had a wonderful stay, enjoyed beautiful sunsets, saw dolphins and surfers. All very beautiful and breathtaking.  Our room was cozy with a breathtaking view and a fireplace. The public patio and BBQ area is a great location to meet other guests, and to view the beach activities.  The rates for this on the water hotel were a bargain. The town is vibrant, very busy, and has many art gallerys and shops not to mention the Art Festival and the Sawdust Festival that run through the summer.  So we give the Laguna Riviera two thumbs up. The employees

Summary Heading: Best trip yet to Laguna Beach
Summary: The Laguna Riviera made our trip our favorite yet to Laguna. We used to stay down the street and just recently discovered what we were missing.  The rates are great. The views are the best and the staff was so friendly and helpfull. The room had a private deck a kitchen and a seperate bedroom all for less than a non-view across the street. The pool while not outdoors has a roof that opens to the sun. Of course if the sun is out your better off on the beach.  And... the beach is the BEST in Laguna great surf and cool people.   The room was very retro and cool and just enhanced the whole beach experience. Great food is everywhere and within walking distance the city tram is freeeeee so leave the car parked (and parking is a premium if you want to be upstairs) no they don't charge

Summary Heading: Wonderful experience at this special unique beach front property
Summary: Upon the suggestion of friends who frequent the Riviera we booked a week to start off our Summer. The hotel has lots of charming qualities that you dont find in the big chains. There was something for everyone, our two children loved the pool, game room, and of course the beach. My wife and I could not get enough of the amazing beach and ocean views from our private deck. We spent most of our time on the deck, or the beach just taking in the sun, views and beach scene.  Evenings were spectaular as the sun set behind Catalina Island and we enjoyed a cocktail or 2. Diner in Laguna is only limited by your tastes. There is something for everyone and every place we tried was spot on. Two of the nights we cooked at the Riviera on the BBQ overlooking the beach. It was great fun and the

We booked this hotel by calling directly and got a great rate ($149 a night for a one queen bedroom and a queen sofa bed) only a week before we arrived.  We stayed in suite 401 and it had wonderful ocean views. The suite was old but had newer windows and everything worked just fine. The full kitchen was great for my family and it had everything we needed for meals. It was very clean and the housekeeping staff were very accommodating and friendly.  Vince at the front desk was super friendly and helpful and even remembered my first name each time he saw me.  The sunsets are to die for and only a two minute walk down to the beach made it a great vacation for myself, my husband and two small kids.  We were there in the off season and while I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel, I

This hotel had a plaque on the wall that said something like 'Man cannot be both comfortable and grand' and this sums up the hotel exactly.  This isn't the Ritz but I don't think I have been in a more comfortable hotel.  The rooms were very comfortable with some that had incredible views of the ocean.  They provided many amenities that made the stay very comfortable.  They had beach towels and alot of beach toys that you could check out along with a pool, jacuzzi, and game room.  The courtyard had a fabulous deck to watch the sunset from chaise lounges and had a well-appointed barbeque that you could reserve for the night.  We went to the supermarket across the street, picked up some wine and cheese and had a great quiet night on the deck watching the sunset.  I would

Stayed at Laguna Riveria February 2007 and enjoyed our stay there , it is not like the Montage but location, and price is everything. We found the rooms suitable for our stay and had no problems at all. We had view of the Ocean which was very nice and to listen to the waves crashing at night was wonderful Great sunset at night looking over the ocean.  Its a short stroll to the main shops and streets and cafes, loved the feel and location of the hotel,  restaurants and cafes are close by and are reasonably priced. With some great deals enjoyed our time at Laguna Beach and would go back anytime    Across the road is a 24hr supermarket where you can grab what you need and a bus stop out the front as well. Would stay there again for sure. Hop on the bus to Newport Beach not far away

Summary Heading: Love Laguna but, would not stay here again
Summary: If you could ignore someone else's hair in your bathtub and dead bugs on the wall, you might be okay staying here.    True, the place is old and needs renovation, but I could overlook that if I felt the place was super clean.  However, I did not find that to be true.   My husband said on several occassions that the staff was rude to him at the counter, except for one younger gentleman when he went to ask for some reccomendations, check- in and check-out.  Yes, the location is INCREDIBLE.  It is right on the beach and a short walk to the center of town.  We will be back in Laguna soon, but we won't be staying here.

The Laguna Riviera Beach Resort has a 1950s feel, is basic and  clean, comfortable and friendly.  We were able to sit on a private balcony overlooking the ocean for less than $160 a night which is fantastic for that area.  Food and shopping in walking distance.    That said I would not recommend this for families with children under 5 or anyone with physical limitations.  There were too many steep areas and fall hazards.  For others it would be great.  Beach is clean and fun.

Stayed 2 nights in March 2007. Room 404. Paying the extra cost for this surf-view room was worth every penny .  The Laguna is a little dated but has a great beach-house ambience which it would lose if everything was brand new. It was very clean and had all the amenities required for a very pleasant stay. This particular suite is very large and has both an outside deck and an enclosed "sunroom" which is especially great if you are going in the off season when the mornings and evenings are cool. Great location---park the car and walk anyplace in town. I would highly recommend this hotel. I'm hoping to return with my husband but it would also be a perfect location for a family vacation or girl's weekend retreat.

My wife and I came here for our honeymoon in 2001 on the recommendation of friends, and have been back every year since. The rooms are nice, and yes, some are small, and if you want more than a continental breakfast you will want to go to one of the great restaurants close by like Roadhouse Rubys just down the road. I love to sit on the patio with my coffee and listen to the surf, watch the early morning surfers, or occasionally be treated to dolphins swimming by. No, it's not the Ritz (also just down the Pacific Coast Hwy) but if that's what you are looking for then by all means stay there! We have always had a wonderful time, and it's the highlight of the year. If you want a low-key, relaxing stay, visit the Riviera. Otherwise, leave this fantastic place for us, because it's a

Our party of 4 adults stayed at Laguna Riviera in the beach bungalow for 2 nights in Mar, for $400 per night.  As always, we had a wonderful trip overall and enjoyed relaxing and playing on the beach, dining and strolling through town. The accommodations at Laguna Rivera is older, like many of the other beachside lodging, and can use some updating and better maintenance.   Pros:  -Beach front. The sand is only a couple of flights of stairs away from the bungalow. The views and sounds of the ocean is prominent from our unit. The living room has a big picture window facing the beach.  There is a tiny deck with a beach view too. The location and views are the best part of our unit. - Near shops, restaurants and galleries. Ralphs's supermarket is right across the street. Our unit

Summary Heading: Would highly recommend the Laguna Riviera!
Summary: I was highly satistfied with the Laguna Riviera and would stay there again and recommend it to others.  I was looking for an affordable hotel on the beach and thanks to the good tripadvisor reviews, I chose the Laguna Riviera.  The hotel website provides good descriptions and a physical layout of the hotel, so you can pick the best room for your interest and budget.  The Laguna Riviera is set-up in motel fashion and decorated with handpainted murals.   The view of the ocean and beach, visible from many rooms and numerous public decks, is gorgeous.  The rooms, while they could use some updating, are simple, clean and comfortable.  A basic  breakfast of cereal, fruit, yogurt, and baked goods in included and can be enjoyed on any of the public decks viewing the beach.  The staff

We just returned from 5 days in Laguna Beach.  We stayed at the Laguna Riviera Beach Resort.  My husband and I had a great time.    The Laguna Riviera is an older property.  Perhaps some of you would like a more sterile - no character - approach to Hotel/Motel stays...I say "that's rubbish!"  Yes the Laguna Riv may have it's bumps and bruises, but you cannot beat it's ocean views and the privacy you'll experience while you are there.    We stayed in room #306, a Surf View room.  It was fantastic.  The bed was extremely comfortable -- and this is coming from a woman with severe back problems.  The efficiency kitchen was great. We had a micro, little fridge, sink, dishes, glasses...the works.  Great to keep your Margarita fixin's handy for an evenings coctail on the patio!    The

Summary Heading: Location, Value, Service we had the time of our life
Summary: We chose this hotel based on price and location and the reviews here on trip advisor. I was not sure exactly what to expect since it is an older property and we have stayed at several such properties on prior trips to Laguna but the Riviera was just wonderful and  I was pleasantly surprised.  The views are amazing and the weather was unbelievable with Santana Winds (warm breezes blowing in from the desert) it fealt like summer. We spent a great deal of our time simply relaxing on our surf view deck reading, relaxing and wearing shorts it was the best.   The prices were what I would put in the budget category. Less than $150 on a weekend with a private deck facing the ocean. The room was very clean and there seemed to be a lot of renovation going on. Our room has been recently

After reading all previous reviews I didn't really expect much from this hotel even though it is rated #3 in Laguna Beach. We stayed in a room 510 with partial ocean view. I am not  a good writer so I'll just list my points: Bed was fairly comfortable. TV is small (though I didn't really care for it) Acoustics is pretty bad so you'll hear everybody walking on those wooden stairways. I was surprised by the shower design - it looks like an odd elevator cabin. You'll feel claustrophobic in it. And there was mold growing on a trim! There's a gas heater in a room - it seem to take a while to heat up. They have breakfast from 8:30 to 10:30 - basic stuff: tea, coffee, pkg cereal.  I might be wrong but I think it only makes sense to get oceanview rooms here. Great view will offset all

We stayed here over the christmas weekend, we have stayed at the property one other time. The view for the price is absolutely great. Book early for one of the ocean front rooms. What ruined our experience was the rude service of the front desk personel. Our drive in took 6 hrs due to traffice, we arrived around 1am, instead of a welcome to the hotel, we were scolded for arriving too late. On one of the nights we had a 3 guest come up to see our room, as we passed the front desk the "older lady" that checked us in, made a reference that we should not have guest over. In all we loved the place, however once person can ruin the experience. With us it was the older lady that seemed to not realize that this is a hotel ie. people check in late and they may have guests over to visit.

Summary Heading: Budget accomodations but not safe for little ones
Summary: We read all the reviews before booking this hotel and it was indeed a beautiful location- right on the beach.  We woke up to the sound of the surf, saw the outstanding sunsets from our balcony, and enjoyed watching surfers all day long.    Our only concern was that we have a 16 month old and this just wasn't the safest place for small children.  The balcony has huge gaps between the boards on the railing, whereas most newer hotels on the beach have plexiglass or some  type of guard installed.  We used the heater in the mornings and it is like the size of a full length mirror in the wall and gets very hot to the touch.  There are cleaning supplies kept under the sink.  Metal chips came off the shower faucet every time you  turned on the water.   There is no way to deadbolt the

Summary Heading: Our first of many stays to come.
Summary: We have been returning to Laguna Beach since 1987 once or twice per year and had never tried the cute hotel with the pool out front. We usually stay at one of several properties that fit our budget including the Vacation Village. Unfortunately they have changed hands, increased rates, let the rooms fall apart and now charge for parking.  We visited the hotel (the Laguna Riviera) in early 06' for a walk through to see what it was all about and were pleasantly surprised after walking through the upper parking lot to see that the hotel has a beautiful view overlooking the ocean and a wonderful public space facing the ocean that we never suspected existed, each time we drove by on the highway side. We wish we took the time to check this place out years ago. We had no idea what we

I was so disappointed with this hotel!  After doing much research on TripAdvisor I chose this.  I admit the location is great, but the hotel is badly in need of renovation.  It's a dump!  I couldn't believe the peeling paint.  Our closet looked dirty with chipped paint all around the perimeter.   On our entire trip through California, this was by far the worst hotel.   Thankfully we only stayed here one night.  I was also disppointed that the continental breakfast doesn't start until 8:30am.  We had an early morning ferry to Catalina to catch, so we ended up having to go elsewhere and pay for breakfast.    I would have rather stayed at a hotel across the street from the beach.  You can still walk to the beach to view the sunset, but at least you would have a nicer room.

We might not have stayed in the BEST room ('cause they were booked), but even though the description of the room said "Garden/street view", we could still see the water and we sat outside in the courtyard at sunset.  It was beautiful.  We will definately stay there again, hopefully for a longer time and with some friends.  It really is a wonderful find in Laguna.

Summary Heading: We had a fantastic time at the Laguna Riviera
Summary: We had a spectacular stay at the Riviera. The location, staff, and atmospere are all spot on. Food and activities are within walking distance and the beach and weather were beautiful. I truly think that Fall is one of the most beautiful and comfortable times in Laguna.   We can't wait to return.

After reading the reviews, my daughter and I and some friends decided to stay at the Laguna Riviera Beach Resort and we had a GREAT time.   This is not the Ritz no frills here.  It is however a great location and a great hotel. Imagine a hotel that was built in the 1950's built for comfort and style at that time. It looks as if renovations are happening though room by room.  My girlfriend and I walked on the beach every morning, while the kids were sleeping. And we ate our complimentary breakfast  while watching the surfers and enjoying the morning sun.  There are a variety of rooms to choose from. Some with private patios, and some with surf views, and some with ocean and partial ocean views. We had a partial view in room 511, and it was wonderful. It also had a kitchenette,

Summary Heading: Like owning your own beach house
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Laguna Rivera from 9/1/06-9/7/06.  We booked directly via the property and stayed in room 503.  Room 503 accomodates 2 people, has a full kitchen, Queen bed and bathroom with shower stall only.  It was fine for us but it would have been worth the extra money to have an ocean view room with balcony.  Luckily, this property has a nice outdoor seating area that overlooks the ocean and we were able to sit there.  It's available to any guest.  This is a family owned property with many repeat guests.  The rooms are not fancy but they're comfortable. The full kitchen was nice to have.  We did dine out every evening but did eat breakfast and lunch in our room often.  The property provides a very basic continental breakfast that includes coffee, juices,

Summary Heading: Love Laguna Love the Riviera it's laid back, great location, great prople
Summary: I just checked out last week and had the time of my life. We stayed for 10 days in a ocean view unit with a private ocean view deck and paid less than $180 a night. The Best Western we checked with is not on the ocean and only had a studio non-view left for over $250 a night. So with that said it's a bargain. The location is great and the staff was fun and informative. I don't get the last review at all... BTW it's Laguna not L_u_guna.  We thought the staff was great. Relaxed and their fun attitudes helped us relax and get into "Vacation Mode". They seemed to live and encourage the vacation atmosphere. Sure they arent dressed in monkey suits and kissing up to me all the time, but they were helpful and had great ideas when we wanted to know what to do, where to go, and whats

First time on California Coast! LAGUNA RIVIERA HOTEL...Only disappoinment of the entire trip!! I was told it was a hotel resort, when in fact it's a run down motel. Room was run down and in much need of repair. Staff was not very professional!!

I have stayed at the Laguna Rivera many many times throughout my life. I have always found it to be an amazing place to stay. It is directly above the beach with a private walking path to get down, it's in a great location, close to everything Laguna and it's gorgeous. The murals on the walls provide for a great atmosphere and the rooms are beautiful. This particular time we went for my mother's 50th birthday party and the large decks on the ocean view rooms provided a great entertainment space for my large irish family after her party. This place even has barbeques you can use. There is a great pool and jacuzzi and game room that I used to always frequent when I was a lot younger. The breakfast's are great, the coffee is good, and the atmosphere is genuine. This is a favorite

Summary Heading: The sweet spot in Laguna Beach Hotels
Summary: After studying all of the various reviews for Laguna Hotels we chose and recently stayed at the Riviera so I would like to offer my thoughts. I loved the hotel for all kinds of reasons and will try and explain using several key points. Since the reviews here are all over the place this may be useful to others like me when trying to consider all of the available options and desciding what is and is not important for your situation.  1) Location is arguably the best in the entire town. It‚Äôs not too close or too far away from downtown. It‚Äôs close enough to walk to within a few minutes by beach or sidewalk. The hotel is right on the beach a market is down the street and food service and surf shops are everywhere.  2) Pricing is also the best I found in town when the location is

Summary Heading: The best hotel on the beach
Summary: The rooms were clean, the best location in the middle of everything that matters, the beach was clean.  I had the best time of my life in Laguna and I give the hotel  100% credit for making it a memorable visit ....  thanks for everything

Summary Heading: This place ---....you can do better someplace else!!
Summary: The best part of this motel is its location.....just a short walk to the beach but the office staff kills it. They were very rude when asked even a simple question. The breakfast in the lobby is a joke, small boxes of cereal, day old danish and smelly fruit. If you just want a place close to the beach and the center of town then go ahead but don't expect any type of good service from the staff. I'd rather pay a little more next time and stay in a nicer place. There are many motels in Laguna so do yourself a favor and check around a little before you pick this one as a last resort. Oh and the best part, our room had major plumbing problems. Ah, good times, not.

I stayed at the Laguna Riviera with my family and we rented the beach bungalow between us making it very affordable.    It was the most fantastic location, we looked out of the living room window directly at the ocean and all it encompassed, surfers, dolphins, sea lions and pelicans and great sun sets.  The beach was just one flight of stairs away.  The bungalow was extreemely well equiped with a full kitchen and enough china to serve 12 people it was also furnished to a high standard and the beds were very comfortable.  There was not only a washer and dryer but the detergent and softner was also provided and as we had been travelling a couple of weeks before we arrived here this was very usefull.  Local Supermarket was within walking distance so it was easy to self cater, (join

Summary Heading: Not impressed at all with people working there
Summary: I think I've been waiting a year to write this!  My husband and I had gone to this hotel April 29, 2005.  It had come highly recommended.  We had been going thru some extremely difficult times with family illness, and had booked the hotel months previous.  We were SO looking forward to getting there!  That was part of our problem, our flight from Denver arrived in the morning...we thought, no big deal, we'll see about check in, knowing we probably COULDN"T before afternoon.  On arrival, it appeared that we were intruding on the personnel's time...we were treated like we shouldn't have been there.  I remember thinking, we're PAYING for this, and we're being treated terribly.  The staff, including the manager on duty acted like we were out of place, and not wanted...of course, we

Summary Heading: Can't wait to go back to the Laguna Riviera.
Summary: This is the second time we stayed at the Laguna Riviera.  This time, we were in Room 303 and then moved to Room 201.  What a wonderful place.  The staff is terrific, but not intrusive.  The location is spectacular.  Rooms are mediium sized, and a little funky but nice.  The rooms we were in had a small fridge, microwave, sink and coffee maker.  And then there's the view....INCREDIBLE!  This is not the place for you if you want room service or a gym on site.  This is where you go if you truly want to relax and take in the ocean and just be.  It's a short walk to all the shopping in Laguna Beach, and right on the PCH.  We love it there, and can't wait to go back.

I'd give this hotel 4 points because of the location on the beach and close to the tourist shopping, on top of very reasonable prices. The rooms are not sparkling, but for the money, ours was decent and do-able. Parking is free and there is a normal continental breakfast.  But I'm goinv this 3 points because of the poor service. Sour people who weren't at all interested in the fact that I was a guest. When I asked for directions, one receptionist wouldn't even get up from her seat, which was a distance from the front desk, to talk to me. When I asked her to show me something on the map that I had, she looked annoyed. Now, I'm a pleasant person, so it's not as though I had alienated them with any aggressiveness or demanding demeanor. They were just consistently disinterested. The

Can't wait to return. We came to Laguna for a family reunion and were fortunate enough to locate a room at this hotel. My cousin who lives in the area made the recomendation and if your looking for value and location with insane views this is the best in Laguna. I know there are fancier places but they are way too expensive. We stopped by the Montage were my very succesful uncle parted with over $1,200 a night for his room. Yes it was beautiful but I spent less than half of his nightly rate for 3 nights within walking distance of the  downtown area, looking at the same ocean and had a closer view. We thought the rooms, location, public spaces and staff were all great. We will be back.

We were in Laguna Beach to attend the wedding of a good friend and wanted to stay in an ocean-view hotel without paying dearly.  This hotel epitomizes the phrase that "you get what you pay for".  The website and surprisingly, many of the reviews I read, make this facility out to be a gem.  I can unequivocally state that it is not.  I cannot emphasize how shocked I was when we got there.  The rooms were well worn, outdated and void of any charm.  The hallways were often very dark and frequently festooned with ridiculous amateurish painted murals, chipped paint on railings, old carpet, mildew smells, and an overall ambience of yuck.  I can't understand the positive reviews of this place.  Maybe these are folks who are not used to staying at the beach and were so wowed by the ocean

Summary Heading: Even off season we loved it
Summary: We were guests of the Riviera mid February and just loved it. The location, staff, beach, and weather were all spot on. As other reviews have pointed out this is not a new property but it is a unique boutique with all the comfort and ambiance we needed and a real bargain which left us enough in our winter vacation budget to have some first class dinners. One feature of note is the water pressure. I have stayed at so many hotels with wimpy water pressure, but at the Riviera it was every bit as good as back home. I just felt comfortable, at home and plan on returning at the next available opportunity. If all goes well it will be this summer.

It was out first time we stayed in Laguna Beach, usually we stay with friends. This time we wanted to be near downtown and experience the Laguna nightlife. We are so glad we did! My wife and I had such a wonderful time with our friends. The nightlife has something for everyone! We were able to walk down to the center of town and back with no problems. Do be careful though when crossing Pacific Coast Highway, the cars don‚Äôt slow down very often.   The other guests staying at the hotel were just as friendly. It wasn‚Äôt out of the ordinary to strike up a conversation with other guests in the morning who were waiting for breakfast in the lobby. Laguna Beach has wonderful coffee shops and little diners that serve fantastic breakfast burritos, within a couple blocks of the hotel, a

Summary Heading: Summer in January it was an enjoyable and memorable experience.
Summary: We can reccomend the Riviera to any traveler looking for a great place to stay at reasonable prices. After using a few online services to help us make a choice, we selected the Riviera and it lived up to all of our expectations. It is a fun classic feeling beach front hotel. At home We look at snow this time of year so being able to watch the sun set and wave crashing while wearing shorts was a welcome change. We were told that the weather was unseasonably warm and that it is not unusual to have rain in January and February so maybe we just got lucky. Never the less, we loved it. The rooms were very comfortable and the service was friendly and helpful. The center of town is a short stroll to the north, the beach is in front of the hotel and you get to it by walking down the

If you're looking for a beach front dive hotel, this is your place. If you're looking for comfort or romance, keep looking! The decor and the bedding haven't been changed in decades. The ocean front suites are some of the worst and they have a very strong mildew smell. If you want a cheap place where kids couldn't hurt a thing this hotel may be okay for you.

Summary Heading: Charming property, terrific weather, we look forward to returning
Summary: Having stayed recently at the Laguna Riviera I can highly recommend it to travelers on a budget, those looking for a great experience, travelers with kids, and or even those just looking for a cool boutique type of property. Don't misunderstand, this is no Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons, but it is right on the beach very well maintained extremely charming and very relaxing. The staff seamed to be made up of locals who knew the town and were always able to suggest something for us to do or a restaurant to try.  We stayed in a ocean front room with a nice private balcony for less than $150 per night. The weather was like summer; however the ocean was to cold for us to swim. January is winter in Southern California, being from Florida we are spoiled with year round warm water. An

In July of this year my girls 14 and 16 stayed the Laguana Riveria it was a  clean hotel.  Being on a budget this hotel was perfect for the 3 of us. I liked that it was located on the beach but getting up and down from the beach was not an easy task. Very steep walkway, but I found the shrubs and flowers on the walkway-- breathtakingly Beautiful !! The towels were quite thin and too few of them being that we were on and off the beach several times a day. I did not find the staff to be overly anixous to assist with questions but they were corridal. The hotel was within walking distance of shops,grocery stores and restaurants so the rental car was parked most of the time. All and all I would rate this hotel as average--and I would stay there again... due to the location and the

We stayed two nights at the Laguna Riviera. I knew that it had received high marks by other guest but I was very pleased by first impressions of the property. It's a older Hotel but everything, interior/exterior/retaining walls all were freshly painted. Our two rooms were well equipped, clean and comfortable. I don't think you could be any closer to the surf. Falling to sleep with the crashing waves in the background was a treat. Service was very good. The staff was polite and the complimentry breakfest, while somewhat limited, was still tasty and filling. Both of our rooms were surf view so I can't provide conditions on the ocean view or street front rooms. The only con was a smallish parking lot but wasn't a real problem since all the cities attractions are within walking

We stayed at the Laguna Riviera for a weekend.  The motel is as described--sort of a 50's style, with updated features (cable TV, wireless internet, for example.)  We had one of the smallest, cheapest rooms, which was quite adequate for our family of 3.  It was very clean but the walls are showing their age (rot along a bathtub base). We really liked the murals on the exterior walls and the sea wall down by the beach. You have to walk down a brick walkway to get to the beach, which is fair sized, but not real big.  It's OK for boogie boarding/surfing, but not a great place for body surfing --there are large stones on the bottom of the ocean which hurt your feet.  The best beach is about 6 blocks north (Main Beach) which is larger, has 4 beach volleyball courts (available every

Summary Heading: We had a great time and look forward to returning
Summary: Our family had a very special time staying at this property. It is quaint, well maintained and directly on the shore. The rates, according to our research, are certainly better than the other locations we considered. The kids had the time of their lives playing in the surf and swimming while the wife and I enjoyed the sun, shops, galleries and exhibitions in town. Being peak season the property was sold out every day we were there and parking was very tight but somehow the desk staff was always able to find something for us in one of their three parking areas.   Our daughter was particularly delighted when she met a cast member of the MTV show ‚ÄúLaguna Beach‚Äù at a shop right next door. We felt very comfortable with the accommodations and the staff of the Riviera. I was struck by

Summary Heading: Second visit will be the last!
Summary: Our first visit to the Riveria was very nice. We enjoyed our room (509) with a side ocean view and got a kick out of the 1950's era feel of the motel. We selected a different room and made reservations to return to the motel a few weeks later for another visit.....what a mistake that was, we should have quit with our good memories! For our second visit we arrived a little before 2pm and told the desk girl we were a little early for check in but would sit and enjoy the sun in the lawn area. She told us that our room would be ready in a few minutes anyway. I returned to see about checking in after 4 and was told the room was not ready yet. When I mentioned that it was after the check in time she told me "Check in time is 4 or later" so basically the room could be ready at 4 "or

Summary Heading: Great time, great place, great location, very Laguna
Summary: What a great place. We stayed for just over a week, 10 days to be exact and loved every one of them. Laguna is a place that, after you leave, you just want to go back. We have been vacationing on and off in Laguna Beach since the early 80s. The town is easy going with creativity and a casual air about it and the Riviera mimics that feeling. It's been in Laguna so long that it feels like part of the Laguna experience. We stayed in a comfortable surprisingly large Ocean View room on the top floor. In the morning we would pick up our coffee, and breakfast snacks in the office, take them back to the room and watch the morning waves roll in from our deck.    The room was clean and comfortable not real modern, but not terribly dated either. You do see some wear and tear from being on

Having read the reviews and all the pros and cons we decided to give the Laguna Riviera a shot and are we glad we did. The beach is stunning and the waves were perfect for both surfing and boogie boarding. The hotel itself is full of charm and has a great feel to it. Sure as some have mentioned the decor may be a tad dated, but the place is clean comfortable and very well preserved. The five of us stayed in a side view room for about $130 a night. Even at the price we could still see the ocean. A couple of the nights we reserved the BBQ on the front patio and cooked up steaks and salmon which we ate while watching the surfers taking their last rides of the day. The local tram which is free picked us up right out front for a nice tour of Laguna that ended at the festival grounds

Having read all the positive reviews we looked forward towards our stay at this property.  We were shocked at what can only be described at its state of complete disrepair.   Their own brochure describes the hotel as "posh" but it is far from it.  The paint is peeling; there are trim and soffetts that need replacing; the owners are clearly not investing anything back into the physical condition of the property. The description of this hotel as  aging  is accurate.  The brochure indicates that it is an air conditioned hotel.  However, only a small number of rooms are actually air conditioned; and despite what you are told about not needing a/c you need it even at night during the summer.  The website tour is completely misleading unless you happen to stay in one of the few rooms
Manager Response: The guest in question checked in on a Friday evening. Upon seeing our notice advising guests that there may be construction going on next door he became very agitated and argumentative with our desk manager because he had not been given advance notice of possible construction. Unable to calm the guest, the desk manager contacted me at home while having dinner with the family. I could hear the guest berating the desk manager in the background and instead of accepting my call; he insisted I call him in his room. Upon doing so he did not answer so a message was left explaining that we have no control over the activities next door, but that they have been relatively quiet since they are only excavating at this point. In addition since it was a Friday there would be no construction over the weekend. If any additional information was needed the desk knows how to contact me. Understandably, I do not give my home number out.  Had this guest chosen to stay for the 3 nights booked he would have heard no noise what so ever from the construction site as they did not work on Monday and are not allowed to work on the weekends. The room the guest stayed in is an Ocean View not a Surf View room. In this room you do look across a roof top to a clear view of the open ocean.  A Surf View room can see the open ocean and the breaking waves. This information along with which rooms have A/C and all other pertinent information is clearly disclosed on our website and room grid sent with all confirmations.  With regards to the peeling paint, the property was repainted November 2004 and is very well maintained. We consistently strive to make all of our guests as safe and comfortable as possible while offering a tremendous value. I believe that is why we get so many favorable reviews online and in the mail from our many satisfied guests. Unfortunately, in the case of this guest, we were unable to meet his needs and for that we are regretful.

Summary Heading: Had a blast great location, good rooms, fun & friendly place
Summary: We enjoyed our stay very much. Check in was smooth and easy room was simple, clean and comfortable. Views were spectacular. My husband and I had planned this weekend retreat months ago and are looking forward to returning we had such a great time. The staff was helpful, printed us a map to an antique shop we wanted to visit in another town, made excellent suggestions when we asked where to eat and offered up no charge beach chairs and umbrella when we went to the beach. We found the rates and views to be some of the best in Laguna.

Summary Heading: Great deal, not so sweet attitude
Summary: This ranking should be taken in context-- the Laguna Riviera is an Inexpensive Beachfront Motel. Given these factors (capitalized for emphasis), it is certainly above average. The only thing that dragged it down, for us, was the staff.  The first time I called, I was told they had nothing for the two consecutive days we wanted to stay. But the tripadvisor reviews were so glowing that I called back to ask to be put on a waiting list; a different woman told me they could give us a non-view suite for the first night for v. cheap and a ocean-view for the second night, also reasonably cheap. While I was satisfied with this arrangement (it actually worked out quite well), the inflexibility/non-creativity of the first person with whom I spoke turned out to be representative of the

we were thrilled with this place  right on the beach  fantastic views breakfast including fruit  great friendly staff   big rooms  paper in the morning  bus stop out the front  ralphs supermarket across the road and walk in to town  not a huge place so book ahead  we loved it   brissy couple, australia

Summary Heading: If you can get in and can do without the glitz this is for you
Summary: We were on a waiting list and when the call came that a cancellation had made room for us we put a stop on our back up reservation at another hotel. The Riviera offers fantastic views, unbelievable rates, and a loctation close to restaurants, the town and of course the beach which is only a short walk down their private pathway. Rooms feel like their from the 70's but are very clean and comfortable.  The room had all we needed, coffee maker, fridge, microwave, TV, iron w/board and so on plus they have free beach chairs and umbrellas, in the office.  Parking is free although the upper main area only has a few spaces and it seems the regulars have them reserved, but if you use the underground or side parking it's not an issue.  The employees are all friendly and helpful, they even

We read many reviews and didn't know where to stay and we are glad we picked Laguna Riviera, especialy for the price.  Just down the street is the Surf and Sand hotel and it looks nice, but is very pricing and it's the same beach.  The Laguna has a good basic continential breakfast...many choices of cereal, juice, danish, ect. All high carb, but the kids the husband got enough to eat. The pool was nice and warm and the rooms was clean.  The rooms are older and run down a bit, but the hotel is not new....so I expected it to be of lower quality.  We would return since it's nice and close to the main beach, clean, friendly staff and the price you can't beat!  I am really glad we picked the Laguna Beach area, I think it was much nicer than the Huntington Beach area....which was also

Summary Heading: Looking for just what we needed and the Riviera delivered
Summary: We just returned from a great stay at the LRBR and had a wonderful time. The room was comfortable and spacious with a view that made me never want to leave. The bed was comfortable with a nice down comforter and the bathrobes were nicer than we have at home. The staff was warm and friendly, and every restaurant they sent us to was excellent. They suggested we try a little place around the corner called Zuloo Cafe and they had the best sworfish I've ever tasted. Once parked we simply walked everywhere we were interested in and with the beach was right out our front door we were set.   Some highlights of our trip 1) Evening cocktails on our deck as the sun set. 2) Morning walk on the beach to the downtown area where we picked up a Starbucks and window shopped. 3) Using the sauna

I have stayed at The Laguna Riviera Beach Resort a few times over the past few years.  Overall I would give the experience a B.  Of course you get what you pay for as well.  All rooms are pretty different.  I have been in like five of them.  The best room I stayed in just happend to be the least expensive.  It was a one bedroom apartment with a full kitchen.  If you are looking for super nice you want get it.  It is pretty clean and you have the usual stuff like a bed, TV and a enclosed pool.  The thing that draws me to the place is the parking which is pretty good, can walk to pretty much everything and the beach is straight down.  Overall you should have a good experience.  The thing you must be patience with is getting your room.  If you want to get in before the 3 or 4 check

We were able to get a 1 bedroom partial ocean view for $100.  That's something.  And it had a little kitchenette which was also nice.  As far as the "free parking" goes, the number of available spots is very limited and we were only able to get a spot 1 of the 4 times we had to park.  The rest of the time we had to park on the street in a meterred spot.  The POSITIVES: Good location.  Great little back terrace with beautiful flowers, a public bbq grill and nice ocean views.  Free continental beakfast - nothing fancy but decent enough.  The NEGATIVES:  Pretty dingy property.  Very old uncomfortable bouncy mattress.  Not much privacy.  The service was not very good - they seemed almost resentful about having to answer questions about the area, etc.  Bathroom is not well designed -

Summary Heading: Will return to the Laguna Riviera - someday.
Summary: The Laguna Riviera was custom-made for a spring break trip for my 14-year-old daughter and me. We enjoyed everything about it because our expectations were of an ‚Äúolder family-run resort‚Äù. My husband hates ‚Äúolder family-run resorts‚Äù, much like some previous reviewers. He would have bolted the second day for the nearest Marriott like some previous reviewers. I‚Äôd also like to point out that I‚Äôve stayed at many, many beach resorts, and the ones that are right on the beach like this one tend to show the effects of the wind, salt and sand, regardless of price. People like my husband who travel frequently usually know this and stay further from the sand and wind. The reason it was so perfect for us was the location, right on the beach and easy walking distance to shopping and

Summary Heading: Comfortable Hotel for a Great Price
Summary: I spent one night at the Laguna Riviera last week with my girlfriend (we are both in our mid-20s), and I must say that the hotel offers outstanding value, views and proximity to the main streets of Laguna Beach.  Of course, this is no 4-star hotel.  It feels much more like an aging beach-front motel from yesteryear.  That being said, our room was very clean, the bed was very comfortable, and the shower had great water pressure.  I woke up to a magnificent view of the Pacific Ocean from my bed.    A couple of other notes.  We originally booked a room with a "Surf View" for one night.  When we called to extend the reservation to two nights, they told us that the only other "Surf View" room that they had was a "Grand Family Suite," which also turned out to be the most expensive and

Summary Heading: I Disagree with both March 17th and 21st.
Summary: We stayed at this property recently and I am shocked to read inaccurate reviews from some spiteful real or fake vacationers. We spent last summer vacation in Laguna Beach and chose the Riviera based on the suggestion of friends who had visited in the past. It is very nice, very clean and very friendly. Our room was comfortable and the views were to die for. The property is classic Laguna artsy with hand painted murals and a nice beach cottage feel. The free breakfast was your typical continental consisting of juices, fruits, hot/cold cereals, rolls, muffins, coffee, assorted teas, and milk. There are several restaurants nearby for those looking for a more substantial meal. Our two boys loved the beach and the game room. We are planning this years summer family vacation so I am

I totally agree with Review dated March 17th 2005.  They too must of been mislead to the Oceanview Room #408.  When I made my reservations for the LRBR in December I was told Room #408 w/ ocean view would accomodate my husband, 16th year old daughter and myself.  In order to fit the roll away bed in this small space- we had to move furniture to the Lanai (porch).  One night was ENOUGH of this place.  I too believe the past EXCELLENT Tripadvisor Reviews to be a hoax. When we arrived we were greeted with a less than friendly welcome.  We were not contacted by the front desk when our delayed baggage arrived from the airport- and in the meantime made needless calls until 2:00 AM to United baggage at SNA. The same warm soul that "greeted" us when we arrived at the hotel- was the same

This is definitely a below average, run-down, motel-like place. The walls of the rooms are almost non-existent. You hear doors slamming all night long (to slam the doors is the only way to shut them because they are broken somehow). We paid about $ 140 per night and expected at least an average room. But what we got was comparable to a Motel 6 room that has not been refurnished for decades. The "ocean view" was more like a "roof view" with a little blue in the back which could be the ocean - hard to tell from the distance. The staff was not friendly at all and the breakfast which was included - let's not talk about it. I would not recommend staying here. The Beach Village two blocks away seemed to be a much nicer alternative - although I can't tell for sure because I didn't see

Summary Heading: The Laguna Riviera made fans out of us
Summary: The Laguna Riviera has a unique charm and allure that will keep us coming back. We stayed recently partly because of the reviews we read and partly due to the recommendation of a business associate. The Riviera is a comfortable property with a relaxed and friendly staff.    It is close to everything in Laguna, food, fun and the downtown galleries & shops. We were lucky enough to have great weather in February and even saw a whale breach as we enjoyed our coffee on the front patio. As others have mentioned, the rates are a bargain and the views ... well you just have to see for yourself..... Amazing.   Since we stayed in winter the ocean was too cold, but we were still able to walk on the sand and enjoy the experience. The rooms are nice, clean, and each one is different with a

The location of this hotel is beachfront and close to art galleries, shops and restaurants of downtown Laguna Beach. I rated this a five in the base of price, location and service. The staff were very friendly and accomodating. It's a family owned hotel, and you get that type of atmosphere when staying here.  We enjoyed our room, the sunsets, the sounds of crashing waves, and being able to walk directly to the beach from our hotel. Where else can you get an oceanview room for $120/night in Laguna Beach where land here cost in the millions, especailly right next to the beach? Yes, it's not luxurious, but it's comfortable, and if you want to spend $$$$, then go to the Montage or Ritz Carlton. Don't expect to compare these hotels.

My wife and I had no reservations and were looking for a place to stay in Laguna Beach for one evening.  The usual policy of the Laguna Riviera requires a two night minimum, however, they were kind enough to let us stay there for one night and even got us into our room early in the day.  The rooms are definitely dated, but for the price what an unbelievable value.  The cost for our room was around $140 with tax and had a lovely ocean view and nice balcony.  You could hear the ocean all night and we felt safe leaving our door open to hear the ocean and enjoy the ocean breeze.  There were surfers, a beautiful sunset and a short walk to all downtown Laguna Beach has to offer.  For the price this place was perfect.

Summary Heading: We can't wait to return to the Riviera
Summary: We love the Riviera and have stayed there many times over the years. It has a lot of character and is a beautiful property. As some have mentioned the furnishings are a bit dated, but while we were staying we learned that several upgrades are in the works. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the furnishings are in good shape, just not reflective of more modern styling. We rented a 1 bedroom suite with a wonderful ocean view for about $130 per night.  The blending of value, location and comfort cannot be matched in Laguna. There are less expensive properties, but they have no views and in many cases are very run down. There are lots of more expensive choices, but I cant see spending 4 - 10 times as much just to get room service and some fancy designer appointed room with

I had almost booked a room in advance at the Laguna Riviera based on the comments in Trip Advisor, but wasn't quite sure when we'd be arriving in Laguna.  I'm happy that I looked at the room when we arrived because I was shocked at the condition.  The furniture is terribly outdated and everything needs a coat of paint.  The AAA gives this hotel a 2 star rating and it's accurate.  Needless to say, we moved on and stayed at the Ariso Creek, which is not on the beach, but very nice.  If you're only concerned about a cheap place on the beach though, then by all means, stay here.

Summary Heading: Authentic not glamerous a real deal and real Laguna
Summary: Like another review says, the Riviera doesnt have a lot of "Glam" but, I'll tell you it does have a lot of "Fam" as in family appeal. It's a real orginal with a classic Laguna charm. The rooms are large for the most part and quite nice. The rooms are actually very nice and clean even if the furniture may be a bit dated. Our room had a good size television with built in dvd and vcr. I don't think these have been installed in all of the rooms, since my sons room had a regular 27" TV, so if this is an important feature for you ask when making your reservation. Our room had a large deck with expansive views and a fireplace which came in handy, we fired it up while staying in watching a massive rain storm pass through. If your looking for a real Laguna experience this is the place.

I can only imagine the high 5* reviews are only due to one thing, PRICE.  I stayed here based on reviews on this site.  I admit, the price is attractive but, you get what you pay for.  With the 'ritzy' hotels running upward to $300+ night, the Laguna Riv. is a bargain.  But, this is a NO FRILLS hotel.   I had a room with a nice ocean view but, in such a big room, they could do more.  The couch, decor, and bathroom looked 'old'.  My first thought was the decor was upgraded in the late 60's or 70's and nothing has been done since.  The room had a very small 13" TV with a remote control held together by tape.  There was also a small fridge in the room which was cool as a grocery store is across to street.  On check-in we heard loud 'booming' noises for several hours like someone

A visit to family for Thanksgiving brought us to Laguna and our online research helped us choose the Laguna Riviera Beach Resort for our stay. It was a great value, cost less than we expected to pay for an ocean front hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful and the location perfect. When we return to Laguna we look forward to staying again.

Summary Heading: To quote Californias' Governator, "I'll be back"
Summary: Unbelievable views and atmosphere is what we experienced staying at this fun boutique property. Some places just feel warm and welcoming like going to a friends home and that is what we felt as we walked out to the Rivieras ocean front patio to watch dolphins migrating north. This is not a fancy place, but it's a comfortable place that is warm, friendly, clean and very very relaxing. It reminds me more of a B&B than a hotel and our room was more like a small apartment than a hotel room. I'm used to a coffee maker, but can't recall ever having a fireplace in my hotel room or cooking facilities. The weather was spectacular,warm, breezy & clear.. much better that I would have thought for November. This is definately a place for the vacationing family or a nice romantic weekend.

Spent 2 nights in mid october, ocean view room, location easy to get to, right on the PCH, parking spot availiable for each room, 10 mins walking distance back to shops in laguna beach on road or on the beach, easy access to the beack which is a great beach to walk on.  Room had 2 beds, kitchen, own outside seating area.  Friendly staff, and in room internet availiable for an additional ¬£9.95 a night. Could do with a bit of fresh paint, but then thats always the case with a ocean side hotel.  Would go back and stay longer.

Summary Heading: Recommended by Laguna Locals and We I loved the stay.
Summary: Our friends who have lived in Laguna since the 60's suggested we stay at the Laguna Riviera while we spent a week visiting them and the town. What a great recommendation. The views were so nice our friends came to visit us more than we went to their home. Our evenings spent sharing the ocean views, sunsets, fine wine and good conversation with our dear friends on our expansive private deck made for some unforgettable memories.   The property is one of Laguna‚Äôs original hotels and I must say has aged very gracefully. It has been well maintained, and offered a cozy feel. You can feel the history of the town walking the mural covered hallways and looking through the photo albums in the lobby. We felt very much at home with the property and the staff, who when asked, can offer up

We stayed at the Riviera Beach Resort for a week in August.  It is right on the PCH across the street from the beach.  The RBR is a great resort community - not too big, not terribly fancy but just what you want at the beach.  We had a one bedroomed apartment which also had a double sofa bed in the living room.  The kitchen was very good - all you could need.  Best of all was the very large balcony which had a gas grill and faced directly out to sea, over the beach.  We cooked out many of our nights there and enjoyed the views.  Most nights people would be bbqing on the beach around the fire pits and it was an interesting sight.  They all have to leave by 10pm so there is no noise problem.  The resort has 2 pools, a good gym and games room.  There is a restaurant - small - open

Summary Heading: Our Family had a great time
Summary: We had a summer vacation to remember at the Riviera. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the continental breakfast better than usual and the indoor pool was perfect for our youngest while her older brothers rode the waves at the beach. The 5 of us had a great time and frankly the rates are a bargain.

I'll keep this short, but feel I should let others know that I find inspiration when relaxing at the Riv. I have a high-pressure gig as a screenwriter and find this place perfect for getting my creative juices going. The property and town represent the epitome of what makes an artist community. I have just returned from completing another project, and must admit that my muse lives in the sounds I hear in the crashing waves as I watch the sun set at this truly laid back, original Laguna Beach, establishment.

Summary Heading: Unique, Fun, and BEAUTIFUL what a terrific time we had
Summary: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful vacation to Laguna Beach and just want to share how special we felt staying at the Riviera. Upon checking in we were given free passes to the local Festival of Arts. They were because we used our Amex card to pay the deposit. Then we get to our room to find a bottle of champagne on ice and two glasses. We mentioned we were coming for our anniversary, but never expected this nice surprise or the kind note.   The property is located right on the ocean with breathtaking views and private beach access, it is a well maintained older property with architecture that reminds me of the Mediterranean with flowers everywhere, a nice break from the hotels we stay in while traveling for my husbands company.  When the desk attendant noticed my

Summary Heading: Beautiful Location and Authentic Local Laguna Experience
Summary: As an avid world traveler I try to find local flavor wherever I go. I avoid the stacked cracker boxes ala Hilton in favor of secret hide a ways that let me experience the true flavor and ambiance of the local community. The Laguna Riviera in Laguna Beach does just that. It is in a beautiful beach front location where you walk out your door down a garden terrace right onto one of the most beautiful beaches in Southern California. The staff is relaxed and fun the property is still owned and managed by members of the same family who built the hotel in 1948. They know the city over and under and can direct you to the best restaurant, or surf breaks around. If you want to get the real flavor of this unique and amazing artist community I can‚Äôt imagine paying a fortune for the
